Tom Blouin

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Tom Blouin is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Blouin focuses on developing and deepening BXCI’s overall relationships with private equity firms and other borrowers and originating, structuring and executing private investments across a diverse range of industries.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2024, Mr. Blouin spent over 20 years at Barclays/Lehman Brothers, most recently as Co-Head of Global Leveraged Finance, a member of Barclays Capital Markets Management Team and Co-Chair of Barclays non-investment grade commitment committee. During his time at Barclays he led the team responsible for the origination, structuring and execution of Leveraged Loans and High Yield Securities across a wide range of industries for the firm’s corporate and financial sponsor clients.

Mr. Blouin graduated with a BS in Finance and Business Administration from Georgetown University and earned his MBA at the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College.

Jonathan Bock

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Jonathan Bock is a Senior Managing Director and the Co-CEO of Blackstone Private Credit Fund (BCRED) and Blackstone Secured Lending Fund (BXSL), and Global Head of Market Research for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Bock was the Chief Executive Officer of Barings Business Development Companies (BDCs). In addition to this role, he served as the Co-Chief Executive Officer and President of Barings Private Credit Corporation, and Chief Financial Officer of Barings Capital Investment Corporation, Barings Corporate Investors, and Barings Participation Investors. Prior to joining Barings in July 2018, Mr. Bock was a Managing Director and Senior Equity Analyst at Wells Fargo Securities specializing in BDCs. He was the chief author of a leading BDC quarterly research publication: the BDC Scorecard. He is also published in the Journal of Alternative Investments. Prior to Wells Fargo, Mr. Bock followed the BDC industry at Stifel Nicolaus & Company and A.G. Edwards Inc. Prior to entering sell-side research in 2006, Mr. Bock was an equity portfolio manager/analyst at Busey Wealth Management in Champaign, Illinois.

Mr. Bock holds a BS in Finance from the University of Illinois College of Business and is a member of the CFA Institute. 

Ellen Bogard

Managing Director

Corporate Affairs - Hong Kong

Ellen Bogard is a Managing Director overseeing Asia-Pacific Public Affairs and Government Relations in Blackstone’s Hong Kong office. She serves as a primary spokesperson and government relations representative for the firm across Asia.

Ms. Bogard has more than 15 years of experience across corporate, political, government and consulting work. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Bogard led the Corporate/Financial Practice at Ogilvy Public Relations in Hong Kong. She has extensive PR experience in Asia and in the United States, having previously served as Director for Corporate and Internal Communications at Anheuser-Busch InBev and as a senior account lead at leading PR firm Fleishman-Hillard. Prior to that, Ms. Bogard held a variety of roles in government and politics, including Campaign Manager, Communications Director, and Legislative Director for local, state and U.S. Senate campaigns, as well as for labor and consumer rights organizations in her home state of Missouri.

Ms. Bogard received her BA in political science from the University of Missouri-Columbia.

Toula Bougiamas

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Panayiota (Toula) K. Bougiamas is a Managing Director and the Chief Compliance Officer of Blackstone Credit in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Toula served for 18 years in the SEC's Division of Enforcement in the New York Regional Office, conducting all facets of complex investigations and litigation involving the federal securities laws. For seven years, Toula served as an Assistant Regional Director of the Asset Management Unit, supervising a group of attorneys and industry experts on matters pertaining to the asset management industry. Before joining the SEC, Toula served as a judicial law clerk in the U.S. Court of International Trade.

She received her BS from Cornell University and her JD from Brooklyn Law School, where she was a member of the Brooklyn Law Review and Editor of the Second Circuit Review.

Dr. Brettman is a member of the Board of Directors of Praxis Precision Medicines, a startup in genetically defined neuropsychiatric disorders.

Dr. Brettman received his M.D. from Duke University and his AB in History and Science from Harvard College. While a medical student, he was a Sarnoff Cardiovascular Research Foundation Fellow at Stanford University, where he studied angiogenesis

Mark Burton

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. Burton was a Managing Director at H/2 Capital Partners, an institutional investment manager focused on commercial real estate credit. While at H/2, he led the sourcing, pricing and execution of the firm’s distressed commercial mortgage opportunities in the U.S. and Europe. Mr. Burton served as a member of the Management Committee and Investment Committee for each of H/2’s investment funds. Prior to that, Mr. Burton worked at Goldman Sachs where he was a Vice President in their Special Situations Group, overseeing domestic commercial real estate investing. He also co-managed Goldman’s Real Estate Mezzanine Partners, a fund focused on originating and purchasing commercial real estate, secured mortgages, securities, mezzanine loans and preferred equity.

Managing Director

He is involved in financial evaluation, benchmarking, and modeling of health plan performance optimization for existing and prospective portfolio investments including benefit design alternatives, clinical programming and innovation partner opportunities.

Prior to Unum, Mr. Camire operated his own health actuarial and healthcare reform consulting practice supporting payer, provider, employer and government clients in navigating the risks and opportunities of the rapidly evolving health system dynamics. Bob Carroll

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Bob Carroll is a Managing Director and Head of Distressed Trading with Blackstone Credit. He oversees all trading activity relating to Blackstone Credit’s expansive public distressed efforts. Mr. Carroll joined Blackstone from hedgefund Smith Cove Capital, where he had been responsible for all trading activity since 2016. Prior to that, he spent 10 years at Perry Capital as Head of Trading. Previously, Mr. Carroll was a trader at Litespeed Partners and Imperial Capital. Mr. Carroll received a BS in Communications from Norwich University —The Military College of Vermont.

Mike Carruthers

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - Berkeley Square House London

Mike Carruthers is a Senior Managing Director and the European Head of Private Credit for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in London. Mr. Carruthers is involved in the origination, researching, structuring, and managing of investments.

Mr. Carruthers re-joined the London team in 2022 after having previously relocated to Toronto, Canada to focus on credit origination efforts in Canada and the Midwest. Mr. Carruthers previously worked in the London office from 2006 – 2019. Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Carruthers worked in the investment banking division of Credit Suisse.

Mr. Carruthers graduated with Honors in Business Administration from the Richard Ivey School of Business at the University of Western Ontario.

Joshua Carson

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Josh Carson is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and Chief Operating Officer of Real Estate Americas. Mr. Carson was previously the COO of Americas Asset Management and involved in the oversight of Blackstone's office and lab office investments.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Carson was a Senior Vice President at L&L Holding Company, a privately held real estate company, where he focused on acquiring and redeveloping office buildings in New York City. Prior to joining L&L, Mr. Carson worked on acquisitions for New Boston Fund, a real estate investment management firm. Mr. Carson began his career at McKinsey & Company.

Mr. Carson received a BA in Economics and Russian from Middlebury College, where he graduated magna cum laude. 

Kendra Cartwright

Managing Director

Human Resources - Hong Kong

Kendra Cartwright is a Managing Director and is the Head of Human Resources Asia Pacific. 

Kendra brings nearly 20 years of international human resources experience to the firm.  Prior to joining Blackstone, she spent 10 years in Asia, most recently as HR Business Partner for the Asia ETF and Distribution businesses at Blackrock.  She also spent 13 years at Barclays Investment Bank in HR roles across geographies and functions, including HR Business Partner for Global Research (New York) and Head of HR for Asia Pacific Front Office (Tokyo and Singapore).

Kendra earned a BA in Russian and French from Indiana University, an MA in Slavic Linguistics from Florida State University, and an MBA from Thunderbird School of Global Management.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Caruso was a Principal at Rhône Group in the Private Equity Fund in London and New York; previously, he was at Goldman Sachs Real Estate private equity group in London.

Mr. Cerrone was previously part of the debt capital markets group where he focused on the financing of real estate investments in the Americas.

Ms. Chan received a BEng in Industrial Engineering and Engineering Management and a MPhil in Industrial Engineering and Logistics Management from The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.

Sr. Managing Director

Before joining Blackstone in 2005, Ms. Chartoff worked as a Director in Investment Banking at Banc of America Securities in the Financial Sponsors Group.  Prior to that she was in the investment banking groups of Credit Suisse and Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette where she worked on a variety of financing, M&A, and restructuring transactions in the consumer and retail and media and telecommunications industries.

Ms. Chartoff received a B.A. in Economics from Cornell University and an M.B.A. from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.  She is a member of the Board of Trustees of American Ballet Theater.

Prior to Apax Digital, Mr. Chaudhry worked at Honeycomb Asset Management, a fundamental long/short equity manager, and at KKR where he focused on growth equity and private equity investments. He started his career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley.

Menes Chee

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Menes Chee is a Senior Managing Director of Blackstone and the Head of Asia Pacific for Tactical Opportunities.  He is a member of the investment committees for Tactical Opportunities and Blackstone Insurance Solutions.

Prior to the launch of Tactical Opportunities, Mr. Chee was a Managing Director in Blackstone’s credit business focused on rescue lending and capital solutions.  Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Chee was a hedge fund manager with TPG-Axon Capital and a private equity investor with Texas Pacific Group.  Mr. Chee began his career at Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette in the leveraged finance and merchant banking groups.

Mr. Chee graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania with a B.S. in Economics from the Wharton School and a B.A. from the College, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa.

Kuohsin Chen

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Kuohsin Chen is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Institutional Client Solutions Group. Ms. Chen is involved in raising capital for Blackstone's private investment funds and maintaining relationships with the Firm’s Limited Partners.

 

Since joining Blackstone in 2012, Ms. Chen has performed various roles across the firm, most recently within the Insurance Solutions group, where she was involved in the development, distribution and portfolio management of alternative solutions for insurance companies and prior to that she executed M&A and strategic initiatives within the asset management industry on behalf of Blackstone. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Chen was an investment banker at UBS Investment Bank.

 

Ms. Chen received a BS in Economics from The Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management. She currently serves on the Associates Council of Prep for Prep, a New York City based education non-profit.

Amy Chen

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Amy Chen is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit.  Ms. Chen heads up the tax compliance and reporting function for all Blackstone Credit's investment funds and its affiliated entities.  Her responsibilities include managing the tax compliance and reporting obligation both in the US and in foreign jurisdictions as well as FATCA compliance. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Chen was a Director of Tax at Amber Capital Investment Management where she was responsible for all tax matters related to the investments funds as well as the management company. She collaborated with the investment team, operation team and legal team on all portfolio transactions. Prior to joining Amber Capital, she was a Senior Tax Manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers’s asset management tax group based in New York where she provided a wide range of tax services to private investment fund clients. Ms. Chen was also a Tax Manager at Arthur Andersen’s financial services tax group based in New York where she provided similar tax services to private investment fund clients as well as international banking clients. Ms. Chen received her BBA in Accounting from Bernard M. Baruch College. She is a Certified Public Accountant and a member of the American Institution of Certified Public Accountants.

Athena Cheng

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Athena Cheng is a Managing Director in the Chief Legal Office and Blackstone’s Head of Litigation and Investigations.
 
Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Cheng practiced at Cravath, Swaine & Moore LLP where she focused on litigation, investigations and antitrust matters. Prior to joining Cravath, Ms. Cheng served as a law clerk to the Honorable William G. Young of the United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts. 
 
Ms. Cheng received a BA in Psychology, magna cum laude, from Yale University, where she was elected Phi Beta Kappa, and a JD, summa cum laude, from Boston University School of Law, where she was a member of the Law Review.

Ashish Chhaparwal

Managing Director

BXCI - San Francisco

Ashish Chhaparwal is a Managing Director of Blackstone Credit’s Systematic Strategies unit.  Mr. Chhaparwal is the Head of Strategy Implementation and is involved in model management, portfolio construction, and alpha research on systematic credit strategies.

Prior to Blackstone’s acquisition of DCI in 2020, Mr. Chhaparwal was Head of Strategy Implementation at DCI, LLC. Before joining DCI, Mr. Chhaparwal was a portfolio co-manager and researcher for global equity long-short strategies at Incapture Investments. Prior to that he was Senior Researcher at Charles Schwab Investment Management (CSIM) focusing on Schwab Active Equity Funds. Prior to CSIM, he was at BlackRock (previously Barclays Global Investors), where he began his career in the Scientific Active Equity group (SAE).

Mr. Chhaparwal is a CFA charter holder and received a B.Tech in Civil Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IITD).

Charmaine Chin

Managing Director

BXMA - Singapore

Charmaine Chin is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Ms. Chin worked at Fullerton Fund Management in Singapore managing a portfolio of hedge funds, private equity and private credit funds, as well as co-investments and late-stage growth investments. Prior to Fullerton, Ms. Chin spent 12 years as a Partner and Managing Director at K2 Advisors (part of Franklin Templeton’s Alternatives division) in New York, where she oversaw all of K2’s investments in Asia, as well as all investments globally in credit and event-driven strategies. Prior to K2, Ms. Chin worked at Goldman Sachs in the Special Situations Group, focused on opportunistic investing across equities and credit. Ms. Chin began her career in the investment banking division of Goldman Sachs in New York and Hong Kong.

Ms. Chin received a B.A. from Harvard University, where she graduated magna cum laude and was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. In addition, she serves on the Singapore Advisory Committee for the Standards Board for Alternatives Investments and the United World College of South East Asia board. 

Paula Chirhart

Managing Director

Corporate Affairs - New York

Paula is a Managing Director in the Global Corporate Affairs Group. She serves as a media spokesperson for the firm and advises on communications issues.

Ms. Chirhart joined Blackstone in 2015 from global financial services provider Macquarie Group where she served as Senior Vice President of Corporate Communications in the Americas. During her eight-year tenure at Macquarie, she served as the primary spokesperson for several its businesses including Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets (MIRA). Prior to joining Macquarie, she served as a Vice President at Abernathy MacGregor, a leading NY-based financial communications firm, where she worked on communications efforts relating to transactions, crisis management and corporate reputation building. She started her career as a Research Associate for the National Center on Addiction and Substance Abuse (CASA) at Columbia University.

Ms. Chirhart received a BA from The University of Virginia.

Frank Cohen

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Frank Cohen is the Global Chairman of Core+ Real Estate. He is also the Chairman and CEO of Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust.

Since joining Blackstone in 1996, Mr. Cohen has played an integral role in the growth of the real estate business. He previously held multiple leadership positions, overseeing Americas Acquisitions and later the Core+ Real estate business from its early days. He has been involved in over $100 billion of real estate transactions, including many of the firm’s notable investments, including Equity Office, CarrAmerica Realty, Trizec and IndCor Properties.

Mr. Cohen received a BA from Northwestern University, where he graduated from the Honors Program in Mathematical Methods in the Social Sciences, with a double major in political science.

He serves on the Board of Trustees for Northwestern University, as a Trustee of the Urban Land Institute and on the NAREIT Advisory Board of Governors. He also serves as a director of Tricon Residential Inc. (TSX:TCN) and several Blackstone portfolio companies.

Eric Conklin

Sr. Managing Director, Managing Partner

Eric Conklin is a Senior Managing Director of Blackstone, serving as the Managing Partner of Harvest Fund Advisors, Blackstone’s publicly traded MLP and Yield-Oriented Investment Platform. Having joined Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Conklin focuses on Harvest’s investment process and the overall direction and growth of Harvest.

Before joining Harvest in 2006, Mr. Conklin was a Vice President in the Credit Suisse Energy Equity Research Group responsible for coverage of the MLP sector. Prior to Credit Suisse, Mr. Conklin was a Research Analyst on both the Exploration & Production and Oil Services teams at Lehman Brothers. Before moving to research, Mr. Conklin was an associate in the Mergers and Acquisitions Group at JP Morgan, and an associate in the Energy Group at the Bank of New York.

Mr. Conklin received a BA in Economics from Hamilton College, where he graduated Magna Cum Laude and as a member of Phi Beta Kappa, and an MBA with Honors from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

David Coppe

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

David Coppé is a Senior Managing Director and Head of Asset Management for North America for Blackstone Credit & Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.  Prior to his current role, since 2019, Mr. Coppé was involved in a Chairman or Board Member capacity for several Blackstone Credit portfolio companies.

Prior to working with Blackstone, Mr. Coppé worked in private equity, as Head of Energy Private Equity for CDPQ and, earlier, as a Partner at Cadent Energy Partners.  He also served as Chief Executive Officer of Probe Holdings, a Texas-based manufacturer of specialty measurement equipment, where he led an operational turnaround.  Earlier in his career, Mr. Coppé was an investment banking associate at Goldman Sachs, in the Technology, and in the Energy and Power groups.  He started his career at Schlumberger, working on drilling rigs in the North Sea, Venezuela and Asia.

Mr. Coppé holds an Engineering degree from the University of Louvain, Belgium, and an MBA from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology’s Sloan School of Management.

Since joining Strategic Partners in 2001, Mr. Corey has been involved in over $30 billion of secondary transactions and developed investor relationships across the Americas and Asia. David Cunningham

Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

Mr. Cunningham is a Managing Director and a Portfolio Manager of the European CLOs in Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit. Mr. Cunningham is responsible for the origination of European CLOs with a focus on CLO structuring and also for overseeing LCS’s European capital markets activities. He also sits on LCS’s European Syndicated Credit Investment Committee and CLO Origination Committee.

Mr. Cunningham joined Blackstone Credit, then GSO Capital Partners, during their acquisition of Harbourmaster Capital Management Limited in 2012. Prior to that, Mr. Cunningham was a Director at Harbourmaster Capital where he was part of the portfolio management group supporting the Portfolio Managers for the CLOs under management at Harbourmaster Capital, and was also involved in capital formation and investor relations.  Prior to joining Harbourmaster Capital in 2007, Mr. Cunningham worked as a credit analyst in WGZ Bank focusing on structured finance transactions.

Mr. Cunningham received a BE in Electronic Engineering from University College Dublin and his MSc in Financial & Industrial Mathematics from Dublin City University.  Mr. Cunningham is also a CFA Charterholder and a CAIA Charterholder.

Nela D’Agosta

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Nela D'Agosta is a Senior Managing Director and leads ICS for insurance globally in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. D’Agosta was at MetLife Investment Management where she was the Global Head of Insurance & Banking in their Institutional Client Group leading strategy, sales, and relationship management. Prior to that, she was at Goldman Sachs Asset Management where she was the Global Head of Insurance Client Relationship Management overseeing client service and business growth for their insurance clients. Ms. D’Agosta also worked at JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley in New York, London and Sydney, in client facing in various roles.

Ms. D’Agosta received a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from Villanova University.

Marco D’Arienzo

Managing Director

Real Estate - Toronto

Marco D’Arienzo is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. D’Arienzo has held roles in both New York and Toronto and has been involved in investing and managing real estate across several asset classes, including Blackstone’s Canadian industrial portfolio (Pure Industrial) and its US affordable housing platform (April Housing). Prior to that, he was involved in sourcing, underwriting, negotiating, and structuring commercial and residential real estate debt investments across the United States and Canada.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. D’Arienzo worked in Toronto for Brookfield Financial supporting global real estate M&A, capital markets and brokerage teams.

Mr. D’Arienzo received a Bachelor of Commerce (First Class Honours) from Queen’s University and serves as a board member for the Canadian Transplant Association and the Heart & Hands Pediatric Clinic. 

Ana DaCosta

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Ana DaCosta is a Managing Director within the Institutional Client Solutions group of Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. She is responsible for product strategy and product development for BXCI clients.

Prior to Blackstone, Ms. DaCosta served as Head of Alternative Product Solutions for Voya Investment Management. Before that, Ms. DaCosta spent 16 years at MetLife Investment Management where she had a variety of roles including Head of Real Estate Debt Client Solutions, Business Administration for the office of the COO and as a private credit investments lawyer. Ms. DaCosta began her career as a corporate attorney at LeBoeuf, Lamb, Greene and MacRae, LLP.

Ms. DaCosta earned a BA in Philosophy from Rutgers University and a JD from New York Law School. Ms. DaCosta holds several FINRA licenses.

Gabrielle Dale

Managing Director

Infrastructure - London

Gabrielle Dale is a Managing Director in the Infrastructure Group.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2022, Ms. Dale spent 16 years at Macquarie, most recently as a Managing Director at Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets where she was involved in numerous transactions in the transport and digital infrastructure sectors. Gabrielle started her career in Macquarie’s infrastructure advisory group, Macquarie Capital, where she worked in various global offices across Australia, UAE and UK. She has previously served as a director of HES International, Macquarie Air Finance and Exolum.

Ms. Dale graduated from the University of Queensland with a Bachelor of Commerce (Hons.) and a Bachelor of Science.

Amit Dalmia

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Mumbai

Amit Dalmia is a Senior Managing Director in the Corporate Private Equity group and is based in Mumbai. Since joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Dalmia has primarily been involved in monitoring the performance and development of Blackstone portfolio companies in India. Before joining Blackstone, Mr.  Dalmia had diverse operational experience of over 13 years with Hindustan Unilever India ("HUL") in various management and business leadership roles ranging from finance and accounts to commercial and supply chain. Mr. Dalmia He has undergone a management training program with the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad and subsequently worked extensively on in-company training at Unilever. Mr.  Dalmia received a B. Com. (Hons. ) from St. Xaviers' College from the University of Kolkatta, India. He is also a Chartered Accountant (CA), Company Secretary (CS) and Cost Accountant (ICWA) with three Gold Medals for securing first-ranks in the country.

Jake Dalpiaz

Managing Director

Blackstone Capital Markets - New York

Jake Dalpiaz is a Managing Director in Blackstone Capital Markets (BXCM) based in New York.

Since joining Blackstone in June 2021, he has been involved with asset-backed capital markets financing activities across Blackstone in a variety of sectors, such as digital infrastructure, WBS, media royalties, accounts receivables, fund finance, and consumer credit.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Dalpiaz was a Director at Barclays in the Structured Products Origination group, responsible for origination, structuring, and syndication across a range of traditional and esoteric securitized asset classes.

Mr. Dalpiaz graduated from Johns Hopkins University with a BA in History and minors in Business and Economics. He is also a CFA® charterholder.

Amanda Daniel

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Amanda Daniel is a Managing Director on the Real Estate Product Specialist team, based in London.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Daniel worked at BlackRock as a product specialist for its hedge fund solutions business. Prior to joining BlackRock, Ms. Daniel worked on the Institutional Fixed Income Sales team at RBC Capital Markets.

Ms. Daniel received a BA in History from Princeton University.

Simon Davies

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Simon Davies is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in London and is Head of Europe Real Estate Finance.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Davies lead the tax function for the European real estate business focusing on tax planning around fund formations, acquisitions and disposals. Before joining Blackstone in 2007, Mr. Davies worked as a Senior Manager in the Investment Management and Real Estate team at PricewaterhouseCoopers and specialized in the tax affairs of international real estate funds and investments.

Mr. Davies received a First-Class Honours degree in Chemical Engineering from Imperial College London and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of England and Wales.

Sara Davis

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York 601 Lex

Sara Davis is a Managing Director in Blackstone Real Estate and Co-Head of BPP Global Finance, based in New York. Ms. Davis is involved with valuations, performance and investor reporting for the global BPP real estate fund platform.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Ms. Davis spent over 17 years at Morgan Stanley where she most recently was an Executive Director in MSIM’s Real Assets Group, leading the portfolio management team for the global opportunistic real estate funds.

Ms. Davis received a BS in Finance and International Business from Manhattan College, where she graduated summa cum laude and an MBA from Fordham University. Ms. Davis is a member of the NCREIF/PREA Reporting Standards Council.

Joe DeFalco

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Joe DeFalco is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2007, Mr. DeFalco was an Assurance Manager in PricewaterhouseCooper’s Alternative Investment Fund practice.

Mr. DeFalco received a B.A. in Economics from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. He also received an M.S. in Accounting from the UNC Kenan-Flagler Business School and is a Certified Public Accountant.

John DePalma

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

John DePalma is a Managing Director and U.S. Credit Research analyst involved with the ongoing analysis and evaluation of primary and secondary fixed income investments.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2015 Mr. DePalma worked at Babson Capital Management, most recently as an Associate Director in the Alternative High Yield Investments Group. There he was responsible for debt and equity analysis covering a variety of industries for the firm’s event driven hedge fund.

Mr. DePalma received a BS in Finance from Bentley University, where he graduated magna cum laude and is a CFA Charterholder.

Anthony DeRose

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Anthony DeRose is a Managing Director in the Legal and Compliance Department and is the Chief Compliance Officer of Blackstone Securities Partners L.P. In addition, Mr. DeRose oversees the Central Compliance and Conflicts Clearance teams.

Before joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. DeRose was a Managing Director in Compliance at Deustche Bank and before that he served as Deputy Chief Compliance Officer at Och-Ziff Capital Management. From 2008 to 2016, Mr. DeRose was a member of Compliance at Goldman Sachs and was named a Managing Director in 2013.  From 2004 to 2008, Mr. DeRose was a Senior Vice President in Legal & Compliance at Lehman Brothers, and he began his career as a Corporate Associate at Cadwalader, Wickersham and Taft.

He received his BS magna cum laude from Binghamton University School of Management and his JD from Brooklyn Law School, where he was a member of the Journal of Law and Policy and the Moot Court Honor Society.

Adam Denhoff

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Adam Denhoff is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Denhoff worked at Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP as an Associate in the Restructuring Group.

Mr. Denhoff received a BA, cum laude, from New York University, and a JD, magna cum laude, from The University of Michigan Law School.

Ravi Desai

Sr. Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Ravi Desai is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA). Mr. Desai is involved in hedge fund manager evaluation, selection, and monitoring, as well as structured and corporate credit investments.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Desai was a Managing Director at Caprok Capital. Prior to Caprok, Mr. Desai was a Portfolio Manager at Tolis Advisors, and prior to that, a Vice President at Bear Stearns.

Mr. Desai received a BA in Economics and Political Science from Columbia University.

Susanne Desch

Managing Director & CAO

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Susanne Desch is the Chief Operating Officer of Blackstone Private Equity Strategies (BXPE), a Managing Director and Chief Administrative Officer of Blackstone’s Tactical Opportunities (“Tac Opps”) group, based in New York. In these roles, she oversees strategy, operations and administration for the business.

Ms. Desch joined Blackstone in 2014, after nearly 10 years at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where she focused on Business Administration for the Global Markets and Investment Bank, followed by the Private Banking and Investment Group.

Ms. Desch received a BS in Business Administration from Western Carolina University.

Teddy Desloge

Managing Director

BXCI - Miami

Teddy Desloge is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in Miami and serves as the Chief Financial Officer and Portfolio Manager of Blackstone Private Credit Fund (BCRED) and Blackstone Secured Lending Fund (BXSL). Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Desloge has been involved with investment management of various direct lending funds and has focused on origination, research, and execution of private and opportunistic credit investments across industries, supporting private credit strategies.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Desloge focused on origination, research and execution of private credit investments at Gefinor Capital. He started his career in the Leveraged Finance group at Jefferies.

Mr. Desloge graduated from Hobart & William Smith Colleges with a BA in Economics.

Chris Dettman

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Chris Dettman is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group based in New York, where he focuses on investments in the Technology and Services industries. Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Dettman has worked in both the New York and Tokyo offices and has been involved in the execution of Blackstone’s investments in Refinitiv, Alinamin, Encore, Kronos, Ipreo, and Lendmark.

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Dettman worked at Stephens Inc. in its Investment Banking division. Mr. Dettman received a BS from the University of Nebraska and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Marc Dietrich

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Marc Dietrich is a Managing Director on the Institutional Client Solutions (ICS) team within Blackstone Credit focused on institutional marketing, business development and client relationships. Marc has over 20 years of institutional sales and investment management experience, including in both buy-side and sell-side roles.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Dietrich was a Sr. Institutional Client Advisor with Neuberger Berman. Prior to that, he was an Executive Director with Morgan Stanley Investment Management and Allianz Global Investors. He began his career in Chicago with Capital Markets roles with Morgan Stanley and First Analysis. 

Mr. Dietrich holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Rutgers University, an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University, and he has been awarded the CAIA designation. 

Michael Diverio

Sr. Managing Director

Infrastructure - New York

Mike Diverio is a Senior Managing Director in the Infrastructure Group where he focuses on investments in the Digital Infrastructure and Transportation sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2020, he has been involved in the execution of investments in QTS Realty Trust, Phoenix Tower International, Signature Aviation and the Digital Realty JV.

Prior to Blackstone, Mike worked in corporate private equity, most recently at Apollo Global Management, where he was involved in the investments in Direct ChassisLink, Blume Global, and Qdoba Mexican Eats, and served on the Board of Directors of Direct ChassisLink, Blume Global, Qdoba, and CEC Entertainment. Mike began his career at Morgan Stanley in the investment banking division.

Mike received a BS in Business Administration from Washington & Lee University where he graduated magna cum laude, and received an MBA from Harvard Business School. Mike currently serves on the Board of Directors of QTS Realty Trust, Phoenix Tower International, and the Digital Realty JV, and as a Board Observer of Signature Aviation. He serves as a member of the Board of Trustees of The Hun School of Princeton.

Amit Dixit

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - Mumbai

Amit Dixit is Head of Asia for Blackstone Private Equity.  Since joining Blackstone in 2007, Mr. Dixit has been based in Mumbai and led various investments in South Asia and global technology-enabled services. 

Previously, Mr. Dixit was a Principal at Warburg Pincus and started his career at Trilogy Software.  Mr. Dixit received an MBA from Harvard Business School, an MS in Engineering from Stanford University, and a B.Tech. from Indian Institute of Technology Mumbai where he was awarded the Director’s Silver Medal for graduating at the top of his program.  Mr. Dixit has established the first Chair, the “Shobha Dixit Chair” named after his mother, exclusively for women faculty pursuing research in science and technology at IIT Mumbai.

He currently serves as a Director of Mphasis, TaskUs, Aadhar Housing Finance, Essel Propack, Sona Comstar, IBS Software, Piramal Glass, ASK Investment Managers and Blackstone India.  Mr. Dixit was previously a Director of Intelenet Global Services, Trans Maldivian Airways, Jagran Media, Igarashi Motors India, S.H. Kelkar Fragrances, Aakash Education and Emcure Pharmaceuticals.

Thomas Dixon

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - London

Thomas Dixon is a Managing Director in the Blackstone European Private Equity Portfolio Operations team based in London.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Dixon worked at Alvarez & Marsal, Deloitte and EY leading performance improvement projects for PE portfolio companies. 

Mr. Dixon graduated from the University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology (UMIST) with a BSc in Management (International Studies) and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Scotland (ICAS).

Himanshu Dodeja

Sr. Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - Mumbai

Himanshu Dodeja is a Senior Managing Director in the Legal and Compliance Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Dodeja has advised on various investments across private equity, real estate, tactical opportunities, and growth. 

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Dodeja was a partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas in Mumbai, where he focused on private equity and mergers and acquisitions.

Mr. Dodeja completed his post-graduate studies in corporate law, from New York University and is licensed to practice in India and New York. Mr. Dodeja is a member of the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry’s committees on capital markets and private equity. He currently serves as a director on various boards including ASK Wealth Advisors Private Limited and Blackstone India Advisors Private Limited.

Aisling Doherty

Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

Aisling Doherty is a Managing Director and Portfolio Manager in Blackstone’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) group.

Ms. Doherty is responsible for engaging asset owners across the credit opportunity set, with a focus on delivering optimal credit solutions to meet their needs. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Doherty was a Partner and Senior Fixed Income Portfolio Manager for Mercer Global Investments where she oversaw $40bn of delegated fixed income assets on behalf of investors.

Ms. Doherty received an Honors BSc in Financial and Actuarial Mathematics and completed Postgraduate studies in Actuarial Applications at Dublin City University, Ireland. Ms. Doherty is a Fellow of the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries UK, and a Fellow of the Society of Actuaries in Ireland.

K.C. Dolan

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - London

K.C. Dolan is a Managing Director in Portfolio Operations and leads asset management in Europe for Tactical Opportunities.

Before joining Blackstone in 2023, Mr. Dolan worked at Lycamobile, the world’s largest Mobile Virtual Network Operator, where he was the Chief Development Officer. Prior to Lycamobile, he spent 15 years at Liberty Global, a leader in converged broadband, video and mobile communications services. At Liberty, he held various senior roles in Investor Relations, Financial Planning & Analysis, Strategy & Development, Business Integration as well as serving as the Deputy CFO of Liberty Latin America and the CFO of UPC Central & Eastern Europe. Prior to his operational experience, he worked in the investment banking divisions of JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs.

Mr. Dolan received a B.S. in Finance from Villanova University. He currently serves as a director of Hipgnosis, a portfolio company in the Tactical Opportunities Fund.

John Donovan

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

John Donovan is a Managing Director in the Private Wealth Solutions group.  Mr. Donovan is a member of the US Sales Leadership Team where he leads the Eastern Division of Independent Wealth Management.  Mr. Donovan also works directly with independent wealth managers in Greater New York and Greater Philadelphia. 

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Donovan spent 6 years at Schroders.  His most recent role was Director, US Intermediary Distribution, where he was responsible for business development in the Southwest. 

Mr. Donovan holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, Finance & Economics from Boston University.  He is a CFA Charterholder.

Andrew Dowler

Managing Director

Government Relations - Berkeley Square House London

Andrew Dowler is a Managing Director of Government Relations in Europe. He helps navigate political, legislative, and regulatory risk for the firm and advises Blackstone's portfolio companies on related matters, drawing on his extensive knowledge and expertise built up over more than 30 years advising alternative investment companies.

Mr. Dowler played a major role on many of the most high-profile mergers and acquisitions (hostile and agreed), re-financings and restructurings of the European market since deregulation in the 1980s.

Mr. Dowler was previously a Partner at one of the UK’s leading public affairs consultancies (where his clients included Blackstone) and started his career in politics in Westminster as a researcher and speechwriter. He received a BSc (Hons) from the University of Southampton.

Joe Dowling

Sr. Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Joe Dowling is a Senior Managing Director and the Global Head of Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA), where he oversees and leads all of BXMA’s investment activities.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Dowling led Brown University’s endowment, including as Chief Executive Officer from July 2018 to July 2020 and Chief Investment Officer from June 2013 to July 2018. Mr. Dowling also served as interim Chief Financial Officer of the University from May 2019 until January 2020, leading all finance and treasury functions as well as cash and debt management.

Before joining Brown University, he was the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Narragansett Asset Management, where he managed funds for institutions, pension funds, and endowments. Mr. Dowling has also worked for First Boston and Tudor Investments.

Mr. Dowling has a B.A. from Harvard College and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Amanda Downy

Managing Director

Human Resources - New York

Amanda Downy is a Managing Director and Human Resources Business Partner supporting the Blackstone Credit & Insurance, Infrastructure, and Strategic Partners businesses.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Downy was the Head of Human Capital at Sycamore Partners where she was responsible for building the HR function and enabling talent strategy. Prior to Sycamore, she spent eight years at Apollo Global Management, most recently as the HR Business Partner for the Credit business. Over her Apollo tenure, she previously covered the Private Equity and Real Estate businesses, as well as the Executive Office and several corporate functions. She began her career at Deutsche Bank as an HR Business Partner.

Ms. Downy received a B.S. in Communication and a Human Resources Concentration from Cornell University, where she also minored in Applied Economics and Management.

Andrea Drasites

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Andrea Drasites is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group at Blackstone. She is involved in the asset management and oversight of Blackstone’s retail, gaming, digital infrastructure, and tradeshow investments in the US including ShopCore, Edens, QTS, Phoenix Towers and International Market Centers.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Drasites was responsible for asset management, acquisitions, and dispositions at Equity One, Inc., She began her real estate career at Woolbright Development.

Ms. Drasites received a BA in International Business from Rollins College and an MBA from the University of Florida with honors. Ms. Drasites is active in the Blackstone Diversity & Inclusion and Task Force and is a member of the University of Florida’s Real Estate Advisory Board, as well as the International Council of Shopping Centers Board of Trustees and Executive Board. She is on the Founding Member on the Board of Core Giving.

Jonathan Duber

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Jonathan Duber is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Duber has been focused on the asset management of Blackstone’s U.S. industrial portfolio, Link Logistics, which spans more than 450 million square feet.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Duber was a Director of Acquisitions at GTIS Partners. He previously worked as an Analyst in Deutsche Bank’s Commercial Real Estate Group.

Mr. Duber received a BS from Cornell University. 

Jean-Christophe Dubois

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Jean-Christophe Dubois is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and is based in London. Mr. Dubois is involved with portfolio management, asset management and transaction activities across our continental European businesses. Prior to joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Dubois was a Managing Director at Archon, Goldman Sachs’ European real estate and distressed loan management platform. Prior to this role, Mr. Dubois held multiple leadership positions at Archon, including Head of Italian Management Platform, Head of European Acquisition, Head of Loan Management and Asset Manager. Mr. Dubois received a degree in engineering from Ecole Centrale de Marseille and a Master in Finance from ESCP Europe.

Eric Duchon

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Eric Duchon is a Managing Director and the Global Head of ESG for Blackstone Real Estate. As part of the Real Estate Asset Management team, he partners with the firm’s central ESG team and Portfolio Operations to initiate, manage, implement and report ESG initiatives across the global Real Estate portfolio.

Prior to joining Blackstone in November 2020, Mr. Duchon was at LaSalle Investment Management where he was a Managing Director and Global Head of Sustainability. Prior to LaSalle, Mr. Duchon spent over 9 years at Cushman & Wakefield as the Director of Sustainability Strategies.

Mr. Duchon received a BBA from Emory University – Goizueta Business School and a Masters in Real Estate Development Degree from New York University Schack Institute of Real Estate.

Christopher Duff

Managing Director

Strategic Incentives Group - New York

Christopher Duff is a Managing Director in the Finance Group. Since joining the firm in 1998, Mr. Duff has been involved with the management of the investment economics related to the general partner and side-by-side in the various Blackstone funds. His responsibilities include the preparation and invoicing of the general partner and side-by-side investments made by the firm's funds, the distribution of proceeds received from these components of the funds, the preparation of annual side-by-side elections projecting anticipated funding requirements for all participating Blackstone investors, the placement of financing including loan repayment and analysis of financing costs and the importing and management of all pertinent data into our accounting software for easy tracking and reporting. Mr. Duff received a BS in Finance from Villanova University.

Michael J Dupuis

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - San Francisco

Michael Dupuis is a Managing Director in the Private Wealth Management Group involved in raising capital for Blackstone’s private and public funds in the Pacific Northwest region. Prior to joining Blackstone in January 2012, Mr. Dupuis was a Senior Vice President in the Private Client Services Division of the Trust Company of the West responsible for business development and client service of endowment, foundation and family office clients. Before joining TCW in 2002 he was a Vice President of Roxbury Capital Management. Earlier he was the Director of Marketing for Munn, Bernhard and Associates. He began his investment career with Smith, Barney, Harris, Upham in New York as a financial advisor and was a Vice President of Kidder, Peabody & Company in a similar capacity. Mr. Dupuis holds a BS from The Ohio University.

Prior to Blackstone’s acquisition of DCI in 2020, Mr. Dwinells was Head of Portfolio Management at DCI, LLC where he was involved with portfolio management, strategy execution and investment technology. Prior to that, Mr. Dwinells was a Vice President at J.P. Morgan.

Oran Ebel

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Oran Ebel is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Ebel has been involved in new business initiatives, fund structuring and related issues, investment transactions and a number of other legal and compliance matters.  Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, Mr. Ebel worked at Debevoise & Plimpton LLP in New York as an associate in the Finance Group.

Mr. Ebel received an AB, cum laude, from Princeton University and a J.D., cum laude, from New York University School of Law. Prior to attending law school Mr. Ebel worked in real estate finance.

Karl Eber

Managing Director

BX Private Equity Strategies - New York

Karl Eber is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group based in New York. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Eber was a Principal at Crestview Partners, where he evaluated and executed private equity investments across several sectors. Prior to that, Mr. Eber was a Vice President at Emerging Sovereign Group, a global long/short hedge fund. Earlier in his career, Mr. Eber was a Private Equity Associate at Bain Capital and a Business Analyst at McKinsey & Company.

Mr. Eber received an A.B. with a double major in Political Science and Psychology from Stanford University, where he graduated Phi Beta Kappa. He holds an M.B.A. from the Stanford Graduate School of Business, where he was named an Arjay Miller Scholar.

Michael Eglit

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Michael Eglit is a Senior Managing Director and Head of U.S. Originations in Blackstone’s Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group. Since joining Blackstone, Mr. Eglit has been involved in sourcing, underwriting, negotiating and structuring debt investments across all asset types and geographies.

Before joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Eglit was with Wrightwood Capital where he underwrote and originated first mortgages, mezzanine loans and preferred equity.

Mr. Eglit received a BA from Lehigh University and an MBA from the Booth School of Business at the University of Chicago.

Elliot Eisenberger

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Elliot Eisenberger is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Since joining Blackstone in 2007 Elliot has been involved in tax planning and consulting for Blackstone and its affiliated entities. His responsibilities include the implementation of efficient tax investment and fund structures as well as managing BXCI’s tax compliance and reporting obligations.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Eisenberger was the Director of Tax at Amaranth Advisors LLC where his responsibilities included providing tax consulting with respect to investment transactions, fund structure and other general tax issues as well as ensuring that the fund was in compliance with all Federal, State and International tax filings. Prior to joining Amaranth in 2003, Mr. Eisenberger was with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP in its capital markets tax group where he provided a wide range of tax services to a number of hedge fund clients. Mr. Eisenberger was also with Ernst & Young LLP, providing similar tax services to hedge fund clients.

Mr. Eisenberger holds a BS in Accounting from Ramapo College of New Jersey and a Masters of Science in Taxation from Fordham University. Mr. Eisenberger is a Certified Public Accountant licensed to practice in the State of New York. 

Ryan Elman

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Ryan Elman is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Since joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Elman has been involved in overseeing the Finance and Operations of BXMA’s various platforms, with a focus on mitigating operational risk across the business.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Elman worked in Citi Group’s Global Transaction Services business, where he managed the monthly operations and books and records across a number of hedge fund relationships.

Mr. Elman received a B.S. in Management from Boston College.

Jaiye Falusi

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Jaiye Falusi is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Falusi was a Director at Tishman Speyer where he focused on acquiring and developing real estate investments in the US, with a specific focus on affordable and workforce housing. Prior to joining Tishman Speyer, Mr. Falusi spent time in both the market rate and affordable housing teams at Related. Mr. Falusi began his career at Citigroup.

Mr. Falusi received his MBA, with distinction, from Harvard Business School and his BSE in Mechanical Engineering from Princeton University. Mr. Falusi is a 2021 Real Estate Board of New York (“REBNY”) fellow.

Donatella Fanti

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Donatella Fanti is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, based in London. Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Ms. Fanti has been involved in Blackstone's real estate asset management activities, with a focus on the group's Italian real estate portfolio of office, retail, and hospitality assets, and the asset management of a number of Blackstone’s residential logistics and retail investments across Europe.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Fanti was a Vice President at Morgan Stanley, based in Milan, where she spent seven years focused on investments and asset management on behalf of Morgan Stanley's real estate investing team.

Ms. Fanti graduated summa cum laude from the Politecnico di Milano in 2006.

Since joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Favetto has been involved in the execution of Blackstone’s investments in Cerdia, Luminor and NIBC. He currently serves on the Supervisory Council of Luminor.

Jonathan Feiler

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Jonathan Feiler is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Feiler was the General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer of Arosa Capital Management LP, where he was responsible for overseeing all legal and compliance matters. Before joining Arosa, Mr. Feiler worked in the Investment Management group at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP where he represented private investment funds in connection with structuring, investor negotiation and ongoing legal issues, as well as regulatory and compliance matters.

Mr. Feiler received a J.D. from Boston University School of Law, where he graduated cum laude, and a B.S. in Business Administration from the State University of New York at Albany.

Marina Felman

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Marina Felman is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi Asset Investing (BXMA).

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2019, Ms. Felman was the General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer at Antecapio Investment Partners, a multi-strategy registered investment adviser. Ms. Felman began her legal career at S.A.C. Capital Advisors and later transitioned to Point72 Asset Management, where she served as Counsel in the Legal Department for over a decade to support structuring, trading and execution of capital markets and financing transactions across asset classes for global affiliates. Prior to law school, Ms. Felman was an Analyst in the Syndicated Finance Group at JPMorgan.

Ms. Felman received a B.A. in Economics and Psychology from Barnard College at Columbia University, and a J.D. from New York Law School.

Andrew Fenet

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Andrew Fenet is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and is based in New York. Mr. Fenet focuses on capital raising efforts for Blackstone’s Real Estate funds. Previously, he was focused on new investment opportunities in North America across several property types. Prior to joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Fenet was a Vice President in Morgan Stanley’s Real Estate Investment Group where he was responsible for new investments across all property types for the opportunistic and core real estate funds. Mr. Fenet received a BS in Economics from Vanderbilt University where he graduated magna cum laude and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management where he was awarded the Sears Scholarship.

James Feng

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

James Feng is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Securities group, part of Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”). He is involved with public real estate-related investments.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Feng worked at Credit Suisse, where he was responsible for trading CMBS. He began his career in the fixed income investing group at BlackRock.

Mr. Feng received a BSE in Operations Research and Financial Engineering from Princeton University, where he graduated summa cum laude and was elected to Phi Beta Kappa.

Jillian Fitzpatrick

Managing Director

Government Relations - DC

Jillian Fitzpatrick is Managing Director of Government Relations for Blackstone. She helps navigate political, legislative, and regulatory risk for the firm and provides advice to portfolio companies on related matters.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Fitzpatrick was Head of Global Policy for S&P Global. She previously served as Senior Policy Advisor to U.S. Senator Heidi Heitkamp of North Dakota and Minority Staff Director for the Banking Subcommittee on National Security and International Trade and Finance. She also served as Policy Director and Transition Director for U.S. Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and as Economic Policy Advisor for Senator Richard Blumenthal (D-CT). During the development and passage of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, Jillian worked for Rep. Dan Maffei (D-NY-25) on the House Financial Services Committee.

Jillian is currently co-chair of the Duke University Politics and Policy Network. She holds a BA from Duke University in Durham, NC and an MA from the George Washington University in Washington, D.C.

John Fitzpatrick

Sr. Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

John Fitzpatrick is a Senior Managing Director and Chief Technology Officer of Alternative Asset Management Technology at Blackstone. He handles all aspects of technology across Blackstone’s Real Estate and Private Equity businesses and assists our portfolio companies with managing their technology programs and strategy. He is also involved in the firm’s balance sheet investments in targeted, early stage, technology-related opportunities.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Fitzpatrick oversaw various initiatives across the entire Technology and Innovations group. Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Fitzpatrick worked at Capital IQ, a division of Standard & Poor’s, for seven years where he was most recently the Head of Product.

He received a BS in Finance from St. John’s University and currently serves on the Blackstone Charitable Foundation’s Leadership Council.

John Fitzpatrick

Sr. Managing Director

PropTech & FinTech

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

John Fitzpatrick is a Senior Managing Director and Chief Technology Officer of Alternative Asset Management Technology at Blackstone. He handles all aspects of technology across Blackstone’s Real Estate and Private Equity businesses and assists our portfolio companies with managing their technology programs and strategy. He is also involved in the firm’s balance sheet investments in targeted, early stage, technology-related opportunities.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Fitzpatrick oversaw various initiatives across the entire Technology and Innovations group. Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Fitzpatrick worked at Capital IQ, a division of Standard & Poor’s, for seven years where he was most recently the Head of Product.

He received a BS in Finance from St. John’s University and currently serves on the Blackstone Charitable Foundation’s Leadership Council.

Adam Fletcher

Sr. Managing Director

Cybersecurity

BXTI - Miami

Adam Fletcher is a Senior Managing Director in the Technology and Innovations group and Blackstone’s Chief Security Officer. He is responsible for all aspects of cyber and physical security across Blackstone as well as managing a small portfolio of investments in leading early-stage cybersecurity companies.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Fletcher was Blackstone’s Deputy CISO and helped lead an engaged community of cybersecurity professionals across Blackstone’s portfolio of companies. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Fletcher led the International Security organization for Equifax, coordinating a global security program across 14 countries, each with different business, regulatory, and privacy requirements.

Mr. Fletcher received a B.S. in Operations Research and Industrial Engineering from Cornell University. He currently serves as a director on the board of Pentera, is an observer on the boards of ShiftLeft, CyberGRX and Mitiga, and has been a Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) since 2011.

Adam Fletcher

Sr. Managing Director

BXTI - Miami

Adam Fletcher is a Senior Managing Director in the Technology and Innovations group and Blackstone’s Chief Security Officer. He is responsible for all aspects of cyber and physical security across Blackstone as well as managing a small portfolio of investments in leading early-stage cybersecurity companies.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Fletcher was Blackstone’s Deputy CISO and helped lead an engaged community of cybersecurity professionals across Blackstone’s portfolio of companies. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Fletcher led the International Security organization for Equifax, coordinating a global security program across 14 countries, each with different business, regulatory, and privacy requirements.

Mr. Fletcher received a B.S. in Operations Research and Industrial Engineering from Cornell University. He currently serves as a director on the board of Pentera, is an observer on the boards of ShiftLeft, CyberGRX and Mitiga, and has been a Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) since 2011.

Julie Flynn

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Julie Flynn is a Managing Director in Finance. She is co-lead of the Global Fund Finance group and co-head of BPP Global Finance. She oversees the accounting, financial reporting, fund administration and LP reporting for Blackstone’s open-ended products including the BPP Core Plus Real Estate Funds and the Infrastructure Funds.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Flynn worked at J.P. Morgan, where she was an Executive Director in the Global Real Assets Group as a Fund, Separate Account and Sector Controller during her 13 year tenure. Prior to that, she was an auditor at Arthur Andersen in its Technology, Media & Communications Division providing assurance services to a wide range of clients.

Ms. Flynn received a B.S. in Accounting from The State University at Albany, where she graduated magna cum laude. She is a Certified Public Accountant.

David Foley

Sr. Managing Director & Global Head of Blackstone Energy Transition Partners

Private Equity - New York

David I. Foley is a Senior Managing Director in the Private Equity Group and Global Head of Blackstone Energy Transition Partners. Mr. Foley is based in New York and is responsible for overseeing Blackstone’s private equity investment activities in the energy sector on a global basis. Since joining Blackstone in 1995, Mr. Foley has been responsible for building the Blackstone energy practice and has played an integral role in every energy–related private equity deal that the firm has made. Mr. Foley actively leads our investment activities and provides guidance and support to the other BEP senior investment professionals, who each have primary responsibility for specific sectors.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Foley worked with AEA Investors, and prior to that he worked as a management consultant for Monitor Company. Mr. Foley serves as a member of the Board of Directors for several BEP investments, including Beacon Offshore Energy, Geosyntec, Kinetik, Olympus Energy and Rover.  He also serves as the Chairman of the Columbia University Medical Center Ophthalmology Board of Advisors.

Mr. Foley received a B.A. and M.A. in Economics, with honors, Phi Beta Kappa, from Northwestern University and received an MBA with distinction from Harvard Business School.

Colm Foley

Managing Director

Blackstone Life Sciences - Cambridge

Colm Foley is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Life Sciences business. He joined Blackstone in 2022 after 23 years at the Boston Consulting Group (BCG). Within the Life Sciences business, Mr. Foley is involved with investments in the medical devices, diagnostics, and life sciences tools spaces. This includes supporting companies in driving their innovation agendas through product financings, joint acquisitions, spin-outs, and structured royalty and debt financings.

During his 23 years with BCG, Mr. Foley notably contributed to building the firm’s Medical Technology sector from its nascent days into a leading global business. His leadership roles included heading the Medical Technology sector globally, as well as the Healthcare Practice in North America – spanning Med Tech, Biopharma, and Payer/Provider segments. He was named in the top 10 of Healthcare Consultants and Leaders for 2022, by The Consulting Report.

Mr. Foley received an AB in Political Science from University of Michigan and an MBA from University of Chicago.

Since joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Forde has focused on institutional client coverage and business development across the UK, Nordics and Continental Europe.

Mr. Forde received a B.A. in European & International Politics from Northumbria University.

Mike Forman

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Mike Forman is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate group where he currently focuses on investment opportunities in the digital infrastructure and retail sectors.

Since joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Forman has been involved in investments across several asset classes, including QTS Data Centers, Digital Realty, COPT, Sunset Studios, ShopCore, and the creation and eventual IPO of Invitation Homes.

Mr. Forman received a dual BA in Mathematical Methods in the Social Sciences and Economics from Northwestern University, where he graduated with honors, and completed the Kellogg Financial Economics program.

Managing Director

ICS - New York

Sarah Foster is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Institutional Client Solutions group, where she is involved in raising capital for Blackstone’s private investment funds and maintaining relationships with the Firm’s Limited Partners.

Since joining Blackstone in 2011, Ms. Foster has managed relationships with BX shareholders and has executed strategic initiatives and M&A transactions on behalf of Blackstone and its clients. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Foster was an investment banker at Deutsche Bank and Lehman Brothers.

Ms. Foster received a BS in Management from Tulane University’s A.B. Freeman School of Business, where she graduated summa cum laude and earned majors in Finance and Accounting. Ms. Foster currently serves on the Board for A Fair Shake for Youth.

Anna Fritz

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Anna Fritz is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group. She is the Head of Fund Management for BREDS and a senior member of the Real Estate Securities team, focused on operations, financing, and non-investment-related matters.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Fritz was a Manager in the Banking and Capital Markets practice at PwC where she provided audit and advisory services to various banking clients. Prior to PwC, Ms. Fritz was an Associate in KPMG’s Financial Services practice.

Ms. Fritz received an MS in Accounting and BS in Business Administration from the Keenan-Flagler School of Business at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Kaoru Fujita

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Tokyo

Kaoru Fujita is a Managing Director in the Private Wealth Solutions Group and leads Blackstone’s private wealth solutions in Japan. The mission of Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions is to bring institutional-quality products across a broad spectrum of alternative asset classes to Japanese individual investors by collaborating with Japanese financial institutions.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Fujita worked at Fidelity International in Japan, where she led a team of product strategists introducing actively-managed equity and bond funds to the Japanese market.

Ms. Fujita served as a member of the Cabinet Secretariat of Japan’s Sub-Committee on Promoting Japan as a Leading Asset Management Center in 2023. She is also a member of Japan’s Financial Services Agency (FSA) Working Group on Capital Market Regulations in 2024.

Mrs. Fujita received a BA from Tokyo Woman's Christian University.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Gallagher worked at Harbourmaster Capital. Before that,  Mr. Gallagher worked as a Chartered Accountant.

Vikram Garg

Before joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Garg was a Director with Religare’s asset management business and prior to that worked with Deutsche Bank and The Chatterjee Group on pan- India real estate investments and asset management.

Amy Garges

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New Jersey

Amy Garges is a Managing Director in the Legal and Compliance Department on the Compliance Risk Management team. Previously, she was in the Hedge Fund Solutions Group where she managed internal compliance review matters.

Before joining Blackstone in 2008, Ms. Garges worked at PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as an Audit Manager in the Banking Capital Markets practice where she supervised audit teams, maintained client relationships, and provided accounting advisory services to financial institutional clients. Prior to PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, she worked at Franklin Templeton Investments as a Tax Audit Supervisor where she managed multiple tax audits and assisted with tax planning projects.

Ms. Garges received a BA in Economics from the University of California, Los Angeles. She is a Certified Public Accountant.
