Brian Geraghty

Managing Director

Strategic Partners - Tennessee

Brian Geraghty is a Managing Director in Blackstone Strategic Partners. Brian focuses on the GP Stakes business and leads the platform’s Spend Management Team, working with the GPs and their underlying portfolio companies on procurement and expense reduction initiatives.

Before joining Blackstone, Brian served most recently as AVP of Business Development at CoreTrust and, prior to that, was an Equity Research Associate at SunTrust Robinson Humphrey.

Brian received a BA in Finance from Fairfield University. He has been actively involved with the Pencil Foundation, where he most recently served as Chairman of the Board.

Claire Gerault

Managing Director

Finance - Luxembourg

Claire Gerault is a Managing Director in the European Finance team and the Conducting Officer for BEFM Valuation, Finance and Risk Management. Ms. Gerault primarily focuses on the oversight of the valuation and risk management of the Funds managed by BEFM as well as the oversight of the finance activities.

Before joining Blackstone in 2017, she was the Finance Director and Head of Office of BX Fund Services, a Blackstone company delivering value-add services to Blackstone Private Equity and Tactical Opportunities and its partners, where she worked on a variety of private equity transactions in Luxembourg. Prior to that, she worked in a variety of audit roles in France and Luxembourg, and spent 7 years at Deloitte, Luxembourg, most recently as a Senior Manager within the Private Equity and Real Estate Division.

Ms. Gerault holds a Masters in Management, Corporate Finance, from the SKEMA Business School (France) and the Accounting & Auditing Certificate (Reviseur d’Entreprise) from the University of Luxembourg. 

Barry Gertz

Managing Director

Blackstone Life Sciences - Cambridge

Barry Gertz is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Life Sciences group, having joined Blackstone as part of its acquisition of Clarus in December of 2018.

Dr. Gertz joined Clarus in October 2014 from Merck (NYSE: MRK) where he was Senior Vice President and Head of Global Clinical Development, overseeing all aspects of Merck’s clinical research. He brings 28 years of experience in drug development, from exploratory clinical pharmacology to global phase 3 trials. While at Merck, Dr. Gertz was instrumental in the development and approval of more than 25 new drugs and vaccines, including the blockbuster products Fosamax and Januvia as well as the initial indication for Keytruda. Dr. Gertz has co-authored over a hundred scientific publications appearing in the Journal of Clinical Investigation, the Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism, and the New England Journal of Medicine. Dr. Gertz currently is a member of the Advisory Boards of Abide Therapeutics, EMD Serono, the Institute for Translational Medicine and Therapeutics at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine and is a member of the Board of Trustees of the Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania.

Dr. Gertz received an MD, PhD and BA from the University of Pennsylvania.

Moez Gharbi

Managing Director

Blackstone Growth - London

Moez Gharbi is a Managing Director for Blackstone Growth (BXG) based in London. Mr. Gharbi focuses on investing in growth companies across Europe, with a particular focus on the financial technology and consumer sectors. Since joining BXG in 2020, he has been involved in several transactions, including Oatly, Epidemic Sound, Mollie, Relex and Celonis.

Mr. Gharbi joined Blackstone in 2012 and was a member of the Private Equity team prior to moving to BXG. Within the Private Equity group, Mr. Gharbi was focused on buyout transactions in Europe and was involved in multiple Private Equity portfolio companies including Stow, Scout24, Tangerine and ICS.

Mr. Gharbi earned master's degrees in Management Studies from both HEC Paris and the MIT Sloan School of Management.

Susan Givens

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Susan Givens is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, where she currently focuses on Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT). Ms. Givens previously led asset management for Blackstone’s US student housing investments and other residential investments in Blackstone’s portfolio.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Givens was the Chief Executive Officer of New Senior Investment Group Inc. (NYSE: SNR), a publicly traded healthcare REIT, from the company’s inception through its separation from Fortress Investment Group and through its sale to Ventas, Inc. (NYSE: VTR) in 2021. Prior to New Senior, Ms. Givens was a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group at Fortress, where she spent more than 13 years. While at Fortress, she was responsible for various real estate, healthcare, financial services, and infrastructure investments and oversaw equity capital markets transactions. Ms. Givens began her career in Investment Banking at Deutsche Bank.

Ms. Givens received a BA from Middlebury College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. 

Mark Glengarry

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - Sydney

Mark Glengarry is a Senior Managing Director and the Head of APAC for Private Credit Strategies in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in Sydney.  Mr. Glengarry handles the origination, execution and management of credit investments across the capital structure in the region. 

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Glengarry worked at Anchorage Capital Group for seven years as a Managing Director in both London and Sydney where he worked across all aspects of origination, execution and portfolio company management. Prior to Anchorage, Mr. Glengarry worked at Morgan Stanley in London as Head of Restructuring and Debt Advisory for EMEA. Prior to Morgan Stanley, Mr. Glengarry was a partner in the Banking and Finance Group at White & Case LLP in London.

Mr. Glengarry received a B.Com (Economics and Business Administration) and an LLB (First Class Honours) from the University of Canterbury. 

Devin Glenn

Managing Director

Human Resources - New York

Devin Glenn is the Global Head of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Blackstone.

She joined the firm from Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP where she was the Assistant Director of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. In that role, she advanced and increased awareness of the firm’s global diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, executed recruiting, retention, and client development initiatives, and launched an industry-leading diversity pipeline program for high-potential first-year law students. Prior to that, she held various positions related to diversity and inclusion at the law firm, as well as working as an associate in its banking and institutional investing division.

She received a BA from the University of Virginia and a JD from Columbia Law School. She is a member of the New York State Bar.

Kenny Glennon

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Kenny Glennon, CFA is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Glennon was a Managing Director at CAM Capital where he focused on external fund/manager selection, public/private equity investments and venture capital. Prior to joining CAM, Mr. Glennon was an analyst at The Raine Group LLC, a boutique merchant bank focusing on the technology, sports, media, and telecom sectors. While at Raine, Mr. Glennon worked on a variety of principal and advisory assignments and growth equity investments.

Mr. Glennon graduated magna cum laude from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania where he received a B.S. in Economics with concentrations in Finance and Legal Studies & Business Ethics. In addition, Mr. Glennon is a CFA charterholder.

Prior to that, she was a Portfolio Manager and Co-Founder of Land & Buildings – a real estate hedge fund based in Greenwich, CT. David Goldberg

Managing Director

Mitchell Golden

Sr. Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Mitch Golden is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA). Mr. Golden focuses on portfolio development, manager selection and evaluation, and ongoing monitoring for global hedge fund equity strategies.

Before joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Golden was the Founder and Chief Investment Officer of Kyndle Capital, a multi-family office. Prior to starting Kyndle, Mr. Golden was the Portfolio Manager of Greenlight Masters, a multi-manager fund affiliate of Greenlight Capital where he managed a portfolio of hedge fund, SPV, and direct investments. Mr. Golden held portfolio management and investment research roles at Senator Investment Group, Motu Capital and RH Capital.

Mr. Golden serves on the Family Circle committee of the Robin Hood Foundation, the advisory council of Human Development Services of Westchester and on the advisory board of the Abaarso School of Science and Technology. Mr. Golden received a BA with Honors and Distinction from Stanford University and earned an MBA with Honors from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Ana Gonzalez-Iglesias

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Gonzalez-Iglesias was an Executive Director at Morgan Stanley focusing primarily on commercial real estate loan originations. Prior to that, she focused on Debt Capital Markets transactions across sectors.

Robin Goodman

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Robin is Senior Managing Director and Chief Operating Officer for Blackstone’s Portfolio Operations team, based in New York. Robin also leads Asset Management for Blackstone’s Private Equity businesses, and previously led Asset Management for Blackstone's European private equity investments.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Goodman spent 12 years in GE Renewable Energy and Alstom Power where he was most recently Interim CEO for the Onshore Wind business in Europe and Africa and General Manager for Wind Services in Europe and Africa. Prior to joining GE/Alstom, Mr. Goodman worked for Mars & Co and Citigroup.

Natasha Gopaul

Sr. Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Natasha Gopaul is a Senior Managing Director in the Chief Legal Office and General Counsel of Private Equity.

Before joining Blackstone in 2016, Ms. Gopaul worked at Weil, Gotshal & Manges LLP in the Private Equity and Mergers and Acquisitions group in New York.  Prior to that, she worked at an international auction house and a research and policy institute at Princeton University.

Ms. Gopaul received a BA, summa cum laude, from the Princeton School of Public and International Affairs, and was elected Phi Beta Kappa, and a JD from Georgetown University Law Center, where she was a member of the Georgetown Journal of International Law. She is also a Term Member of the Council on Foreign Relations. She currently serves on the board of Sphera.

Mr. Graham received a BS from the University of Southern California.

Arielle Gross Samuels

Managing Director

Corporate Affairs - New York

Arielle Gross Samuels is a Managing Director and Blackstone’s Global Head of Marketing. She leads Blackstone's marketing function, inclusive of brand, digital, video, design and events. 

Prior to joining Blackstone, Samuels worked at Meta (FKA Facebook), serving as the Global Head of ESG Business and previously Business Lead of Global Business Marketing. Prior to Meta, Samuels worked at Deloitte in Engineering Consulting.  

Samuels serves on the board of the United Nations Foundation Girl Up, the 92NY CEO Council, and is a Founding Member of Chief. She earned a B.S. in Materials Science and Engineering from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Yan was head of quant research and member of the management committee of Stone Ridge Asset Management. Prior to joining Stone Ridge, Yan was head of research of quant equity at Magnetar Capital. Yan also worked as a quant researcher at Citadel and Lehman Brothers.

Yan received a Ph.D. in theoretical physics from UPenn, an M.S. from Stanford and B.S. from Fudan University in China.

Ms. Guerin began her career working in Compliance at Sovereign Bank.

Before joining Blackstone, Jan-Michael worked at GoldenTree Asset Management where he was responsible for structured product investments, focusing on asset backed, residential, CRE, and esoteric structured product transactions. Prior to that, Mr. Guerra was at Goldman Sachs where he was a trader on the RMBS and ABS credit desk.

Benji Guilford

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Benji Guilford is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Guilford is involved in sourcing, evaluating, and executing investment opportunities in the technology sector.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Guilford was a senior member of the software and technology investment team at Golub Capital. During his twelve-year tenure at Golub Capital, Mr. Guilford was responsible for originating, evaluating, and executing software and technology investments. Mr. Guilford also assisted with launching Golub Capital’s growth-stage technology investing platform and one of Golub Capital’s opportunistic credit funds. Prior to Golub Capital, Mr. Guilford worked in the Merchant Banking Group of the Chart Group, where he advised clients on mergers and acquisitions, as well as both debt and equity financings.

Mr. Guilford received an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and a BS in Accounting from Elon University.

Bridget Hagan

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Hagan was a founding partner at Mindset, an advocacy and advisory firm where she led the insurance practice group. Prior to his current role, Mr. Hager was involved in the origination, execution, and management of investments across the capital structure. Before joining Blackstone Credit, Mr. Hager was a member of Blackstone’s Restructuring & Reorganization Group where he worked with debtors and creditors on in-court and out-of-court restructurings.

Mr. Hager graduated from the Vienna University of Economics and Business and holds an MBA with Honors from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

At Black Diamond, Mr. Halal was primarily involved in fund management, administration and financial reporting for its private equity funds as well as financial reporting for the management company. Prior to BlackRock, Mr. Harrison ran the Capital Markets research team at the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, where he helped lead the analysis and communication of market and financial conditions to the Board.
 
Mr. Harrison received a Ph.D. and M.A. from Duke University and B.A. from Swarthmore College.

George Holding

Managing Director

Government Relations - Berkeley Square House London

George Holding is a Managing Director and European Head of Government Relations for Blackstone, based in London.

As a former Member of Congress, United States Attorney, counsel to a United States Senator, federal judge’s clerk and lawyer at a top 100 firm, he has handled a wide variety of issues on tax, trade, healthcare, foreign affairs, national security and intellectual property.

In the United States House of Representatives, Mr. Holding was Chairman of the British American Parliamentary Group (BAPG), the U.K. Caucus and the India Caucus.  He served as a Member of the Ways and Means Committee, Judiciary Committee, Foreign Affairs Committee, Budget Committee and Ethics Committee.  He has participated in the World Economic Forum, the European Parliament Transatlantic Dialogue and the NATO Parliamentary Assembly.

Mr. Holding has degrees in classical studies and law from Wake Forest University and attended The Groton School.

Tabea Hsi

Sr. Managing Director

Tabea Hsi is a Senior Managing Director and Deputy General Counsel of Blackstone. She is also Chief Operating Officer of the Legal & Compliance group.

Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Ms. Hsi practiced securities law at Davis Polk & Wardwell LLP. Prior to that, she worked in higher education and in the non-profit sector in Germany.

Ms. Hsi received a BA from the University of Virginia, an M.S.Ed. in Higher Education Management from the University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Education and a JD from the University of Pennsylvania Law School, where she was editor-in-chief of the Law Review.

Ed Huang

Sr. Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Hong Kong

Ed Huang is a Senior Managing Director and Head of Asia-Pacific (APAC) for Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions Group based in Hong Kong.

Mr. Huang joined Blackstone in 2012, and Private Wealth Solutions in 2024. Prior to his current role, Mr. Huang was COO of Asia Private Equity, Head of BCP Asia Acquisitions, and led Greater China and Korea for Blackstone’s Private Equity Group. Mr. Huang has led or been involved in Blackstone’s investments in Ennovi/Interplex, Geo-Young, SHP Packaging, Global Sources, Pactera, and Simone.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Huang was previously a Managing Director for China investments at Morgan Stanley Private Equity Asia and worked in investment banking for Morgan Stanley and Merrill Lynch in New York and Hong Kong.

Mr. Huang received a B.A. from Yale University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Mr. Huang serves as a director on the boards of Ennovi/Interplex, Geo-Young and SHP Packaging. He is also director on the boards of the China and Hong Kong Venture Capital and Private Equity Associations, and member of the Yale Asia Development Council. 

Hilary Hung

Sr. Managing Director

ICS - Hong Kong

Hilary Hung is a Senior Managing Director in the Institutional Client Solutions Group.  She is based in Hong Kong. Since joining Blackstone, Ms. Hung has been involved in raising capital for Blackstone's private investment funds. Before joining Blackstone in 2010, Ms. Hung worked at Goldman Sachs in Hong Kong in the Investment Banking Division. Ms. Hung received a BS in Economics from the Wharton School and a BA in International Relations from the University of Pennsylvania.

Avner Husen

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Avner Husen is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, where he is involved with the Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT) Strategy & Management team.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Husen worked at Fortress Investment Group, where he was a Partner and Investment Committee Member in the Credit and Real Estate business.  Prior to that, Mr. Husen was at the Carlyle Group in their U.S. Real Estate Funds.

Mr. Husen received an AB in Economics from the University of Chicago where he graduated with honors.

Thomas Iannarone

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Mr. Iannarone is a Senior Managing Director and the Chief Operating Officer of Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit. Previously, Mr. Iannarone was associate general counsel at Blackstone Credit, responsible for new business initiatives, daily trading and transaction activities and general legal and compliance matters.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2007 Mr. Iannarone worked at Morrison & Foerster in its corporate transaction group. Prior to that, he worked at Bingham McCutchen in its private equity and corporate practice groups.

Mr. Iannarone received a B.A. from Siena College and a J.D. from Villanova University School of Law.

Ken Iio

Managing Director

Tokyo-Regional Management - Tokyo

Ken Iio is a Managing Director for The Blackstone Group Japan K.K..

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Iio worked at Morgan Stanley Investment Management in Tokyo, where he was a Senior Advisor and a Management Director & Head of the Institutional Sales Division. Prior to joining Morgan Stanley in 2012, he spent 5 years with Allianz Global Investors, 7 years with Fidelity Investments Japan, and 16 years with the Bank of Tokyo.

Mr. Iio received a bachelor’s degree in Law from University of Tokyo.

Kenneth Ijomah

Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

Kenneth Ijomah is a Managing Director and European credit research analyst is involved with the ongoing analysis and evaluation of primary and secondary fixed income investments

Mr. Ijomah joined Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, at the time of GSO's acquisition of Harbourmaster Capital Management Limited in 2012.  Prior to that, Mr. Ijomah spent five years working as a credit analyst with Harbourmaster Capital Management.  Prior to working at Harbourmaster, Mr. Ijomah worked as a proprietary trader for Reminiscence Ltd with an equity focus on the New York and London stock exchanges.

Mr. Ijomah received a BS in Physics and French from Dublin City University.

Ek Indharameesup

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Ek Indharameesup is a Managing Director with GSO Capital Partners. Since joining GSO Capital in 2006, Mr. Indharameesup has been involved in the design, development, and support for all internal applications used by the management, operations, risk, legal, and accounting teams. Before joining GSO, Mr. Indharameesup was a Vice President in the Information Technology Group at Credit Suisse responsible for various development projects for the Alternative Capital Division and the Product Control group. Prior to that, he worked at Credit Suisse First Boston in Zurich as a development project manager for the Financial Reporting and Accounting Policy group. Before moving to Europe, Mr. Indharameesup was a senior developer responsible for the implementation of several management and regulatory reporting systems at CSFB in New York. Mr. Indharameesup received a BS in Computer Science from Columbia University and an MA in Economics from New York University.

Ryan Ingle

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Ryan Ingle is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Ingle has been involved in analyzing and managing real estate investments across several property sectors. Mr. Ingle currently leads asset management for Blackstone’s U.S. and Canadian industrial portfolios, Link Logistics and Pure Industrial, which together span more than 500 million square feet. Mr. Ingle has been involved in other notable investments including BioMed, IndCor, Motel 6, La Quinta and Extended Stay.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Ingle worked in Citi's real estate investment banking group.

Mr. Ingle received a BS in Finance and a BA in Spanish from the University of Kansas where he graduated with highest distinction. He currently serves on the board of directors of Carrix.

Tom Jack

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Tom Jack is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, based in New York. Since joining Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Jack has been involved in analyzing real estate investments in several property sectors and has worked on a variety of transactions, including the acquisition AIG’s affordable housing assets, the Cornerstone affordable housing portfolio, Extended Stay America, and Great Wolf Resorts.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Jack was a Vice President at Colony Capital where he worked on a variety of real estate transactions across the United States. Mr. Jack began his career at Goldman, Sachs & Co. in the Real Estate, Gaming and Lodging investment banking group.

Mr. Jack received a BS from the McIntire School at the University of Virginia, where he graduated with distinction.

Jonathan Jacoby

Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York 601 Lex

Jonathan A. Jacoby is a Managing Director and Head of Finance for Strategic Partners, having joined in 2020.

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. Jacoby was an Executive Director at GCM Grosvenor, where he was responsible for managing investment operations and shared responsibility for managing fund finance for the firm’s private equity, real estate and infrastructure investments. Prior to joining GCM Grosvenor, Mr. Jacoby was the Chief Financial Officer of Credit Suisse’s Customized Fund Investment Group. Mr. Jacoby previously worked as an auditor at KPMG LLP and Arthur Andersen, where he focused on auditing mutual and private equity funds.

Mr. Jacoby received a B.S. in Accounting from the University of Delaware and an MBA from Fordham University.

Max Jaffe

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Max Jaffe is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Jaffe was a Senior Analyst at The Solaris Group where he focused on building custom portfolios for private clients. Prior to The Solaris Group, Mr. Jaffe was an Associate at Ziff Brothers Investments where he worked in the Risk and Performance group.

Mr. Jaffe received a B.S. in Finance from the University of Montana. In addition, he serves on the Board of Puppies Behind Bars.

Ram Jagannath

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Ram Jagannath is the Global Head of Healthcare, responsible for investing across Blackstone’s Private Equity, Tactical Opportunities and Growth businesses, based in New York. Since joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Jagannath has led Blackstone’s investments in HealthEdge, Burgess Group, Bright Health, Cryoport (NASDAQ: CYRX), ZO Skin Health, Altruista Health, Ginger, Hydrogen Health, Wellframe, Medable, Life Science Logistics, and DNAnexus, and was involved in Blackstone’s investments in Alnylam/inclisiran royalty, Precision Medicine Group and Advarra. He is also a member of the Blackstone Growth Investment Committee and Chairman of the Portfolio Committee.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Jagannath was a founding Partner of Navab Capital Partners (NCP), where he was Head of Healthcare and a member of NCP’s Management and Investment Committees. Prior to NCP, he was a Managing Director of The Carlyle Group, focused on healthcare investments in Carlyle’s flagship US Buyout private equity fund. During his twelve years at Carlyle, Mr. Jagannath was a member of the teams which invested in One Medical Group, Pharmaceutical Product Development, X-Chem, Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, Healthscope Ltd., and HCR ManorCare. Previously, he worked at Genstar Capital and Thomas Weisel Capital Partners.

Mr. Jagannath currently serves on the Board of Directors of HealthEdge, Cryoport, ZO Skin Health, Headspace Health and Life Science Logistics and as a Board Observer of Medable and ConnectiveRx. He also serves on the Board of Visitors of the Duke University Pratt School of Engineering and on the Kellogg School of Management Private Equity Advisory Council, as well as on the Board of the Navy SEAL Foundation. Mr. Jagannath was previously a term member of the Council on Foreign Relations.

Mr. Jagannath received a BSE in Biomedical and Electrical Engineering with a minor in Economics from Duke University, a J.D. from the Northwestern University Pritzker School of Law, and an MBA from the Northwestern University Kellogg School of Management. After Duke, he was a Fulbright Scholar in Economic Development at the University of Zagreb in Croatia.

Rohit S Jain

Managing Director

Real Estate - Sydney

Rohit Sharan Jain is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in Sydney.

Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Jain has been involved with asset management and transaction activities across Europe, Singapore and Australia, on a variety of real estate classes including hospitality, gaming, office, residential and logistics. He has worked in the London and Hong Kong offices of Blackstone before joining the Sydney office in 2022.

Mr. Jain received a Masters in Finance from the London School of Economics (LSE) in London, and has also completed all three levels of the chartered financial analyst (CFA) program.

Alok Jain is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group.

Since joining Blackstone, Mr. Jain has been involved in evaluating real estate investments in several property types.

Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Jain worked as a Hardware Engineer with Nvidia Graphics and was involved in designing and verifying complex computer chips. He completed his MBA in Finance from the Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Bangalore.

Christopher James

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Prior to launching Tactical Opportunities in 2012, Mr. James had been involved in the execution of Blackstone strategic initiatives and investments across a variety of asset classes including the firm’s initial public offering and the firm’s investments in GSO, Pátria Investimentos and Strategic Partners. He has served on the boards of various Blackstone portfolio companies.

Mr. James received a BS from Duke University and a JD from Harvard Law School. He currently serves on the Board of Trustees of Prep for Prep and Riverdale Country School.

Gadi Jay

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Gadi Jay is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate group and responsible for European Real Estate Capital Markets, based in London. Since joining the firm in 2014, Mr. Jay has been involved in the financing of all European real estate investments including asset, stock and portfolio-level financings and in obtaining fund-level leverage utilized by Blackstone’s European real estate investment vehicles. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Jay spent 3 years at HSBC Global Banking & Markets where he was a Vice President based in London, focusing on financing and debt advisory mandates across Europe. Prior to that Mr. Jay spent 2 years at HSBC Private Bank in New York and London. Mr. Jay graduated from City University with an LLB (Honors) in Law and Property Valuation.

Adam Jenkins

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Adam Jenkins is a Senior Managing Director and Global Head of Portfolio Management for Blackstone’s Private Equity platforms. Mr. Jenkins is responsible for monitoring performance across the global private equity portfolio, driving strategic prioritization of the firm’s operational resources, and developing financial, operational, and investing insights from Blackstone’s business ecosystem.

Previously, Mr. Jenkins focused on private equity investments in the energy sector, and has been involved with the firm’s investments in Beacon Offshore Energy, Brix Oil & Gas, Falcon Minerals Corp., Kosmos Energy, LLOG Bluewater, Royal Resources, Siccar Point Energy, and Vine Oil & Gas. He currently serves on the board of Beacon Offshore Energy.

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Jenkins evaluated and executed investments at WL Ross & Co. He began his career at Lazard Ltd.

Mr. Jenkins received a BA, summa cum laude from Yale College, and a JD, magna cum laude from Harvard Law School. He is a member of the New York State Bar.

Patrick Jennings

Managing Director

Anand Jha

Managing Director

Government Relations - Mumbai

Anand Vijay Jha is a Managing Director, Government Relations, India. He helps navigate political, legislative, and regulatory risk for the firm and provides advice to portfolio companies on related matters.

Before Joining Blackstone, Anand worked as the Chief Corporate Affairs Officer for United Breweries (a Heineken Group company) and Walmart in India. He was responsible for all issues on Public Affairs, Communications and ESG for these companies.

Anand was an Indian Civil Servant for two decades. He has worked as a policy maker and implementer with several Indian government departments, as well as a land development and anti-trust regulator for the government of India. His last assignment with government of India was with the Competition Commission of India (CCI) as Additional Director General (Investigations).

Anand received an LLM from Durham University (UK), and an MBA from FMS University of Delhi. He is a graduate in Mathematics (BSc.) and Law (LLB) from the University of Delhi. He is a member of Oxford University, Said Business School’s Corporate Affairs Academy.

Tim Johnson

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Timothy Johnson is the Global Head of Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies, based in New York. Mr. Johnson is responsible for overseeing Blackstone’s commercial and residential real estate debt investment strategies and is also a member of the firm’s real estate investment committee.

Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Johnson was a co-founder of BroadPeak Funding, a boutique commercial real estate finance company based in Los Angeles. Prior to founding BroadPeak, Mr. Johnson was a Vice President in the Lehman Brothers Global Commercial Real Estate Group where he worked from 2002-2008.

Mr. Johnson received a BA in Mathematics from the College of the Holy Cross where he graduated cum laude.

Laura Johnson

Managing Director

BXCI - San Francisco

Laura Johnson is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit, and Insurance (BXCI) based in San Francisco. Ms. Johnson is principally involved in originating and executing opportunities with high growth companies in the technology sector.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Johnson was a senior member of the investment team at ORIX Growth Capital where she was responsible for originating and underwriting mid to late-stage software and fintech investments. Prior to ORIX Growth Capital, Ms. Johnson led FP&A and Strategy at RichRelevance, a San Francisco based software company. Ms. Johnson began her career at Prudential Capital Group where she was responsible for underwriting investment opportunities in the middle market.

Ms. Johnson received an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a BS in Finance from the University of San Francisco.   

Kristin Johnston

Managing Director

Finance - New York

Kristin Johnston is a Managing Director in the Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis group and is involved with management reporting, financial planning, budgeting, and earnings preparation. Previously, Ms. Johnston was in various strategic and financial roles with the firm including positions with the Strategic Incentives, Business Development, Private Equity valuations and Corporate Finance groups. She was involved with various strategic planning projects including the firm’s initial public offering, bond issuances, spin-off of PJT Partners and the conversion to a C-Corp.

Ms. Johnston received a BBA in International Business and Finance from James Madison University with distinction and has earned the right to use the Chartered Financial Analyst designation. She is a member of the CFA Institute and the CFA Society of New York. Ms. Johnston is on the Blackstone Charitable Foundation Leadership Council, the Finance Women’s Network Steering Committee and Finance Integration and Training Committee.

Graham Jones

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Graham Jones is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Jones is responsible for the origination of U.S. CLOs with a focus on CLO structuring, and is involved with structured credit investments, both making investment recommendations and monitoring current positions.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Jones worked at Morgan Stanley, where he was responsible for the structuring and marketing of U.S. CLO transactions. Mr. Jones was at various times responsible for structuring and origination of reREMICs and other securitized products. Mr. Jones began his career in management consulting.

Mr. Jones received a BA from Cambridge University and an MBA in Finance from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, graduating as Palmer Scholar.

Chris Joseph

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Chris Joseph is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit.  He is involved with originating and executing upon investments in the energy, energy transition, and sustainability sectors.

Before joining Blackstone Credit, Mr. Joseph worked in the Global Natural Resources Investment Banking group at Goldman Sachs, where he advised on mergers and acquisitions and debt and equity capital raises for companies within the energy and energy transition sectors.  Prior to that, Mr. Joseph began his career at Lehman Brothers in the Fixed Income Division.

Mr. Joseph received a BA in Economics from Cornell University and an MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

David Kaden

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

David Kaden is a Senior Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities Group, where he is involved in the execution of the firm’s investments. Tac Opps is Blackstone’s opportunistic investment business which invests globally across asset classes and industries and seeks to identify and execute on attractive, differentiated investment opportunities. Mr. Kaden is currently a member of the Board of Directors of ARKA, Draken and Diamonds Direct and an observer to the board of Bridger Aerospace and Cargo X. 

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Kaden worked at the White House where he was the Director for International Economics on the National Security Council and National Economic Council. He previously served as the assistant chief of staff to the President and CEO of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

Mr. Kaden received an AB from Harvard College, a JD from Yale Law School, and served as a law clerk to Judge Jose A. Cabranes on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. He is a term member of the Council on Foreign Relations.

Kelli Kahn

Kelli Kahn is the Global Co-Head and Managing Director in the Conference and Event Management group.

Before joining Blackstone in 2010, Ms. Kahn worked as an Assistant Vice President in Events for Bank of America Merrill Lynch supporting various businesses globally. Prior to that, she also worked for Condé Nast publications and with SFX Sports Management.

Ms. Kahn received a BA in Communication, cum laude, with a major in Public Relations and a minor in Global Studies from Marist College. She also studied at Bond University in Queensland, Australia. Ms. Kahn is a member of the Council of Protocol Executives and Meeting Professionals International.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kantt was a Senior Vice President at Starwood Capital Group, where he most recently led corporate real estate acquisitions in the Americas. Mr. Kantt began his career at Deutsche Bank in the Commercial Real Estate group.

Ryan Karnes

Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Karnes has worked on real estate investments across several property sectors, including the acquisition of GLP’s U.S. logistics business, the privatizations of Gramercy Property Trust and PS Business Parks, as well as a variety of other transactions contributing to the growth of Blackstone's industrial platform in the U.S. (Link Logistics).

Gabi Karnes

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Gabrielle Karnes is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group at Blackstone. She currently focuses on strategy for Blackstone Property Partners U.S., one of Blackstone’s U.S. Core+ vehicles.

Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Ms. Karnes focused on new investment opportunities in North America with a particular focus on the retail sector. She also worked on real estate investments across several other property sectors including the acquisition of GE Capital’s real estate business and the recapitalization of BioMed Realty.

Ms. Karnes received a BA in Mathematics and Economics with a minor in Political Science from Northwestern University, where she graduated cum laude, and received an MBA from Harvard Business School. 

Gemma Kataky

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Gemma Kataky is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and is based in London.

Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Kataky has been involved in Blackstone’s real estate asset management activities, with a particular focus on UK investments. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Kataky spent seven years as an Associate Director at The Carlyle Group, focused on investment opportunities and asset management across Europe and prior to that spent two years at BAML on the M&A team.

Ms. Kataky received a BA in Economics from Durham University in 2005, where she graduated with First Class Honors. Ms. Kataky currently serves on the board of Sage Housing, The Office Group, ArchCo, and iQ Student Housing and is a trustee on the LandAid Charitable foundation.

Matt Katz

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Matt Katz is a Senior Managing Director and the Global Head of Data Science for Blackstone. He leads Blackstone’s team of data scientists and in this capacity partners with management teams and operators to accelerate growth across Blackstone’s portfolio companies by leveraging data science. He and his team additionally work closely with Blackstone’s investment teams to provide a differentiated viewpoint through advanced analytics during the investment process.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Katz was a Vice President at Point72 Asset Management where he focused on data science and investing. He began his career at Credit Suisse.

Mr. Katz graduated with honors from Princeton University. He serves on the advisory board of Virginia Tech’s Academy of Data Science and is on the Blackstone Charitable Foundation Leadership Council. In 2022, he was named a World Economic Forum Young Global Leader.

Alex Katz

Managing Director

Government Relations - New York

Alex Katz is a Managing Director of Government Relations. Mr. Katz helps navigate political, legislative, and regulatory risk for the firm and provides advice to portfolio companies on related matters.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Katz was a senior aide to U.S. Senate Democratic Leader Charles E. Schumer. In the Senate, Mr. Katz served as Director of Intergovernmental Affairs and Special Assistant to the Senator before helping to run Mr. Schumer’s successful re-election campaign in 2016. During the 2018 midterm elections Mr. Katz was named Senior Advisor to the Senate Majority PAC, the principal super PAC aimed at electing Democrats to the upper chamber. Prior to his time in the Senate, Mr. Katz worked for New York City Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg in the Office of Policy and Strategic Planning. He also worked in Chicago City Hall under Mayor Rahm Emanuel. During the 2020 election, Mr. Katz served on the Biden for President National Finance Committee.

Mr. Katz holds a Bachelor of Science from Northwestern University. Mr. Katz currently sits on the board of Blackstone portfolio company LifeScience Logistics. He is also a Trustee of the Washington Institute for Near East Policy and serves on the Board of Advisors for the Mayor’s Fund to Advance New York City.

Daniel Katz

Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Daniel Katz is a Managing Director at Blackstone and the Chief Product Officer of Blackstone Private Equity Strategies (BXPE). He is also focused on driving fund marketing initiatives as well as investor relations for Blackstone Tactical Opportunities and Blackstone Growth.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Katz was a Director in the Private Fund Group at Credit Suisse Securities where he was focused on project management. Prior to Credit Suisse, Mr. Katz was an Associate covering Healthcare at BMO Capital Markets and the Northeast Finance Director for the Democratic National Committee.

Mr. Katz received a BA from the University of Michigan and an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Jonathan Kaufman

Sr. Managing Director

Blackstone Capital Markets - New York

Jonathan Kaufman is the Global Head of Blackstone Capital Markets (BXCM), responsible for the debt and equity financing activity across broader Blackstone Private Equity, including Blackstone Energy Partners, Tactical Opportunities, Infrastructure, and Blackstone Growth and Life Sciences. BXCM has structured and led over $500bn of issuance since inception. Mr. Kaufman also works across Blackstone’s credit investing platforms to generate capital deployment and revenue opportunities.

Mr. Kaufman joined Blackstone in 2007 and previously worked as a Vice President in the Restructuring & Reorganization Group, where he advised a number of companies and lenders in their chapter 11 proceedings, out-of-court restructurings, and special situation investments. Prior to Blackstone, Mr. Kaufman was a Manager of M&A at Platinum Equity, where he evaluated and executed private equity investments in a wide range of industries.

Mr. Kaufman received a BA in History from Amherst College, where he graduated magna cum laude, and an MBA with high honors from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. Mr. Kaufman is a member of the Board of Trustees of Park Children’s Day School.

Brian Kaufman

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Brian Kaufman is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and currently leads asset management for Blackstone’s U.S. hospitality and student housing portfolios, including BRE Hotels & Resorts, Extended Stay America, Great Wolf Resorts, G6 Hospitality and American Campus Communities.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Kaufman was the Managing Partner of The Kaufman Companies, a privately held hospitality investment, development and asset management group in the U.S. and Europe. He previously worked at Highgate Capital Investment as a Senior Vice President of Acquisitions and at Goldman Sachs & Co in the Merchant Banking Division. He began his career at Lehman Brothers in the Global Real Estate Group. 

Mr. Kaufman received a BS from Cornell University in 2008. He currently serves on Dean’s Advisory Board at the Cornell Nolan School, SC Johnson College of Business as well as the Advisory Board of the Nolan Center for Real Estate and Finance. He has been recognized for his social impact and philanthropic efforts and, in 2022, received the Peter G. Peterson Award. Mr. Kaufman is also a member of The Council on Foreign Relations.

Managing Director

Corporate Affairs - New York

Jeff Kauth is a Managing Director in the Global Corporate Affairs Group. He focuses on global public affairs for the Blackstone Real Estate business, serving as a media spokesperson and advising on communications issues.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kauth was Managing Director at Joele Frank, a leading financial PR firm, where he advised clients on a wide range of public facing issues and communications challenges. Prior to that, Mr. Kauth held roles with Renaissance Technologies and Abbott Capital Management. Mr. Kauth began his career at Bear Stearns as an investment banker.

Mr. Kauth received his BS in applied economics and management from Cornell University and his MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Prior to that, Mr. Kearns was an Analyst at UBS Investment Bank in Melbourne.

Katie Keenan

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Katie Keenan is Global Chief Operating Officer of Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies Group, which originates loans and invests in securities in commercial and residential real estate on behalf of funds, REITs and insurance capital. Ms. Keenan is also Chief Executive Officer of Blackstone Mortgage Trust (NYSE:BXMT), a publicly-traded commercial mortgage REIT managed by Blackstone that originates senior loans collateralized by commercial real estate in North America, Europe and Australia.

Before joining Blackstone in 2012, Ms. Keenan held positions at G2 Investment Group, Lubert-Adler Real Estate Funds and in the Real Estate Investment Banking Group at Lehman Brothers.

Ms. Keenan graduated cum laude with an A.B. in History from Harvard College. She sits on the Board of Directors of Getting Out and Staying Out and the Advisory Board of Governors of NAREIT, and is a member of WX New York Women Executives in Real Estate.

Laura Keenan

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Laura S. Keenan is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Ms. Keenan joined Blackstone in 2013 as an analyst in the Finance department, and in 2015 joined the Institutional Client Solutions team focusing on investor relations and client service.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Keenan worked as an auditor in the Financial Services Office at Ernst & Young LLP.

Ms. Keenan received a BS in Accountancy with a minor in Finance and graduated magna cum laude from Villanova University’s School of Business. Ms. Keenan holds Series 7, 79 & 63 licenses with FINRA.

Jonathan Kelly

Sr. Managing Director

Infrastructure - London

Mr. Kelly is a Senior Managing Director in the Infrastructure Group and European Head of Infrastructure for Blackstone, based in London. Since joining Blackstone, Mr. Kelly has been involved in the execution of Blackstone Infrastructure’s investments in Autostrade per I’Italia (ASPI) and Mundys, while also serving on the Board of Directors for ASPI, Mundys, including Mundys’ subsidiaries Abertis and Telepass, and Phoenix Tower International. Mr. Kelly also currently serves on the Board of Directors of The Childhood Trust.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Kelly was a Managing Partner at Brookfield Asset Management, where he spent over 12 years. During his time at Brookfield he worked in various global offices including in Australia, Europe and North America. His most recent role at Brookfield was as Head of Europe for Brookfield Infrastructure, as well as Global Chief Investment Officer for Data Infrastructure and Utilities. He previously served as a Director of BUUK Infrastructure, Wireless Infrastructure Group, TdF, Ascenty, Evoque Data Centers, Enwave North America, among others. Prior to joining Brookfield, Mr. Kelly worked at CIBC World Markets.

Mr. Kelly graduated from Queen’s University with a Bachelor of Commerce (Hons.) in 2005.

Kevin Kennedy

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Kevin Kennedy is a Managing Director in the Technology and Innovations group and focuses on the firm’s cyber defense capabilities.

Before joining Blackstone, Kevin held positions as CTO and CISO across several financial organizations in the banking and alternative asset management sectors.

He earned his BA from Columbia University, an MS in Cybersecurity from Brown University, and is currently an adjunct professor in Cybersecurity at John Jay University. Kevin is a former United States Marine, Iraq War Veteran, and co-founder of ReferVets.org – a non-profit platform that helps veterans get back to work.

David Kestnbaum

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

David Kestnbaum is a Senior Managing Director in the Private Equity Group. He currently leads investments in the Media & Entertainment, Communications, and Business Services sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Kestnbaum has led or been involved in Blackstone’s current investments in Alight Solutions, Ancestry, Candle Media, Encore, Merlin Entertainments, Packers Sanitation Services Inc. (PSSI), SERVPRO, SESAC, and Tradesmen, as well as prior investments in AlliedBarton Security Services, AVINTIV, Cloverleaf Cold Storage, DJO Global, and Outerstuff.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kestnbaum was a Vice President of Vestar Capital Partners, and was previously a member of JPMorgan’s Financial Sponsor Group.

Mr. Kestnbaum holds a BA in Political Science from The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. He currently is a Director of Alight Solutions, Ancestry, Candle Media, Encore, SERVPRO, SESAC, and Tradesmen. He is a member of the Choate Rosemary Hall Alumni Association Executive Committee and previously represented Blackstone as a Partnership for New York City Rockefeller Fellow.

Jas Khaira

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Jasvinder Khaira is a Senior Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities Group. He is involved in investments in the digital infrastructure, software and consumer sectors. He has been involved in a number of Blackstone’s current and past investments including Global Tower Partners, Phoenix Towers International, Hotwire Communications, Wireless Capital Partners, Ascenty, Sipartech, Diamonds Direct, Pretium and Lundin Gold. Mr. Khaira has also been involved in several investments in structured credit, whole loan acquisitions and regulatory capital. Prior to joining Tactical Opportunities, Mr. Khaira was a member of Blackstone’s Private Equity Group and Blackstone Credit and was involved in the execution of the firm’s initial public offering and the firm’s investment in GSO. 

Mr. Khaira received a BS in Business and a BA in History from the University of California, Berkeley, where he graduated magna cum laude and was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. 

Jasmine Khambatta

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Jasmine Khambatta is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group where she handles portfolio operations and asset management for Blackstone’s North American private equity investments.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Khambatta served as Vice President and General Manager at TE Connectivity. Previously, Ms. Khambatta served as Sr. Vice President of Strategy and Operational Excellence at Schindler Elevator Corporation, Group President of IAQ at Filtration Group, and Vice President and General Manager of Indoor Lighting at Acuity Brands Corporation. Earlier in her career she held marketing and operations leadership roles at Danaher Corporation.

Ms. Khambatta received a BS in Industrial and Operations Engineering, cum laude, from the University of Michigan and completed her MBA at the Darden School of Business at the University of Virginia.

Bilal Khan

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Bilal Khan is a Senior Managing Director in the Private Equity Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2009, Mr. Khan has been involved in the execution of several Blackstone investments, including various Sithe Global investments, Fisterra Energy, Transmission Developers, Aypa Power, Onyx Renewables, Legence, Array Technologies, Enstall (formerly known as Esdec Solar Group) and Xpansiv.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Khan was an Associate at GTCR Golder Rauner, where he was involved with the analysis and execution of private equity investments in a wide range of industries. Prior to that, Mr. Khan worked in the Mergers and Acquisitions department at Lazard Frères focused on Power & Utilities clients.

Mr. Khan received a BS in Applied Economics from Cornell University, where he graduated magna cum laude. He also received an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and an MA in International Studies from the University of Pennsylvania. Mr. Khan serves as a Director of Fisterra Energy, Transmission Developers, Aypa Power, Legence, Array Technologies and Xpansiv.

Amer Khatoun

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - London

Amer Khatoun is a Senior Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities Group in London. Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Khatoun has been involved in the execution of the firm’s investments in De Nora, Beauparc, Superbet, HH Global and Lombard. He serves as a Director of Beauparc, HH Global and Lombard.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Khatoun was a Senior Associate with H.I.G. Capital in London where he was involved with the analysis and execution of mid-market private equity transactions across a number of sectors. Prior to that, Mr. Khatoun was an analyst with Goldman Sachs and Citi in London, where he worked in their Mergers & Acquisitions divisions.

Mr. Khatoun received a BSc in Economics and Politics from the University of Bristol.

Raphael Kiam

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Raphael Kiam is a Managing Director in Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies group. Mr. Kiam is actively involved in the investment operations for BREDS liquids products.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Kiam was a Business Consultant for Wall Street Systems Inc., a company that provides treasury software to large corporations and central banks. Prior to that role, Mr. Kiam was a Vice President in Finance, for Merrill Lynch Bank & Trust, overseeing the accounting for the bank’s investment and derivatives portfolio. Prior to that role, Mr. Kiam spent five years as a Manager in the Financial Services Risk Management Group at Ernst & Young LLP providing advisory services surrounding derivatives accounting as well as structured finance transactions.

Mr. Kiam began his career with Arthur Andersen LLP as an advisor in the Financial and Commodity Risk Consulting group. Mr. Kiam received a BA in economics from the University of Illinois.

Maha Kiani

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Maha Kiani is a Managing Director and the Head of Asset Management for the Asset Based Finance and Private High-Grade businesses in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Kiani was a Director at Hudson Structured Capital Management. In that role, she originated and invested in transportation related assets across the capital structure. Prior to Hudson, Ms. Kiani was an analyst focused on aviation at Brigade Capital Management, where she originated and managed a hard asset portfolio of over 100+ aircraft.

Ms. Kiani graduated with high distinction with a Bachelor of Commerce from Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto. She also holds a CPA from the Canadian Institute of Chartered Accountants. 

Brian Kim

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Brian Kim is the Global Chief Operating Officer of Core+ Real Estate and the Head of Acquisitions and Capital Markets of Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT). Since joining Blackstone in 2008, Mr. Kim has played a key role in a number of Blackstone’s investments including the take private and subsequent sale of Strategic Hotels & Resorts, the acquisition of Peter Cooper Village / Stuyvesant Town and the creation of BRE Select Hotels Corp., Blackstone’s select service hotel platform.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Kim worked at Apollo Real Estate Advisors, Max Capital Management Corp. and Credit Suisse First Boston. Mr. Kim has served as a board member of Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust since January 2021 and previously served as a board member of CorePoint Lodging Inc. and a board member, Chief Financial Officer, Vice President and Managing Director of BRE Select Hotels Corp.

Mr. Kim received an AB in Biology from Harvard College where he graduated with honors.

Carol Kim

Sr. Managing Director

ICS - Hong Kong

Carol Kim is a Senior Managing Director and Head of the Institutional Client Solutions Group in Asia and is based in Hong Kong. Since joining Blackstone, Ms. Kim has been involved with investor relations and new business development in Asia. Before joining Blackstone in 2008, Ms. Kim was based in New York as a Vice President in the Absolute Return Strategies Group at Lehman Brothers, where she was responsible for client communications and reporting to its hedge fund and fund of hedge funds clients. Prior to joining Lehman, she was Director of Marketing at Continuity Capital, LLC and a Marketing Associate at P. Schoenfeld Asset Management. Ms. Kim began her career in investor relations at LG Electronics in Korea and Allied Properties in Toronto. Ms. Kim received a BA in Urban and Economic Studies from the University of Toronto. She is a Co-Founder and Board member of 100 Women in Finance.

Lydia Kim

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Lydia Kim is a Managing Director of Blackstone in the Private Wealth Solutions group and Head of Product Origination. Ms. Kim is involved in product origination, including product development efforts that deliver Blackstone’s asset management capabilities to private clients and portfolio management of Blackstone Total Alternatives Solution (BTAS). Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Ms. Kim has been involved in the launch of the BTAS program and oversees the execution and portfolio management of the BTAS funds. In addition, Ms. Kim has been actively involved in the creation and implementation of global retail solutions for Blackstone.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Kim worked in the Merrill Lynch Alternative Investments group where she served as primary relationship manager for several alternative investment managers and worked on the origination and product management of hedge funds.

Ms. Kim graduated magna cum laude with a BS in Finance and a BS in Accounting from New York University’s Leonard N. Stern School of Business as part of the distinguished Stern Scholars Program.

Chris Kim

Managing Director

Real Estate - Seoul

Chris Kim is a Managing Director and the Head of Real Estate – Korea based in Seoul. He is involved with the day-to-day management of real estate investment activities in Korea.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kim worked at Angelo Gordon & Co. where he was Co-Head of Korea Real Estate responsible for sourcing and executing real estate transactions in Korea.

Mr. Kim received a B.A. in Business Administrations from Yonsei University and is fluent in Korean and English.

Brendan King

Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York

Brendan M. King is a Managing Director, having joined Strategic Partners in 2009. Mr. King is an advisory board member of multiple funds.

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. King attended Binghamton University where he graduated with a B.S. cum laude in Management & Finance. Mr. King subsequently earned the C.F.A. designation.

Mike Kirkman

Managing Director

Blackstone Growth - San Francisco

Mike Kirkman is a Managing Director in Blackstone Growth (BXG) where he is focused on investments in the Healthcare sector. Mr. Kirkman is based in San Francisco.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kirkman was a Director at GI Partners where he helped lead investment activity in the healthcare and software sectors. During his time at GI, he invested in and served on the boards of such companies as Netsmart, Generate Life Sciences, Clinical Ink, and MRI Software. Prior to GI, Mr. Kirkman was with JLL Partners in New York, where he began his investing career, focusing on private equity investments in North America. Mr. Kirkman currently serves on the board of the San Francisco Private Equity Network.

Mr. Kirkman holds a BS from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia and an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Lee Kirschbaum

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Lee Kirschbaum is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group where he focuses on portfolio operations and asset management for Blackstone’s Private Equity investments in the technology sector.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kirschbaum served as Executive Vice President, Fraud, Communications and Contact Center Solutions at TransUnion. Previously, Mr. Kirschbaum served as Executive Vice President at Neustar, Senior Vice President at Opus, and President of Kroll’s Compliance division. Earlier in his career, Mr. Kirschbaum held strategy and operating roles at Dun & Bradstreet, Qwest Communications, and Capgemini.

Mr. Kirschbaum received a BA in Economics from the University of Chicago where he graduated with honors and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

Since joining Blackstone in 2008, Mr. Kitta has been involved in analyzing various real estate investment opportunities in Japan.

Jacob Kleinberger

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Miami

Jacob Kleinberger is a Managing Director and Head of Platform Solutions with Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions Group. In this role, he oversees the development of the Group’s business intelligence capabilities.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Kleinberger worked at Merrill Lynch, where he held various corporate strategy roles and was an analyst in the investment banking division.

Mr. Kleinberger received a BS in Finance and a BS in Economics from the University of Central Florida, where he graduated magna cum laude. He earned an MBA in Finance from the Stern School of Business at New York University.

Kelly Klobucar

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Kelly Klobucar is a Managing Director and Chief Learning Officer within the Private Wealth Solutions group. Ms. Klobucar is involved in learning and development, recruiting, career development, and other programmatic initiatives. Ms. Klobucar has held a variety of roles within Private Wealth Solutions since joining the firm in 2016, initially leading the Independent Wealth Management internal sales team and more recently was a member of the Global Strategic Partnerships team.

Before joining Blackstone in 2016, Ms. Klobucar was head of Intermediary Internal Sales at Schroder Investment Management. Prior to Schroders, she was a Senior Relationship Manager at FBR Capital Markets where she focused on Registered Investment Advisors in the Northeast region of the US. Ms. Klobucar received a BA in Communications from Boston College.

Mike Knauss

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Mike Knauss is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance department and Chief Compliance Officer of the Infrastructure business.

Before joining Blackstone in 2018, Mr. Knauss practiced law at Ropes & Gray LLP, where he represented investment advisers and registered and private fund clients with a focus on fund formation, derivatives, and regulatory matters. Prior to that role, Mr. Knauss served as a law clerk to the Honorable Frederic Block of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York. Before clerking, Mr. Knauss was Senior Vice President, Head of Strategic Initiatives at Allianz Global Investors Distributors LLC, the distributor for the retail and institutional PIMCO and Allianz funds.

Mr. Knauss received his undergraduate degree from Duke University with Distinction and received a JD from Brooklyn Law School, where he was Associate Managing Editor of the Law Review.

Heidi Kniesel

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - Berkeley Square House London

Ms. Kniesel is the Head of EMEA Compliance for Blackstone, based in London. She joined the Firm in September 2021 as a Managing Director in Real Estate – Asset Management, as Global Head of Portfolio Company Risk.

Prior to joining Blackstone Ms. Kniesel was a Managing Director at Goldman Sachs (GS), where she was International Head of Compliance for their Real Estate Division and Head of Compliance for GS offices in Europe and the Middle East.

Heidi obtained her MBA in 2014 from Edinburgh Business School of the Heriot-Watt University.

Peter Koffler

Sr. Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Peter Koffler is a Senior Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Group, focusing on Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA). His previous positions at Blackstone include General Counsel of BXMA, Global Chief Compliance Officer of Blackstone and Chief Compliance Officer of BXMA.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2006, Mr. Koffler served as General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer of Twenty-First Securities Corporation, an institutional trading and investment firm. Mr. Koffler began his legal career at Baer Marks & Upham.

Mr. Koffler received a BA from the State University of New York at Binghamton. He received a JD, with honors, from Hofstra University School of Law, where he served as an editor of the Law Review.

Paul Kolodziej

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York 601 Lex

Paul Kolodziej is a Managing Director with Blackstone Real Estate.  He serves as the Chief Accounting Officer of Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust, Inc. (“BREIT”) and the Head of Accounting for Blackstone Mortgage Trust.  Paul also previously served as Controller of BREIT from June 2016 to March 2019.

Prior to joining Blackstone in June 2016, Mr. Kolodziej was a Senior Manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, where he provided assurance services to financial service clients focused on REITs, private real estate funds and hedge funds. During his time at PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, Mr. Kolodziej also completed a two-year rotation in PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP’s SEC Services Group within their National Office, focusing on client consultations over a wide range of matters related to security registrations and on-going SEC filing requirements.

Mr. Kolodziej received a BS in Accountancy from DePaul University and is a Certified Public Accountant.

Zaneta Koplewicz

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Zaneta Koplewicz is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and the Head of Shareholder Relations for Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (“BREIT”).

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Koplewicz spent fourteen years at BlackRock where she was most recently a Managing Director responsible for developing and growing relationships with large, strategic clients in North America. Prior to that, she held several roles within BlackRock Alternative Investors including Head of Product Strategy for the Event Driven business, where she led client engagement and business strategy for the platform across institutional and private wealth clients. Ms. Koplewicz was also instrumental in BlackRock’s sustainability efforts, leading a global working group which served as a key catalyst for the establishment of BlackRock Sustainable and Transition Solutions.

Ms. Koplewicz received a BA in Politics with a certificate in African American Studies from Princeton University. 

Nancy Korb

Managing Director

Human Resources - New York

Nancy Korb is the Global Head of Real Estate Human Resources. With more than 20 years of global HR experience, Ms. Korb has held senior HR Global Business Advisor positions at JP Morgan covering Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate Investment Bank and served as Head of HR for Latin America and Canada for three years. Prior to JPMorgan, Nancy served in various business partner roles at Citi as well as in the Compensation and Recruiting functions.

Nancy holds Bachelor of Arts and Master’s degrees from Columbia University in New York.

Matt Koskinen

Managing Director

Real Estate - Sydney

Matt Koskinen is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and is based in Sydney. Mr. Koskinen is involved in the asset management of Blackstone’s Australian investments.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Koskinen worked in real estate investment banking at Goldman Sachs where he was involved in a variety of M&A, equity and debt transactions. Prior to Goldman Sachs, Mr. Koskinen worked in real estate equity research at Macquarie covering Australia and Canada. Mr. Koskinen began his career in real estate asset management at Standard Life.

Mr. Koskinen received a BBA from Wilfrid Laurier University and is a CFA charterholder.

Peter Krause

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Peter Krause is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and is based in London. Mr. Krause currently focuses on Blackstone’s real estate acquisitions in the logistics sector across Europe. Since joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Krause has been involved in a number of Blackstone’s logistics investments in Europe, including Logicor, Mileway, St. Modwen Properties plc, and Hansteen Holdings plc.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Krause worked at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where he was an Analyst in the Real Estate Investment Banking group.

Mr. Krause received an A.B in Economics from Harvard College and a J.D from Harvard Law School where he was twice named a Dean’s Scholar.

Kevin Kresge

Managing Director

BXCI - New York 601 Lex

Kevin Kresge is a Managing Director and Head of Finance for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Kresge served as Chief Financial Officer of the Private Wealth Solutions (“PWS”) group overseeing strategic planning, financial reporting, data management and business analytics. Prior to PWS, Mr. Kresge served as Chief Administrative Officer of the Strategic Incentives Group, responsible for the global execution, reporting compliance and technology related to the firm's compensation programs and systems. Prior to that, Mr. Kresge was Head of Financial Planning and Analysis with responsibility for the company's global forecast process, business unit and firm-wide strategic planning, management reporting and various special projects. Before joining Blackstone in 2008, he held a number of roles in Finance and Global Markets and Investment Banking at Merrill Lynch.

Mr. Kresge graduated magna cum laude from Villanova University with a B.S. in Finance and a B.S. in Accounting.

Aravind Krishnan

Managing Director

Private Equity - Singapore

Aravind Krishnan is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group based in Mumbai, where he focuses on investments in Technology, Consumer, Education, and Media sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Krishnan has been involved in the execution of Blackstone’s investments in TaskUs, Aakash Education, Simplilearn, Xpressbees, Blue Yonder, and International Tractors.

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Krishnan worked as a management consultant with McKinsey & Company. Mr. Krishnan received a Bachelor and Masters in Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Madras and an MBA with High Distinction from the Harvard Business School, where he graduated as a Baker Scholar. He currently serves on the boards of Simplilearn and Xpressbees.

Valerie Kritsberg

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Valerie Kritsberg is a Senior Managing Director and the Global Head of Capital Markets and Trading for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Ms. Kritsberg leads BXCI’s capital markets origination and sourcing across both liquid and private strategies. Her team acts as a single point of contact within BXCI for banks, broker dealers and other key market participants.

Since joining Blackstone, Ms. Kritsberg has focused on the group's public and private market investments including distressed and special situation investments across multiple industries. Prior to joining Blackstone in 2005, Ms. Kritsberg worked in Credit Suisse First Boston’s Global Energy Investment Banking Group where she worked on equity, leveraged finance and M&A transactions for a number of corporate and private equity clients.

Ms. Kritsberg received a BS from New York University, Leonard N. Stern School of Business.

Nick Kuhar

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Nick Kuhar is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Private Equity Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Kuhar has been involved in Blackstone investments including Copeland, Signature Aviation, MB Aerospace, and Change Healthcare. He currently serves on the Board of Directors of Copeland, Signature Aviation and MB Aerospace.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Kuhar was an Associate at Bain Capital, where he evaluated and executed private equity investments across several industries in the U.S. and Japan. Prior to that, Mr. Kuhar was a Business Analyst at McKinsey & Company where he was a member of the Corporate Finance practice.

Mr. Kuhar received a BBA in Finance and Economics from the University of Notre Dame, where he graduated at the top of his class, and an MBA with Distinction from Harvard Business School.

Adam Kuhnley

Sr. Managing Director

Infrastructure - London

Adam Kuhnley is a Senior Managing Director in the Infrastructure group. Since joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Kuhnley has been involved in the execution of Blackstone Infrastructure’s investments, including Invenergy Renewables and Autostrade per I’Italia (ASPI), while also serving on the Board of Directors for Cheniere Energy Partners, L.P. and as a Board Observer for Tallgrass Energy.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Kuhnley spent 13 years at ArcLight Capital Partners, a private equity firm focused on energy infrastructure investments in Boston, most recently as a Principal. While at ArcLight, Mr. Kuhnley was involved in the origination, management, and monetization of investments across the midstream, power and upstream sectors in North America and Europe. Mr. Kuhnley began his career as an Analyst with Simmons & Company International in Houston, where he focused on energy M&A advisory.

Mr. Kuhnley received a BBA in Finance with a minor in Accounting from the University of Texas at Austin.

Natasha Kulkarni

Natasha Kulkarni is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Ms. Kulkarni was a writer, producer and reporter at Bloomberg Television. Prior to that, Ms. Kulkarni was a Sales Trader at Goldman Sachs where she focused on equity derivatives.

Tony Labarbera

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Tony LaBarbera is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies Group, where he is involved in sourcing, underwriting, negotiating and structuring senior loans, mezzanine loans, preferred equity and other debt investments across all asset types and geographies throughout the U.S. Mr. LaBarbera previously worked for Blackstone in London on both the BREDS and Real Estate Capital Markets teams.

Before joining Blackstone’s Real Estate group in 2014, Mr. LaBarbera was an analyst in Blackstone’s Advisory group with Park Hill Real Estate.

Mr. LaBarbera received a BS from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia where he graduated with distinction.

Joshua Lafer

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Josh Lafer is a Managing Director and the Head of Portfolio Insights for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Lafer’s primary responsibilities include portfolio and asset management for BXCI’s portfolios as well as the evaluation of new investments across a range of strategies as part of the investment committee process.

Prior to his role in the Office of the CIO, Mr. Lafer was a member of Blackstone’s Private Credit Strategies investment team where his responsibilities included sourcing, analyzing, executing and monitoring private credit and equity investments across a diverse range of industries.

Before joining Blackstone in 2016 Mr. Lafer was a Vice President in Barclays Capital’s Financial Institutions Group where he was responsible for advising specialty finance clients on a range of M&A and capital markets transactions. Prior to Barclays Capital, Mr. Lafer worked at Ernst & Young where his responsibilities included derivatives valuation as part of the Financial Services team.

Mr. Lafer holds a BS from Cornell University and an MBA from Columbia University.

Lukas Lambach

Managing Director

Real Estate - Hong Kong

Lukas Lambach is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and is based in Hong Kong.

Mr. Lambach is currently responsible for BPP Asia, Blackstone’s open- ended Core+ real estate fund in Asia Pacific. Prior to his current role Mr. Lambach was involved in real estate acquisitions in various property sectors in Europe and Asia Pacific.

Mr. Lambach graduated with first-class honours from Warwick University in the UK, where he received a BSc in Economics and Politics and was a member of the German Academic Scholarship Foundation.
