Michael Lascher

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Michael Lascher is the Global Head of Real Estate Debt Capital Markets. Mr. Lascher oversees the financing of all of Blackstone’s real estate investments, and since joining the firm in 2012, has been involved in over $240 billion of asset, stock and portfolio-level financings.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lascher was a Managing Director with the Lehman Brothers bankruptcy estate where he asset managed a portfolio of real estate investments. From 2004 until the company's bankruptcy, Mr. Lascher was a member of Lehman’s Global Real Estate Group where he focused on the origination, structuring and closing of CMBS financings. He previously was an associate in the real estate group of Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft.

Mr. Lascher received a BA in History and Communications from The University of Pennsylvania and a JD from the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law.

Alex Lau

Managing Director

Finance - Hong Kong

Alex Lau is a Managing Director at Blackstone and he oversees the Asian tax affairs for Blackstone’s Real Estate Group. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lau worked at KPMG Hong Kong as a tax director and was responsible for advising various funds and real estate clients in Asia. Mr. Lau received a Masters of Taxation Studies from University of Auckland and is a Chartered Accountant with the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Australia and New Zealand. Mr. Lau is fluent in English, Mandarin and Cantonese.

Wesley LePatner

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Wesley LePatner is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and the Global Head of Core+ Real Estate, based in New York. Ms. LePatner is a member of Blackstone Real Estate’s Investment Committee and serves as a Director and the Chief Operating Officer of Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT).

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2014, Ms. LePatner spent over a decade at Goldman Sachs. Ms. LePatner received a BA in History from Yale University, summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa, and serves on the boards of The Hewitt School, The Abraham Joshua Heschel School, The Mount Sinai Children’s Center Foundation and Yale University Library Council.

Guillaume Lecois

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Guillaume Lecois is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in London, where he is involved in Blackstone’s real estate acquisitions in France and Italy.

Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Lecois has been involved in a number of Blackstone’s investments in Europe, including Reale Compagnia Italiana, Testa, Office First, and Certeum.

Mr. Lecois received an MS in Management from the HEC business school in Paris, where he majored in Law. 

Jane Lee

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - Berkeley Square House London

Jane Lee is a Senior Managing Director and the Head of CLO Capital Formation for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in London. Ms. Lee is responsible for the origination of U.S. CLOs, European CLOs, and listed funds.

Ms. Lee joined Blackstone from RBC in 2005. Prior to that, Ms. Lee was a Vice President at Indosuez Capital. Before joining Indosuez Capital, Ms. Lee was a Director in the Loan Products Group of Fitch IBCA, Inc., where she was responsible for rating collateralized debt obligations and other credit derivative transactions. 

Ms. Lee received a BA in Economics and Operations Research from Columbia University. 

Nicholas Lee

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Nicholas Lee is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Lee was a Partner at Moon Capital Management, where he was responsible for building and growing the firm’s global capital markets business, and senior sell-side broker relationships. Prior to Moon Capital Management, Mr. Lee was a Managing Director and Head of Asia Pacific Equity Capital Markets Syndicate at the Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where he oversaw the origination and execution of equity capital markets transactions for the region and was a member of the region’s Equity Executive Committee.

Earlier in his career, Mr. Lee was an Associate at Merrill Lynch in investment banking.

Mr. Lee holds a B.A. in Economics from Princeton University.

Eugene Lee

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Eugene Lee is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit. He is involved with public and private special situations investing.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lee worked at Goldman Sachs within the Special Situations Group (SSG), where he was most recently a member of the Multi-Strategy Investing team. In this capacity, Mr. Lee invested in distressed, stressed, and performing credit as well as other opportunistic asset classes across North and South America. During his time with SSG, Mr. Lee also helped found a direct lending team focused on energy opportunities and invested across the renewables sector as part of the Alternative Energy Investing team.

Mr. Lee graduated from Harvard University with an A.B. / S.M. in Economics and Applied Mathematics, and also studied violin performance at the New England Conservatory. Mr. Lee serves on the board of directors of Delaware Basin Investment Group and the Harvard-Radcliffe Orchestra Foundation.

Anyi Lee

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Anyi Lee is a Managing Director in Blackstone Asset Based Finance within Blackstone’s Structured Finance Group.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Lee was a Director at Citigroup’s Global Structured Debt team. In that role, she originated, structured, and executed debt and equity transactions across capital markets and bank products, including Asset Backed Securities (“ABS”), Enhanced Equipment Trust Certificates (“EETCs”), term loans, warehouses, secured revolving credit facilities and aircraft portfolio equity. Prior to Citigroup, Ms. Lee was an Associate at Deutsche Bank’s Aviation Capital Markets group.

Ms. Lee graduated magna cum laude with a BS in Economics from Duke University where she received the Angier B. Duke scholarship. She also holds an MBA from Columbia Business School.

GW Lee

Managing Director

Real Estate - Seoul

GW Lee is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in Seoul, Korea. He is involved with sourcing and executing real estate investments in Korea. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lee worked at Angelo, Gordon & Co. where he was a Managing Director in Korea office responsible for real estate acquisitions and asset management. Prior to that, Mr. Lee was with Morgan Stanley in Korea as an equity research analyst.

Mr. Lee received a M.S. in Management from Stanford University Graduate School of Business and a B.A. in Business Administration from Yonsei University. He is fluent in Korean and English.

Scott Leister

Managing Director

Global Corporate Services - New York

Scott Leister is Managing Director, Global Head of Facilities and Real Estate for Enterprise Operations. He oversees facilities, corporate real estate, design and construction, and critical systems.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Leister worked at KCG Holdings, Inc. as the Global Head of Real Estate, Facilities and Administration where he managed a comprehensive global services team across multiple functions. Prior to KCG Holdings, Inc., Mr. Leister had consulting experience in the areas of land development and civil engineering, as well as general construction.

Mr. Leister has a BS in Civil/Construction Engineering from Temple University and an MS in Civil Engineering from Drexel University.

Alex Leonard

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

Alex Leonard is a Senior Managing Director and the Head of European Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in Ireland. Mr. Leonard is a Senior Portfolio Manager for LCS’s European funds.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Leonard was Co-Head of Portfolio Management and Trading at Harbourmaster Capital Management Limited. Before Harbourmaster, Mr. Leonard was a Senior Structurer and Co-Head of Euro Capital Structures (“ECS”), the structuring team for the UniCredit Group, where he had responsibility for structuring deals across a wide variety of asset classes. Mr. Leonard began his career as a quantitative analyst in ING Barings and Airbus Industrie’s aerospace finance team.

Mr. Leonard received an MA in Economics from University College Dublin and an MBA with distinction from Trinity College Dublin.

Adam Leslie

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Adam Leslie is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and he currently focuses on new investment opportunities in the office and life science sectors.

Since joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Leslie has been involved in analyzing Blackstone's real estate investments in several property sectors and has worked on a variety of transactions, including the creation and sale of Blackstone’s industrial platform, IndCor Properties as well as the acquisition of Stuyvesant Town / Peter Cooper Village in Manhattan.

Mr. Leslie graduated summa cum laude from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, where he received a BS in Economics.

Cassel Lessinger

Managing Director

Infrastructure - New York

Mr. Lessinger is a Managing Director in the Infrastructure Group, where he focuses on investments in the digital infrastructure and transportation sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Lessinger has been involved in Blackstone’s investments in QTS Realty Trust, Hotwire Communications, Digital Realty Development JV and Mundys.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Lessinger worked in the Private Equity group at Apollo Global Management and J.H. Whitney Capital Partners. Prior to that, Mr. Lessinger was an Analyst in the Industrials Investment Banking group at Citigroup.

Mr. Lessinger received a B.A. in Mathematical Economics from Colgate University where he graduated with Honors, and an MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. Mr. Lessinger also serves as a Director of Common Denominator, a non-profit in New York City. 

Vini Letteri

Sr. Managing Director

Blackstone Growth - San Francisco

Vincent E. Letteri is a Senior Managing Director and Chief Operating Officer of Blackstone’s Growth Equity Business, which is focused on providing capital to companies seeking to manage the execution risks associated with high growth environments. Mr. Letteri leads Blackstone’s San Francisco office, and is Chairman of the Portfolio Management Committee. He is also a Member of the Investment Committee, and the Head of Financial Services and Enterprise Software for Blackstone Growth.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Letteri spent thirteen years at KKR. He was a founding member of their Next Generation Technology (NGT) Fund, where he played a lead investment role. Before that, Mr. Letteri was part of KKR Capstone where he worked across a number of KKR portfolio companies. Mr. Letteri spent several years in Hong Kong assisting in the development of KKR Capstone’s Asia operations. He also led KKR’s Green Portfolio Program for the region.

Before joining KKR, Mr. Letteri worked as a Business Development Manager for Nike helping to lead and grow the company’s online business. He also worked for McKinsey & Company in Boston where he focused on private equity, technology, and consumer goods companies.

Mr. Letteri holds a BA with Honors in Economics from Harvard College where he received the John Harvard, Harvard Club and Harvard College scholarships for outstanding academic achievement. He holds an MBA from Stanford University’s Graduate School of Business.

Mr. Letteri is a Board Member of Dynamo Software, Epidemic Sound, and ISN Software Corporation. He also sits on the Board of Directors at the Blackstone Charitable Foundation, is on the Board of Trustees of Boston Latin school, and is a National Board Member of Citizen Schools.

Verena Letzerich

Managing Director

BXCI - Berkeley Square House London

Verena Letzerich is a Managing Director based in London and Head of Business Development for Blackstone Credit in EMEA.

Before joining Blackstone Credit in 2012 (then known as GSO Capital Partners), Ms. Letzerich spent six years in Structured Credit and Alternatives Sales at J.P. Morgan where she focused primarily on raising capital for managed structured corporate credit, hedge funds, private equity, private debt and insurance linked funds from European institutional investors.

Ms. Letzerich received a Bachelor of Science in Management from the London School of Economics and Political Sciences.

David Levine

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

David Levine is Co-Head of Americas Acquisitions for Blackstone Real Estate.

Since joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Levine has been involved in more than $100 billion of real estate investments across several property sectors and has worked on various transactions, including the acquisition of Gramercy Property Trust, Pure Industrial, WPT Industrial REIT, PS Business Parks, BioMed Realty and the creation and growth of Blackstone’s 500+ million square foot industrial platform, Link Logistics.

Mr. Levine graduated from Northwestern University, where he received a BA in Economics. He also serves on the board of Reading Partners New York.

Lisa Lew

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Ms. Lew is a Managing Director and a Portfolio Manager of the U.S. CLOs in Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit. Previously, she was involved with trade settlement and compliance monitoring.

Before joining Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2008 Ms. Lew was responsible for settling bank debt trades at Credit Suisse. Prior to that, she was an analyst at AIG working in commercial insurance.

Ms. Lew received a B.S. in Business Administration from the University at Buffalo, with concentrations in Finance, Management Information Systems, and International Business.

Elizabeth Lewis

Managing Director

Infrastructure - DC

Elizabeth Lewis is a Managing Director and the Head of ESG for Blackstone Infrastructure Partners. Ms. Lewis leads the integration of ESG into the BIP investment process to mitigate risk and create value for portfolio companies and BIP investors.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Lewis was at the International Finance Corporation (IFC), the private sector part of the World Bank Group, leading engagement with investors, NGOs, governments, and other stakeholders on climate change. Prior to joining IFC, Ms. Lewis was a Partner and Director of Strategy and Business Development for Terra Alpha Investments. Prior to that, she established World Resources Institute’s Sustainable Investing Program and served as WRI’s Head of Sustainable Investing. Earlier in her career, Ms. Lewis was a Principal at Global Environment Fund, a private equity fund focused on clean energy and sustainable forestry. Ms. Lewis started her career at Booz Allen Hamilton, advising clients in their evaluation of alternative energy technologies and solutions.

Ms. Lewis holds an AB in Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. She serves as Chair of the Board of Trustees for The Nature Conservancy Maryland/DC. She also serves as a member of the Harvard Business School Alumni Board and the Harvard Alumni Association Schools and Scholarships Committee (which she previously co-chaired for the Washington, DC area) and is Class Chair of the John Harvard Society. 

Eric Liaw

Sr. Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Eric Liaw is a Senior Managing Director, the Treasurer, and the Head of Corporate Development for Blackstone, and the Chief Investment Officer of Blackstone Private Equity Strategies (BXPE). Mr. Liaw leads Blackstone Global Treasury, which oversees the firm’s balance sheet, risk management activities, and treasury operations. Mr. Liaw also leads strategic mergers and acquisitions, new business initiatives, and special projects in support of Blackstone. Mr. Liaw is also a member of the firm’s Capital Markets, Enterprise Risk, Liquid Asset Investments, and Valuation Committees.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Liaw was a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone’s private equity business, focused on investments in the energy sector. Prior to joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Liaw was a Principal at TPG Capital where he evaluated and executed investment opportunities in a wide range of industries. Prior to TPG, Mr. Liaw was an associate at Bain Capital, where he focused on private equity investments in a wide range of industries.

Mr. Liaw received his BA, with highest honors, and BBA, with highest honors, from the University of Texas at Austin and received his MBA, with distinction, from Harvard Business School.

Adam Lichtenstein

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Adam Lichtenstein is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Technology and Innovations group and is involved with the design and development of quantitative modeling across the group.

Before joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Lichtenstein was a Quantitative Research Lead at Citadel, where he developed systematic volatility portfolio strategies for the Global Quantitative Strategies group.  Prior to Citadel, Mr. Lichtenstein was a Researcher and Portfolio manager at Kepos Capital, where he was responsible for the firm’s commodity and macro volatility strategies.

Mr. Lichtenstein graduated with a BSE (Summa Cum Laude) in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering and a MFin in Finance both from Princeton University.  He is a Chartered Financial Analyst.

Jeffrey Lieberman

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Jeffrey Lieberman is a Managing Director in the Institutional Client Solutions Group. Since joining Blackstone, Mr. Lieberman has been involved in LP relations strategy and supporting business development and fund-raising for Blackstone's private investment funds.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lieberman worked as an Associate at Simpson Thacher & Bartlett LLP.

Mr. Lieberman received a BA with Distinction in Latin American and Caribbean Studies and Political Science from McGill University and a JD, cum laude, from Duke University School of Law, where he served as a Notes Editor on the Duke Law Journal.

Joshua Liederman

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Joshua C. Liederman is a Managing Director in the Institutional Client Solutions Group. He is involved with LP relations strategy, and supporting business development and fund-raising for Blackstone's private investment funds.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Liederman worked at Debevoise & Plimpton LLP where he was an Associate.

Mr. Liederman received a BA in Economics from the State University of New York at Buffalo, where he graduated summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa.  He also received a JD from Rutgers Law School, where he graduated cum laude and was elected to the Order of the Coif, and an MBA from Rutgers Business School, where he was elected Beta Gamma Sigma.  Mr. Liederman serves on the Board of Trustees of Sutton Place Synagogue.

Andrew Lim

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Chicago

Andrew Lim is a Managing Director in the Portfolio Operations group and Talent Lead for the Real Estate business where he is focused on developing and executing an integrated talent strategy across the portfolio.

Prior to joining Blackstone, he spent five years at ghSMART where he was an Associate Partner and co-lead of the Executive Coaching and Development practice. There he advised clients on critical leadership initiatives such as selection assessment, succession planning and high potential development. Prior to ghSMART, Mr. Lim worked at Korn Ferry where he was a Principal and Consulting Director in their advisory business and earlier in his career, he worked at Heidrick and Struggles and Deloitte Consulting.

Mr. Lim holds an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University and a Bachelor of Commerce, with merit, from the University of New South Wales in his hometown of Sydney, Australia.

Bernardo Lima

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Bernardo Reis Carneiro da Costa Lima is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Dr. Costa Lima is involved with the development of quantitative models.

Before joining Blackstone, Dr. Costa Lima worked at Citadel as a Quantitative Researcher with the Global Credit team. Prior to that, he was a Fixed Income Strat with Morgan Stanley, supporting various trading desks, including the e-Rates business, the Emerging Markets Credit Desk and the Structured Credit Desk.

Dr. Costa Lima holds a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering (graduated 1st of his class) from the Military Institute of Engineering (IME – Rio de Janeiro, Brazil), a master’s degree in Financial Mathematics from the Institute of Pure and Applied Mathematics (IMPA – Rio de Janeiro, Brazil) and a Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics from McMaster University (Hamilton, Ontario).

Ethan Lin

Managing Director

Real Estate - Shanghai

Ethan Lin is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group. He is involved with sourcing and executing real estate investments across Greater China.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lin worked as a Managing Director at Angelo Gordon & Co. on real estate investments in Greater China and Singapore. Prior to that, Mr. Lin worked at Pradera Asia, Prudential Real Estate Investors and Sun Hung Kai Properties, focusing on real estate acquisitions and asset management.

Mr. Lin received a M.S. degree in Economics from Peking University and a B.A. degree in Mechanical Engineering from Chongqing University.

Janice Lin

Managing Director

Real Estate - Toronto

Janice Lin is a Managing Director, Head of Canada in the Real Estate Group.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Lin was the Chief Investment Officer for Revera, Inc., a global owner of differentiated retirement living operators with residences throughout Canada, the U.S. and U.K. Prior to Revera, Ms. Lin held senior investment roles with Canada Pension Plan Investment Board’s Real Estate and Private Equity groups.

Ms. Lin received an MBA from Harvard Business School and Bachelor of Science in Economics from the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania, graduating Cum Laude. Ms. Lin is on the board of HLMS Developments, the development arm for Houselink & Mainstay Community Housing, Toronto’s largest non-profit supportive housing provider.

Brian Lin

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Brian Lin is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group. He is in the debt capital markets group focusing on the financing of real estate investments in the Americas.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Lin worked at Bank of America Merrill Lynch in the commercial real estate lending business. Prior to Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Mr. Lin worked at Raymond James within the Investment Banking Restructuring group.

Mr. Lin received a BS from Cornell University’s School of Hotel Administration.

Robert Liptak

Sr. Managing Director

Blackstone Life Sciences - Cambridge

Robert W. Liptak is a Senior Managing Director in the Blackstone Life Sciences group and a member of its Investment Committee, having joined Blackstone as part of its acquisition of Clarus in December 2018. Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Liptak was a co-Founder and Managing Director of Clarus since the firm's inception in 2005.

Mr. Liptak has over 25 years of experience in the investment management industry focusing primarily on the establishment and management of various investment management businesses. Prior to Clarus he was a General Partner at MPM Capital, a healthcare venture capital firm. Prior to MPM Capital, Mr. Liptak was a Partner with the Geometry Group, a diversified asset management firm focused on establishing investment management firms. Mr. Liptak currently serves on The Board of Trustees at LaSalle University. Mr. Liptak received his MBA from Columbia University.

Aaron Lissner

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Aaron Lissner is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Lissner was a Director in the FIG investment banking group of Citigroup Global Markets where he led strategic advisory and execution of mergers and acquisitions, strategic reinsurance transactions, and debt and equity offerings.

Mr. Lissner graduated from Duke University with a BS in Economics. 

Song Liu

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Song Liu is a Managing Director with GSO Capital Partners. Since joining GSO Capital, Mr. Liu has been involved with Application Development and IT Support for the GSO hedge fund platform. Before joining Blackstone in 2007, Mr. Liu was a senior manager at Sungard Consulting Service and was involved in the design and implementation of trading and risk management systems for investment banks. Prior to that, Mr. Liu worked as an Assistant Vice President at the Alternative Capital Division of Credit Suisse Group. Mr. Liu started his career at Software House International, a software reseller/integrator. Mr. Liu received a BS of Electrical Engineering from Tsinghua University in Beijing, China, and an MS in Biomedical Engineering from Rutgers University.

Yixiao Liu

Managing Director

Real Estate - Hong Kong

Yixiao Liu is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and is involved in the financing and capital markets activities for Asia Pacific real estate investments. 

Since joining the firm in 2011, Ms. Liu has worked within Blackstone Credit where she focused on private and public credit investments in the energy sector, as well as Blackstone’s advisory group where she advised clients on various M&A, restructuring, and strategic matters. Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Liu worked for Morgan Stanley’s Fixed-Income CMBS Group.

Ms. Liu received a BA in Mathematics and a BA in Economics from the University of Chicago, and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Fang James Liu

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Shanghai

James Liu is a Managing Director in the Portfolio Operations Group, involved in assisting and guiding Blackstone portfolio companies.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Liu worked as the SVP of Strategy and an Executive Board Member of Zhongnan Group, a leading Chinese real estate development and construction company. He also worked in Intertek China as the Chief Operating Officer.  Prior to Intertek, Mr. Liu spent 21 years with GE, initially in the U.S. and other global locations on GE’s information management leadership program and Corporate Audit Staff.  He then progressed through a variety of business leadership roles in GE Healthcare, GE Capital and GE Industrial Businesses in U.S., Asia and China. 

Mr. Liu received a BA, magna cum laude, from West Virginia Wesleyan College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. 

Joseph Lohrer

Sr. Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Joe Lohrer is the Head of U.S. Retail Sales for Blackstone Private Wealth Solutions. He leads a team of client service professionals in delivering Blackstone’s comprehensive platform of Alternative Investment and Private Market strategies including Private Equity, Real Estate, Credit, and Hedge Fund Solutions to retail clients. Joe joined Blackstone in 2011 focused on building and establishing strong partnerships supporting Private Bank, Wire House, Registered Investment Advisors and Independent distribution platforms with an emphasis on Alternative Investment education, service and new product development.  

Joe began his career at Smith Barney in 1985 and held various home office and field positions prior to having his responsibilities expanded to National Sales Manager for Citi Asset Management. At Citi he built and managed a team of sales professionals covering multiple channels of distribution including wire house, bank, and insurance platforms and supported an industry leading mutual fund and separate account (SMA) business.

Joe joined Legg Mason in 2006 as part of Legg’s acquisition of Citi Asset Management where he was the Head of National Sales for the National Broker Dealer Channel and combined several sales forces to build out broad distribution initiatives and distribution of all Legg Mason products within wirehouses. The product vehicles included mutual funds, separately managed accounts, closed end funds, college savings plans, and alternative investments products.

Mr. Lohrer graduated from the State University of New York at Oneonta with a Bachelor of Science degree in Economics.

Musa Lone

Managing Director

BXCI - San Francisco

Musa Lone is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in San Francisco. Mr. Lone is involved with sourcing, due diligence, structuring and managing investments across the capital structure.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Lone worked at Suvretta Capital Management, a public and private equity investment firm, where he focused on investments in the financial and business services sectors. Prior to Suvretta Capital, Mr. Lone was a private equity investor in Goldman Sachs’ Principal Investment Area (PIA) focused on growth equity and special situations within the financial and technology sectors. Before joining Goldman Sachs’ PIA, Mr. Lone was a private equity investor at Warburg Pincus, where he focused on growth equity and special situations investments within the financial services sector.

Mr. Lone received a BA with Honors from Hofstra University.

Gerrit Loots

Managing Director

Infrastructure - London

Mr. Loots is a Managing Director of Infrastructure Operations and Asset Management focused on Europe.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Loots was a partner and Managing Director at Alvarez and Marsal in London advising on and leading large-scale transformations for major companies in Europe, North America and APAC. Previously, he worked with leading firms including AlixPartners, Ernst & Young and a Bechtel affiliated rail company. Mr. Loots benefits from a lengthy experience as an advisor and operator in verticals including transport, aviation & airports, data networks and industrials. He has significant expertise in supply chain and procurement optimization, operating model design and program delivery.

Mr. Loots is a Chartered Electrical Engineer and has a Bachelor of Engineering from the University of Pretoria and an MBA from the London Business School with concentration in finance.

Bill Loskota

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Bill Loskota is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Institutional Client Solutions Group.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Loskota worked at Oaktree Capital Management, where he was a Managing Director and Product Specialist, responsible for handling the client relations, marketing and product development activities across the real estate platform. Before joining Oaktree, Mr. Loskota worked at UBS.

Mr. Loskota received a BS in Business Administration and an MBA from Pepperdine University.

Alex Lue

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Alex Lue is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Private Equity Group where he is focused on investment activity in the energy and energy transition sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Lue has been involved with the firm’s investments in Aypa Power, Array Technologies, PG&E, Irth Solutions, Xpansiv, Lightstone Generation, Lonestar Generation, and Fisterra Energy.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Lue was an Investment Analyst at the Baupost Group where he evaluated public market opportunities in distressed credit and equities across a variety of sectors. Prior to Baupost, Mr. Lue was an analyst in the M&A group at Blackstone Advisory Partners.

Mr. Lue received a Masters of Engineering in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and a BS in Biological Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

Paget MacColl

Sr. Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Paget MacColl is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA), where she serves as the Global Head of Institutional Client Solutions.

Ms. MacColl joined Blackstone after 20 years at Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM), where she most recently served as the Co-Head of the Americas Institutional Client Business through which she was responsible for leading business strategy and client engagement with institutions across the US, Canada and Latin America. Prior to that, she led the institutional distribution and fundraising efforts in GSAM as the Global Head of Institutional Capital Markets.

Ms. MacColl earned a B.A. in Politics from Princeton University. In addition, she serves on the Board of Trustees of Greenwich Academy and The Children’s School.

Charlotte MacKenzie

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Charlotte MacKenzie is Head of North American Sales and Client Relationships. Since joining Blackstone Credit in 2012 Ms. MacKenzie has focused on raising capital and managing client relationships across private and liquid credit.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. MacKenzie worked as an Associate in the Investment Banking Division at Lehman Brothers / Barclays Capital where she focused on restructuring and advisory. 

Ms. MacKenzie received a BA from Williams College.

Laurent Machenaud

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Laurent Machenaud is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in London.

Since joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Machenaud has been involved with asset management and transaction activities in Continental Europe on a variety of real estate classes including office, retail, logistics, hospitality, and clinics.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Machenaud was at Archon, Goldman Sachs’ European real estate management platform, where he spent 7 years focused on equity and debt investment opportunities in Europe.

Mr. Machenaud received a Masters in Management from Bordeaux Business School.

Rashmi Madan

Sr. Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Berkeley Square House London

Rashmi Madan is a Senior Managing Director and Head of EMEA in Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions Group. Private Wealth Solutions’ mission is to bring institutional quality products across a broad spectrum of alternative asset classes to individual investors and their advisors.

Ms. Madan joined Blackstone in 2011. Prior to her current role she was Chief Operating Officer of Institutional Client Solutions (ICS) in Europe, as well as Head of ICS Europe for Blackstone Credit.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Madan worked for eight years in Credit Sales and Structured Credit at JPMorgan where she focused primarily on raising capital for CLO managers, hedge funds and private credit funds from European institutional investors. Prior to that, Ms. Madan spent five years at Morgan Stanley working in Leveraged Finance and Debt Capital Markets in London and New York, respectively. 

Ms. Madan received a Bachelor of Science Degree from Cornell University where she majored in Industrial and Labor Relations.

Amar Majithia

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Amar Majithia is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group focusing on the financing of Blackstone’s real estate investments across Europe.

Before joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Majithia spent 6 years at Goldman Sachs where he was an Executive Director in the Investment Banking Division, responsible for origination, structuring, syndication and securitization of real estate financings across Europe.

Mr. Majithia graduated from Cardiff University with a BSc in Business Management and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants Scotland. 

Scott Malamut

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Scott Malamut is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, where he is involved with the Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT) Shareholder Relations team.

Before joining Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Malamut worked at Almanac Realty Investors, where he was involved with securities and sector analysis, transaction execution and asset management of new and existing investments. Prior to joining Almanac, he worked in the real estate investment banking group at Barclays.

Mr. Malamut received a BA in Economics from Cornell University.

Danny Malkin

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Danny Malkin is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies Group, where he is involved in the sourcing, underwriting, and structuring of debt investments across all asset types and geographies.  Mr. Malkin previously worked for Blackstone in both London and Sydney.

Mr. Malkin received a BBA from the Ross School of Business at the University of Michigan.

James Mandel

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

James Mandel is a Managing Director and Blackstone's Chief Sustainability Officer. Mr. Mandel is involved in sustainability and climate initiatives that seek to drive long-term value across our portfolio companies.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Mandel was Managing Director of the Carbon-Free Buildings program at Rocky Mountain Institute, where he led research, consulting, and policy work focused on emissions reduction in buildings, with a focus on the US, China, and India. Prior to Rocky Mountain Institute, he worked at McKinsey and Company with a focus on sustainability and operational efficiency in energy and industrial companies.

Mr. Mandel has a BA with a concentration in ecology and evolutionary biology from Princeton University and a PhD in Ecology from Cornell University.

Matt Manewal

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Matt Manewal is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Group, focusing on Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA). Mr. Manewal is involved in the legal structuring of the group’s multi-manager portfolios as well as due diligence on and negotiation of hedge fund manager relationships.

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Manewal served as the Associate General Counsel of FNY Capital Management LP and Clarium Capital Management LLC, each a New York-based hedge fund manager.  Prior to that, Mr. Manewal was an associate in the New York office of Latham & Watkins LLP, where he worked primarily on mergers and acquisitions.

Mr. Manewal received a JD from UCLA School of Law and a BA from Yale University.

Andreas Mang

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Andreas Mang is the Chief Executive Officer of Equity Healthcare where he is involved in managing medical benefits spend across the Blackstone portfolio. Mr. Mang brings twenty years of healthcare experience to Equity Healthcare, having held various roles in healthcare finance, operations, and strategy.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Mang was the Vice-President responsible for national provider network operations at CareCentrix, a PE-backed, leading home health benefit-management company. At Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, he held a variety of roles including a leadership role identifying and implementing administrative cost savings opportunities throughout the organization, and ultimately designing a new corporate business model. In addition, he held roles as the Manager, Strategic Financial Planning at Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, and was a Senior Consultant with Deloitte Consulting’s Strategy and Operations group in Boston.

Mr. Mang has a BS in Healthcare Management and Policy from the University of New Hampshire and an MBA from the University of Rochester’s Simon School of Business Administration. He currently serves on the board of DECA Dental.

Rita Mangalick

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Rita Mangalick is a Managing Director and the Global Head of ESG for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Ms. Mangalick focuses on ESG integration and sustainable investing approaches, ESG engagement with portfolio companies, and transparency on ESG analysis and reporting.

Prior to her current role, Ms. Mangalick led the design and implementation of Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing’s (BXMA) ESG program and worked with hedge fund managers to develop their ESG programs. She was also a member of BXMA’s Business & Financial Evaluation team, performing operational due diligence of hedge fund managers. Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Ms. Mangalick was a Director at UBS Asset Management. Ms. Mangalick was previously with Union Bancaire Privee after starting her career at KPMG.

Ms. Mangalick received her BA from The George Washington University.

Ganesh Mani

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - Mumbai

Ganesh Mani is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone’s Private Equity Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Mani has been involved in Blackstone’s investments in Sona Comstar, Aadhar Housing Finance, Trans Maldivian Airways, IBS Software, International Tractors Limited, CMS Info Systems, Multi Commodity Exchange of India Ltd., and Jagran Prakashan. Mr. Mani is involved in the evaluation of investment opportunities in the pharma and healthcare, financial services, automotive, and specialty chemicals sectors in South Asia. Mr. Mani currently serves on the Board of Directors of Sona Comstar.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Mani was an Associate at the Boston Consulting Group.

Mr. Mani received a B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay.

Harish Manwani

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Singapore

Harish Manwani is a Senior Operating Partner.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Manwani was the Chief Operating Officer of Unilever responsible for managing the P&L across all of Unilever’s global markets. Mr. Manwani spent thirty-eight years with Unilever, holding various senior general management positions globally, including overseeing Unilever’s businesses in Latin America, North America, Asia and Africa.

As a Senior Operating Partner, Mr. Manwani provides guidance to selected Blackstone portfolio companies across the world and assists in diligence of investment opportunities. In addition, he makes recommendations to the portfolio operations and advises the management teams of Blackstone’s Indian portfolio companies. Mr. Manwani serves on the Board of Directors of Gilead Sciences, Inc., Whirlpool Corporation, Tata Sons Private Limited and EDBI Pte Ltd. He is also chairman of the Executive Board of the Indian School of Business.

Mr. Manwani received a B.Sc. (Honors) degree from Bombay University and a Master’s degree in Management Studies. He has also attended the Advanced Management Program at Harvard Business School.

David Marks

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

David Marks is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group based in New York. Mr. Marks is involved with U.S. Core+ portfolio management and focuses on Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT).

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Marks worked at Urban Edge Properties, where he was Vice President for Financial & Strategic Planning. Prior to that, Mr. Marks worked at Acadia Realty Trust and Site Centers in a variety of real estate acquisition, asset management and development roles.

Mr. Marks received a BS in Hotel Administration from Cornell University. 

Tony Marone

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York 601 Lex

Anthony F. Marone, Jr. is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and the Head of Real Estate Finance Americas, based in New York. Mr. Marone also serves as the Chief Financial Officer of Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT), a non-traded public REIT, and Blackstone Mortgage Trust (NYSE: BXMT).

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Marone was a Vice President and Controller at Capital Trust, Inc., the predecessor business to BXMT. Previously, Mr. Marone worked in the Real Estate Assurance practice of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP.

Mr. Marone received a B.S. and an MBA from Rutgers University and is a Certified Public Accountant and Chartered Global Management Accountant.

David Marren

Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

David Marren is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit's Debt Funds Management Europe, formerly Harbourmaster Capital prior to its acquisition by Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in early 2012. He is a senior member of the Loan Operations area in Dublin, and is primarily involved with portfolio administration, cash management, loan settlements and all related areas and activities. Mr. Marren joined Harbourmaster in August 2007. Prior to that, he worked for Bank of New York as a Trust Associate in the Corporate Trusts area and as a WSO Administrator at JP Morgan. Mr. Marren also spent four years at AIB dealing with bank reconciliations for corporate clients.

Brad Marshall

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Brad Marshall is the Global Head of Private Credit Strategies, Chairman and Co-CEO of both the Blackstone Private Credit Fund (BCRED) and the Blackstone Secured Lending Fund (BXSL) in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2005, Mr. Marshall worked in various roles at RBC, including fixed income research and business development within RBC’s private equity funds effort. Prior to RBC, Mr. Marshall helped develop a private equity funds business for TAL Global, a Canadian asset management division of CIBC, and prior to that, he co-founded a microchip verification software company where he served as Chief Financial Officer.

Mr. Marshall received an MBA from McGill University in Montreal and a BA (Honors) in Economics from Queen’s University in Kingston, Canada.

James Marullo

Managing Director

BXTI - New York

James Marullo is a Managing Director and Head of Global Technology Support within the Technology and Innovations group at Blackstone. He oversees the firm’s Service Desk, Support Analytics and Strategy, Executive Services, Desktop Support and Hardware Asset Management functions globally.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Marullo worked for AllianceBernstein where he provided technology support for the firm’s Retail and Marketing group, and executive support for the office of the Chief Operating Officer.

He received a BS in Electronics Engineering, with concentrations in Networking and Digital Systems Design from Johnson & Wales University.

Michael Matejek

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Michael Matejek is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Matejek worked at Goldman Sachs; first as a Repo and Interest Rate Product Desk Strategist in the Global Markets Division, and then as a Corporate Treasury Strategist where he co-ran Treasury Execution Strats and then later Deposit Modeling Strats.

Mr. Matejek received an AB in Physics (with Honors) from Princeton University and a PhD in Physics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

Emily Mathews

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Emily Clarice Ho Mathews is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Group, focusing on Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA). Since joining Blackstone, Ms. Mathews has been involved in the legal structuring and negotiation of the group’s customized multi-manager portfolios, seeding platform, direct trading platforms and other investment opportunities.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Mathews was an Associate at Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP in the Private Funds Group, where her practice focused on organizing and advising private investment funds, including buyout funds and other “alternative asset” investment vehicles. In addition to representing sponsors in their fund formation and management activities, Ms. Mathews also advised institutional investors regarding their private equity investments.

Ms. Mathews received a BA in Psychology from Yale University and a JD from Harvard Law School.

Scott Mathias

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Scott Mathias is a Managing Director and Co-Chief Compliance Officer of Blackstone Real Estate and serves as the Chief Compliance Officer and Secretary for Blackstone Mortgage Trust (BXMT).

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Mathias was an Associate in the Private Funds group at Simpson Thacher & Bartlett LLP where he advised and represented some of the largest and most well-known sponsors of private equity and hedge funds.

Mr. Mathias received a BBA in Marketing and Psychology from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and a JD from New York University School of Law, where he graduated cum laude.

Georgina Matthews

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Georgina Matthews is a Managing Director within Blackstone’s Real Estate Institutional Client Solutions team based in London. Ms. Matthews focuses on Blackstone Real Estate’s capital raising, investor relations and new business development initiatives in Europe.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2018, Ms. Matthews spent ten years at Brookfield in their Private Funds Group.

Ms. Matthews holds a BA in French and Spanish from the University of Newcastle-upon-Tyne.

Adam Mattina

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Adam Mattina is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Technology and Innovations group and is the firm’s Deputy Chief Information Security Officer. He oversees Blackstone’s Portfolio Cybersecurity program, which conducts cybersecurity diligence on, assesses and seeks to improve cybersecurity practices across Blackstone’s global portfolio of operating companies.

Prior to his current role, Mr. Mattina led major projects within the Security team and built multiple functional areas within the firm’s cybersecurity program. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Mattina managed operations, training and recruitment of a global team of information security experts within the United States Department of Defense.

Mr. Mattina received an MBA from George Washington University and graduated with honors from the Rochester Institute of Technology. He serves on the Program Advisory Board of the Masters in Cybersecurity program at New York University and has held adjunct professor roles in the Masters of Cybersecurity programs at New York University and Stevenson University.

Jessica Mayer

Managing Director

BXCI - Berkeley Square House London

Ms. Mayer is a Managing Director and a member of the Investor Relations and Client Service team for Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit, focused on LCS’s European funds and accounts. Ms. Mayer also assists with the business development efforts for these products. Previously, Ms. Mayer provided portfolio management support for LCS’s closed-end and exchange traded funds, and prior to that was involved with the structuring, monitoring and marketing of new funds and existing U.S. CLO transactions.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2007, Ms. Mayer worked at Morgan Stanley, where she was responsible for the warehousing of collateralized debt and loan obligations.  Ms. Mayer was also a relationship manager, working with both internal and external clients to build and improve relationships.

Ms. Mayer received a B.S. in Business Administration from Villanova University, double majoring in Finance and Marketing with a minor in International Business.

Christopher Mazza

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Christopher Mazza is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Mazza worked at BlackRock as a Director within the Institutional Client Business, most recently as part of the Alternatives Specialists Group. Here he was responsible for business development and sales strategy for the hedge fund and private credit platforms. Mr. Mazza previously spent time with the firm’s Defined Contribution and US Wealth Advisory businesses.

Mr. Mazza received a BS in Business Administration with a concentration in Finance from Villanova University.

Megan McCann

Managing Director & CAO

Portfolio Operations - New York

Megan McCann is a Managing Director and Chief Administrative Officer in the Portfolio Operations group.  Ms. McCann is involved with the administrative management including resource allocation, recruiting and training, career development, performance reviews and compensation, and other administrative aspects of the group’s activities.  Ms. McCann has held a variety of roles since joining the firm in 2011, initially working on Private Equity’s Investor Relations and Reporting team and more recently on Private Equity’s Valuations team.

Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Ms. McCann spent 6 years at Morgan Stanley focused on planning, analysis, and reporting for the Global Wealth Management division.

Ms. McCann received a dual BS in Finance and Marketing from Syracuse University.

David McClure

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - London

David McClure is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, based in London.

Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. McClure has been involved extensively in asset management of investments, both in Europe and Asia, and was previously Head of Asset Management for Asia. Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. McClure was a Vice President at Silverpeak Real Estate, where he focused on asset management activities in the United Kingdom and France.

Mr. McClure received an Honours Degree in Law from the University of Edinburgh, Scotland and is also a qualified accountant with the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England & Wales.

Ryan McCracken

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - North Carolina

Ryan McCracken is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Private Wealth Solutions Group. Ryan is a member of the U.S. Sales Leadership Team and serves as Head of External Sales for the Private Wealth Management channel which includes wirehouses and private banks.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2015, Ryan spent eight years as a Director at Wells Fargo Securities in the Market Linked Investments business. He started his career at Morgan Stanley in 1998 and served a variety of roles within the asset management business.

Ryan earned a BA and MBA from the University of Tennessee. 

Julia McDowell

Managing Director

Finance - London

Julia McDowell is a Managing Director in Blackstone Internal Audit. She provides comprehensive risk assurance coverage of the Firm’s European business, inclusive of global audit and advisory reviews. She also partners with regional senior leadership to support strategic growth objectives.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. McDowell worked at BlackRock in both the New York and London offices, and most recently was their Head of Global Operations Audit. She was responsible for managing relationships with board and executive management across EMEA and overseeing audit coverage of the United Kingdom and European businesses. Prior to that, Ms. McDowell was an internal auditor at Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Lehman Brothers, covering Global Wealth Management and Finance.

Ms. McDowell graduated from Siena College with a BBA in Accounting and is a Chartered Member of the Institute of Internal Auditors.

Padraic McGovern

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Padraic McGovern is a Managing Director and Chief Technology Officer of Human Resources within the Technology and Innovations group. He is responsible for all aspects of technology across both Human Resources and the Strategic Incentives Group.

Mr. McGovern has been working with Blackstone since 2001. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. McGovern founded multiple startups which were focused on integration of marketing and technology services primarily in the financial sector.

He received a BA in Mathematics and a BAI in Engineering from Trinity College Dublin and an MBA in Finance from Fordham University.

Stephanie McGowan

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Stephanie McGowan is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group where she is currently focused on the asset management and oversight of Blackstone’s U.S. retail and gaming investments. She is also Co-Chair of Blackstone’s Women’s Initiative.

Before joining Blackstone in 2014, Ms. McGowan worked at Bank of America Merrill Lynch in the Real Estate Gaming & Lodging Investment Banking group.

Ms. McGowan received a B.S. in Business Administration from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill where she attended in the Honors Program, graduating with Highest Distinction and Phi Beta Kappa. She serves on the Board of Part of the Solution (POTS) Bronx. 

Kristin McGrath

Managing Director

Real Estate - Chicago

Kristin McGrath is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group at Blackstone.  Ms. McGrath is involved in global valuations and reporting functions across Blackstone’s opportunistic and core+ strategies.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Ms. McGrath was Global Head of Valuations and Portfolio Reporting Support at Revantage.  She began by establishing the U.S. team and then expanded the function globally by establishing teams in Europe and Asia) Ms. McGrath began her career at Duff & Phelps in their Real Estate Advisory Group (REAG) focusing on independent commercial real estate valuation and consulting.

Ms. McGrath received a BS in Finance from University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign.  She holds an MAI designation for real estate valuations through the Appraisal Institute.

Brendan McIntee

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Brendan McIntee is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group where he currently focuses on new investment opportunities in the industrial/logistics sector across both the U.S. and Canada.

Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. McIntee has worked on real estate investments across several property sectors in Europe, Canada, and the United States, including the acquisition of GE Capital’s real estate business, the privatizations of Strategic Hotels and WPT Industrial REIT, as well as a variety of other transactions contributing to the growth of Blackstone's industrial platforms in the U.S. (Link Logistics) and Canada (Pure Industrial).

Mr. McIntee graduated from Harvard College with an AB in Economics.

Gordon McKemie

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Mr. McKemie is a Managing Director and a Portfolio Manager of the closed-end and exchange-traded funds in Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit. He sits on LCS’s U.S. Syndicated Credit Investment Committee.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2012 Mr. McKemie was an Associate in Leveraged Finance at Citigroup and an Assistant Vice President in high yield research at Barclays Capital.  He began his career at Lehman Brothers.

Mr. McKemie received a B.B.A. with a concentration in Finance from the Goizueta Business School at Emory University and is a CFA Charterholder.

Joseph McKnight

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Joseph McKnight is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. McKnight is the Portfolio Manager for the Insurance Direct Lending and Asset Based Credit portfolios. His primary responsibilities include portfolio construction, evaluation of investments, and structuring.

Before joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. McKnight served as a Vice President at Goldman Sachs, where he focused on private equity and proprietary direct investments in power generation and renewable energy within the firm’s J. Aron commodity division.

Mr. McKnight received a BA in History from the University of Pennsylvania and a BS in Economics from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, where he graduated with academic honors.

Daniel McMullen

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Daniel McMullen is a Senior Managing Director and Head of Portfolio Management for Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”). He is Senior Portfolio Manager of the multi-strategy separately managed accounts, commingled funds, and exchanged traded funds in Blackstone Credit’s LCS unit.  He is also a member of Blackstone Credit’s LCS Management Committee and sits on the following investment committees: U.S. Non-Investment Grade Credit, Global Structured Credit, Public and Private High Grade Credit, Blackstone Treasury Liquid Assets and Asset Allocation/Liquid Markets Forum.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2002, Mr. McMullen worked at CIBC World Markets, most recently as a Director and Senior Investment Analyst for the structured investment vehicles managed by Trimaran Advisors, L. L. C. Prior to that, Mr. McMullen was a Director in the Investment Banking Group at CIBC, specializing in the aerospace and defense industries.  Before joining CIBC in 1996, Mr. McMullen was employed at The Chase Manhattan Bank where he worked in the Corporate Finance Healthcare Group.

Mr. McMullen received a B.A. from the University of Rochester, where he graduated cum laude, and is a CFA Charterholder.

Catherine McNulty

Sr. Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Catherine McNulty is a Senior Managing Director and Global Head of Marketing in Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions Group. Before joining Blackstone, Catherine was a Managing Director, Global Head of Marketing and Product Management for Morgan Stanley Investment Management. In this role, she was responsible for driving the marketing strategy for the firm’s traditional and alternative platforms across institutional and retail client segments. Before that she worked at Deutsche Bank, now DWS, and Legg Mason in channel marketing roles.

Catherine received a BS from Skidmore College and an MBA from Fordham University.

Margaret McSpadden

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Margaret McSpadden is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance group and supports Blackstone’s Credit business. Since joining Blackstone in 2016, Ms. McSpadden has been involved in strategic transactions, fund structuring and related projects, investment transactions, and other legal and compliance matters.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, Ms. McSpadden worked as an associate at Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP in New York, representing both sponsors and lenders in M&A and leverage finance transactions, and prior to Willkie, worked as a corporate associate at Cahill Gordon & Reindel LLP in New York, representing lenders in leverage finance transactions.

Ms. McSpadden received a B.A., magna cum laude, from Duke University in 2008 and was a member of Phi Beta Kappa, and received a J.D. from the University of Virginia School of Law in 2011.

Prakhar Mehrotra

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - San Francisco

Prakhar Mehrotra is the Managing Director of Applied AI at Blackstone. He is responsible for helping Blackstone's portfolio companies apply AI and capitalize on this powerful technology.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Prakhar served as Corporate Vice President and Head of Applied AI for Walmart US. He led Walmart's team to win the prestigious Franz Edelman Prize 2023 by Institute of Operations Research and Managment Sciences (INFORMS) for its work on supply chain optimization. Prior to Walmart, he led the AI group at Uber. He started his career as data scientist at Twitter.

Prakhar holds PhD in Aeronautics from California Institute of Technology, Pasadena and Master's from Ecole Polytechnique, Paris. He is a two time recipient of the Edelman Medal (2020, 2023) and IEEE Senior Member. He serves on the peer review committee for major AI conferences (ICLR, AAMAS, CVPR, INFORMS). He was named in the AI 100 list as top people in Artificial Intelligence. During his graduate studies, he was awarded the Ernest E. Sechler Award in Aeronautics by Caltech and the Gaspard Monge Medal from Ecole Polytechnique.

Mukesh Mehta

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - Mumbai

Mukesh Mehta is a Senior Managing Director in the Private Equity Group and is based in Mumbai. In Blackstone he has been involved in several transactions including acquisition of Piramal Glass Division, Aadhar and TaskUS. He is also on board of these companies Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Mehta worked as a Vice President with The Carlyle Group in their Private Equity division. He was involved in several transactions, including investments in SBI Cards, HDFC, IIFL and PNBHF, during his 10 year stint at Carlyle. Prior to Carlyle he worked in the Investment Banking Division at Citigroup and the Assurance & Business Advisory Group at PwC. Mr. Mehta is a Chartered Accountant, with a Master’s Degree in Commerce from Mumbai University. He has also completed CFA (AIMR-USA).

Seth Meisel

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Mr. Meisel is a Senior Managing Director in the Private Equity group based in New York.  Mr. Meisel heads Blackstone’s private equity transactions in the Industrials sector and has been involved in Blackstone’s investments in Cloverleaf Cold Storage, Interior Logic Group, Chamberlain and Copeland.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Meisel was a partner at Bain Capital focused on the Industrials sector.  He has served as a director on the boards of public companies Sensata Technologies, Trinseo, and Veritiv as well as on the boards of several private companies and non-profit organizations. Mr. Meisel currently serves on the boards of Gates, Interior Logic Group, Chamberlain and Copeland as well as on the boards of non-profits The Ethical Culture Fieldston School, The Opportunity Network, and City Year New York. Additionally, he is an active member of the Saltaire Volunteer Fire Company. Previously, he was with Mercer Management Consulting (Oliver Wyman) in New York and Hong Kong.

Mr. Meisel received a BA in Economics from Princeton University cum laude and an MBA from Harvard Business School with High Distinction as a Baker Scholar.

Prakash Melwani

Sr. Managing Director & Chief Investment Officer

Private Equity - New York

Prakash A. Melwani is the Global Chief Investment Officer of the Private Equity Group and is also the Executive Chairman of the firm’s Private Equity business in Asia.

Since joining Blackstone in 2003, Mr. Melwani has led a number of the firm’s investments including Texas Genco, Ariel Re, Pinnacle Foods, Performance Food Group, Crocs and Ascend Learning. He serves as Chairman of Ascend Learning. Mr. Melwani received a First Class Honors degree in Economics from Cambridge University, England, and an MBA with High Distinction from the Harvard Business School, where he graduated as a Baker Scholar and a Loeb Rhodes Fellow.

Mr. Melwani serves on the Board of Dean’s Advisors at Harvard Business School, the President's Council on International Activities at Yale University, and the Board of Cambridge in America. He sits on the Board of the International Rescue Committee and is also a member of the Council on Foreign Relations.

Nick Menzies

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Nicholas Menzies is a Senior Managing Director and leads consumer and residential real estate credit investments for the Infrastructure and Asset Based Credit unit within Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Mr. Menzies joined Blackstone in 2016 and previously led investments in residential real estate credit for Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Menzies was a Senior Vice President at H/2 Capital Partners, an institutional investment manager focused on real estate structured credit. While at H/2, he was responsible for the trading and structuring of the firm’s real estate related debt securities. Prior to that, Mr. Menzies was an Associate at Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. on the CMBS secondary trading desk.

Mr. Menzies received a BA in Economics from Georgetown University. Mr. Menzies currently serves on the Board of Directors of LendingOne and Encore Finance. 

Anthony Merhige

Sr. Managing Director & Chief Operating Officer

Harvest - Pennsylvania

Anthony Merhige is a Senior Managing Director of Blackstone, serving as the Chief Operating Officer and Chief Compliance Officer of Harvest Fund Advisors, Blackstone’s publicly traded MLP and Yield-Oriented Investment Platform.  Having joined Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Merhige oversees the business development and investor relations functions of Harvest, as well as the day-to-day management of Harvest’s operations.

Before joining Harvest in 2005, Mr. Merhige was the Chief Operating Officer of the Vivum Group.  Prior to that Mr. Merhige was an Associate at the law firm of Pepper Hamilton LLP, where his practice focused on a wide variety of commercial matters, including antitrust mergers and acquisition counseling for national and multinational corporations.

Mr. Merhige holds a BA from Johns Hopkins University and a JD from the Temple University Beasley School of Law.

Ashley Messig

Managing Director

Human Resources - New York

Ashley Messig is a Managing Director and Global Head of Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) Human Resources based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Ashley was the Global HR Business Partner for Credit at BlackRock. Ashley has over twenty years of experience across HR in financial services. Prior to BlackRock, she served in various talent management roles focused on developing and executing comprehensive talent development strategies, training, and performance improvement solutions to support business objectives and drive revenue growth. Ashley began her career in the Investment Management Division at Goldman Sachs and Pine Street, their Leadership Development Group.

Ashley received a BA in Public Policy from Duke University and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

Olivier Meyohas

Sr. Managing Director

BXMA - Berkeley Square House London

Olivier F. Meyohas is a Senior Managing Director in BAAM, where he serves as the head of BAAM’s London office and leads BAAM’s Institutional Client Solutions team in Europe. He is also a member of the Investment Committee for BAAM’s Strategic Alliance Fund platform.

Before joining Blackstone in 2008, Mr. Meyohas spent 16 years at Goldman Sachs, most recently as a Managing Director. He held several senior positions in the Capital Markets group, with his last role being Co-Head of the Pension Advisory Group.

Mr. Meyohas received a BA (Hons) in Modern History from Pembroke College, Oxford University and is a member of the Investment Committee for the College.

Kevin Michel

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Kevin Michel is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Group. Mr. Michel is actively involved in the legal structuring and management of Blackstone’s retail-focused funds, with a particular focus on investment companies registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Michel was an Associate in the Asset Management Group of Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP, where he focused on the formation and operation of hedge funds and registered investment companies.

Mr. Michel received a BA in History from Yale University and a JD from the University of Richmond School of Law.

Evan Middleton

Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Mr. Middleton is a Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities Group, where he focuses on executing transactions in the industrials and business services verticals. Mr. Middleton currently serves on the Board of Directors of Sustana Group and Trimark USA.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Middleton was at The Carlyle Group, most recently as a Partner and Co-Head of North America for Carlyle Strategic Partners, where he led a number of investments including control, minority, and structured equity transactions across a broad range of industries. He previously served on the Board of Directors of companies spanning a wide variety of sectors, including AFG Holdings, Guitar Center, LA Fitness, Liberty Tire, NORDAM Group, and Prime Clerk, among others. Prior to joining Carlyle, Mr. Middleton was with American Securities and Evercore Partners, and he began his career at Bowles Hollowell Conner.

Mr. Middleton received a BS in mathematics and economics, with a minor in Japanese language, from the University of Virginia.

Anna Mignot

Managing Director

Human Resources - London

Anna Mignot is a Managing Director and Head of Human Resources for Blackstone’s offices in Europe and the Middle East, based in London. Since joining Blackstone in 2007, Ms. Mignot has been involved in a wide number of areas for the HR function, including recruiting, employment law matters and employee relations, and immigration.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Mignot worked at The Boston Consulting Group as a Senior Recruiter, and at Teach First as a Senior Graduate Recruitment Officer, overseeing the selection of graduate intake. Ms. Mignot received a B.A. in Music from Royal Holloway, University of London.

Craig Miller

Sr. Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Craig Miller is the Corporate Controller and Senior Managing Director in Finance for Blackstone. Mr. Miller heads all Blackstone Corporate Accounting functions, which includes the accounting, tax, and financial reporting for general partner and management company entities, treasury finance, expense accounting and the firm’s quarterly consolidation process. In addition to Corporate Accounting, Mr. Miller co-heads Financial Planning & Analysis. Mr. Miller is also involved with several compliance related matters and was involved with the firm's initial public offering.

Before joining Blackstone in 2001, Mr. Miller worked in the Financial Services group at PricewaterhouseCoopers where he provided auditing and accounting services to global investment companies.

Mr. Miller received a BS in Accounting as well as a MS in Taxation from St. John's University. He is a Certified Public Accountant.

Chaim Miller

Sr. Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Chaim Miller is a Senior Managing Director and the Head of Global Tax Planning. Since joining Blackstone in 2009, Mr. Miller has been involved in the development and implementation of global tax planning strategies for the firm, the firm’s funds and the firm’s portfolio companies. Mr. Miller is also the Chief Operating Officer of the firm’s Global Tax group, responsible for administration of our global tax function.

Before joining Blackstone in 2009, Mr. Miller worked as a Vice President in the New Product Development group at Merrill Lynch & Co. In that role, he developed and executed alternative structures and platforms to achieve tax, accounting and regulatory efficiency for various fixed-income products. Prior to that, he was an Associate in the Tax group at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP.

Mr. Miller received a J.D. from Columbia Law School where he was a James Kent Scholar.

Alan Milstein

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Mr. Milstein is a Managing Director and is responsible for trading U.S. leveraged loans and overseeing U.S. secondary market trading activities for Blackstone Credit.

Mr. Milstein joined Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2005 from RBC. At RBC, Mr. Milstein was a Vice President in the Debt Investments group with similar responsibilities.  Previously, Mr. Milstein worked at Indosuez Capital, where he was responsible for trading high yield bond assets in various portfolios. Prior to that, Mr. Milstein worked at Prudential Securities as a high yield bond trader.

Mr. Milstein received a B.S. in Business Administration from the University of Albany and an M.B.A. in Finance from Fordham University.

Eugene Min

Managing Director

Real Estate - Singapore

Eugene Min is a Managing Director and Chief Operating Officer of Real Estate Asia, based in Singapore. Mr. Min previously served as Blackstone’s Head of Business Finance for Asia supporting the Real Estate, Private Equity and Tactical Opportunities businesses. 

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2018, Mr. Min worked at CLSA Capital Partners, a multi-strategy alternative investment platform, as their Chief Financial Officer based in Hong Kong. Prior to that, Mr. Min spent 13 years at J.P. Morgan Asset Management in various capacities in their Global Real Assets Group initially in New York and subsequently in Hong Kong. Prior to that, Mr. Min started his career at Ernst & Young in New York as an auditor in their Financial Services Group.

Mr. Min received a B.S. in Business and Economics from Lehigh University and is a CFA Charterholder.

Zaheen Mir

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Mir was the Head of Global Institutional Structuring at J.P. Morgan.

Anindya Mishra

Managing Director

BXCI - Houston

Anindya Mishra is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit and Chief Operating Officer of the Sustainable Resources Group. He is involved with private and public investments in energy transition, renewable energy, and sustainability sectors.

Before joining Blackstone Credit in 2015, Mr. Mishra worked for First Reserve helping invest capital in the energy equipment, manufacturing and services sectors. Before First Reserve, Mr. Mishra worked for Deutsche Bank’s natural resources investment banking group, where he worked on multiple M&A and financing transactions.

Mr. Mishra received a BS in Economics from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Thomas Mitta

Managing Director

BXCI - San Francisco

Thomas ("TJ") Mitta is a Managing Director for Blackstone Credit’s Systematic Strategies unit, where he is focused on the research and management of Systematic Strategies’ portfolios.

Prior to Blackstone’s acquisition of DCI in 2020, Mr. Mitta focused on research and management of systematic credit portfolios at DCI, LLC. Before joining DCI, Mr. Mitta was responsible for alpha research and portfolio management for long-short systematic investment strategies at BlackRock. Before BlackRock, Mr. Mitta was a Quantitative Researcher at Goldman Sachs, where he worked on systematic strategies and capital structure arbitrage models. Mr. Mitta started his career in the POINT group in Fixed Income at Barclays Capital.

Mr. Mitta received a B.S. in Aerospace Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), M.S. degrees in Finance, Mechanical Engineering, and Mathematics from Princeton, Cornell, and the University of California, Santa Barbara, respectively, as well as a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from the University of California, Santa Barbara.
