Mr. Miura started his career in the investment banking group at Merrill Lynch with a focus on real estate capital market transactions. Mr. Miura received a BA in law from University of Tokyo.

Alan Miyasaki

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - Singapore

Alan Miyasaki is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and the Head of Real Estate Acquisitions Asia. Mr. Miyasaki is based in Singapore and is responsible for the day-to-day management of the Real Estate group’s investment activities in Asia.

Since joining Blackstone in 2001, Mr. Miyasaki has been involved in a variety of real estate transactions in both the United States and Asia. Since 2007, Mr. Miyasaki has played a key role in building Blackstone’s Real Estate business in Asia including executing investments in Greater China, India, Singapore, Japan, South Korea, Australia and New Zealand.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Miyasaki was with Starwood Capital Group, where he worked in acquisitions. Mr. Miyasaki received a BS in Economics from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, where he graduated cum laude. He currently serves on the boards of Crown Resorts Ltd. and Singapore American School Foundation.

Shary Moalemzadeh

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Shary Moalemzadeh is a Senior Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities Group.  Mr. Moalemzadeh is a member of the Investment Committee for the Tactical Opportunities and Blackstone Growth funds.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Moalemzadeh was at The Carlyle Group for over 17 years, where he was most recently a Partner and Co-Head of Illiquid Credit Strategies and Co-Head and a founding member of Carlyle Strategic Partners, focusing on special situations investment opportunities.  Mr. Moalemzadeh was member of the Investment Committees for several funds at Carlyle and a member of several management committees including most recently chair of the Global Promotions Committee and member of the Compliance and Regulatory Committee. Prior to joining Carlyle, Mr. Moalemzadeh worked at Jacksons, Vestar Capital Partners and in the Leveraged Finance Group at Merrill Lynch. 

Mr. Moalemzadeh has previously served on the boards of numerous companies in a broad range of industries, including but not limited to Diversified Machine, Inc., Dynamic Precision Group, Metaldyne Corporation, Liberty Tire, Prime Clerk, Service King and Stellex Aerostructures, Inc. 

Mr. Moalemzadeh received a BS in finance and graduated cum laude from New York University’s Stern School of Business.

He was responsible for the treasury and resource raising functions for the group across a pan-Indian portfolio of properties.

Thomas Morrison

Sr. Managing Director

BX Private Equity Strategies - New York

Thomas Morrison is a Senior Managing Director and the President of Blackstone Private Equity Strategies (BXPE), a fund which provides investors with a diversified portfolio of private investments.

Mr. Morrison joined Blackstone in 2011 to lead the firm’s Equity Capital Markets activities across our businesses globally. In 2020, he joined the firm’s Private Wealth Solutions group to focus on senior relationships with private wealth investment firms, and strategic initiatives focused on expanding access with new products, geographies, model portfolios, co-investments, and capital markets.

He is an Advisory Council Member for the Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA) Association, an Advisory Board Member for the Kellogg Finance Network, and is Co-Chairman of the Friends of Harvard Basketball.

Mr. Morrison received a BA from Harvard College, majoring in Economics. He also received an MBA from the Kellogg Graduate School of Management, with majors in Management, Finance, and Marketing. Mr. Morrison also studied at the University of London, University College.

Paul Morrissey

Sr. Managing Director

Paul Morrissey is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Growth. Paul is based in London and leads Blackstone Growth in Europe.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2021, Paul was a partner at Battery Ventures, focusing on later-stage growth equity investments. From 2012 to 2016, Paul was based in Battery’s San Francisco office before moving to London in 2016 to open Battery’s presence in Europe. At Battery Ventures, Paul was involved in Battery portfolio companies including Guardsquare, InCloudCounsel, PageUp, PrimeRevenue, Quinyx, Shippeo, Intacct (acquired by Sage), WebPT (acquired by Warburg Pincus), Gainsight (acquired by Vista Equity Partners) and Nitro (ASX:NTO). Prior to Battery, Paul spent time with Goldman Sachs’ investment-banking division focusing on the technology, media and telecom sectors.

Paul graduated from Stanford University, where he earned a BS in economics and played four years on the varsity men’s tennis team.

Michael Mostert

Managing Director

Mr. Mostert joined Blackstone in 2021. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Mostert worked for seven years in Sales & Distribution at Schroders where he focused primarily on raising capital for mutual funds, hedge funds and private market funds from intermediary investors in Switzerland and Liechtenstein. Prior to that, Mr. Mostert started his professional career in corporate and investment banking where he spent three years at Barclays Capital in Zurich and London and before those three years at BNP Paribas in Zurich and Paris.

Mr. Mount is involved with corporate restructuring efforts within European Private Credit and has worked on a number of complex workout situations.

Mr. Munfa is currently a director of Sabre Industries and Kinetik Holdings.

Kristan Nevins

Managing Director

Government Relations - DC

Kristan Nevins is a Managing Director of Government Relations. Ms. Nevins helps navigate political, legislative, and regulatory risk for the firm and provides advice to portfolio companies on related matters.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Ms. Nevins served in a variety of senior staff positions at the White House and on Capitol Hill, and most recently she was the White House Cabinet Secretary. Prior to joining the White House, she was a Chief of Staff on Capitol Hill and Chief of Staff to the Second Lady in the Office of the Vice President. Before returning to public service in the Office of the Vice President, she was at SBD Advisors where she was Director of Strategy. Her national security credentials hail from the Central Intelligence Agency, where she worked on Middle East and North Africa transnational issues, including counter proliferation, counterterrorism and cyber operations.

Ms. Nevins holds a Bachelor of Business Administration from Texas A&M University and a Masters in Business Administration from The University of North Carolina, Kenan-Flagler Business School.

Melanie Ng

Ms. Ng also leads Finance for Blackstone's Credit & Insurance and Private Wealth Solutions APAC businesses, supporting Blackstone semi-liquid strategies in APAC. Ms. Ng is a member of multiple boards.

Pete Nicholson

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Dallas

Pete Nicholson is a Managing Director in the Portfolio Operations group. Mr. Nicholson is involved in value creation initiatives and advisory services that seek to drive long-term growth objectives across Blackstone's portfolio of companies with a focus on pricing strategy and operations.

Over a career spanning almost two decades, working with many of the industry's highest-growth technology companies, Mr. Nicholson has helped to create some of the most innovative and impactful pricing, go-to-market, and business model transformations. Prior to Blackstone, he led pricing and operations at companies including Sprinklr, Anaplan, Autodesk, and Salesforce.

Mr. Nicholson earned an MBA from the Owen Graduate School of Management at Vanderbilt University and graduated from the University of Colorado, Boulder with a B.S. in Finance and Management.

William Nicholson

Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

William Nicholson is a Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities Group, based in New York. Since joining Blackstone in 2014, he has been involved in the firm’s investments in the Digital Realty Development JV, SKYY Japan, Lumina CloudInfra, DECA Dental Group, Cryoport, La Trobe Financial, DCI Data Centers, Northview Group, Netherlands Residential, and Residomo. During his time at Blackstone Mr. Nicholson has also worked in the firm’s London, Singapore and Hong Kong offices.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Nicholson worked at Barclays Capital in their Technology, Media and Telecommunications Investment Banking Group. He holds a BA from Oxford University.

Tom Nides

Vice Chairman

Executive Offices - New York

Thomas R. Nides is a Vice Chairman, Strategy and Client Relations at Blackstone. He supports a variety of strategic firmwide initiatives, special projects and focus on senior client relationships globally.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Nides served as the United States’ Ambassador to Israel from 2021 to 2023. Prior to that, he spent over a decade at Morgan Stanley in various capacities including Chief Operating Officer and Vice Chairman. Nides was appointed Deputy Secretary of State and Chief Operating Officer of the U.S. State Department by President Barack Obama and was awarded the nation’s highest diplomatic honor by Secretary of State Hillary Clinton for his service. He has also previously been a senior leader at Credit Suisse, Fannie Mae, the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, and on Capitol Hill.

Nides currently serves on the boards of the Partnership for Public Service, the International Rescue Committee, and the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). He formerly served as chairman of the board of the Woodrow Wilson Center. He received his B.A. from the University of Minnesota.

Ferdinand Niederhofer

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - San Francisco

Ferdinand Niederhofer is a Senior Managing Director and the Global Head of Technology Investing for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in San Francisco. Mr. Niederhofer has been with Blackstone since 2011 and has worked across the London, New York, and San Francisco offices.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Niederhofer worked in the Investment Banking and Global Capital Markets divisions for Morgan Stanley in London.

Mr. Niederhofer received a Business Administration degree from The University of St. Gallen, Switzerland, and an MBA with Distinction from INSEAD, France.

Anders Nielsen

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Berkeley Square House London

Anders Nielsen is a Managing Director and Head of EMEA Investment Strategy in Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions. Private Wealth Solutions’ mission is to bring institutional quality products across a broad spectrum of alternative asset classes to individual investors and their advisors. Mr. Nielsen joined Blackstone in 2022. 

Prior to his current role he spent almost 14 years at Goldman Sachs. He was head of the Macroeconomic Research and Investment Team in the Global Portfolio Solutions group, where he was responsible for the macro component of the group’s investment process. Before that, he held several macro roles in Global Investment Research in Goldman Sachs, with a particular focus on asset allocation. 

Mr. Nielsen holds a Ph.D. in Economics from Princeton University and a B.Sc. in Economics from University of Aarhus, Denmark. 

Atish Nigam

Sr. Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Atish Nigam is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA), where he serves as Chief Investment Officer of the Multi-Strategy platform.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Mr. Nigam spent a decade at Appaloosa Management, where he invested opportunistically across a diverse set of asset classes, including liquid equities and credit, private equities, distressed debt and other special situations. Prior to Appaloosa, Mr. Nigam worked at SAC Capital, FTV Capital and McKinsey & Company.

Mr. Nigam received a B.S. and M.Eng. in Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Mr. Nigam is also a CFA® charterholder.

Mitchell Nimocks

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Mitchell Nimocks is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Private Equity Group where he focuses on investments in the energy and energy transition sectors. Since joining Blackstone, Mitchell has been involved with the firm’s investments in Blue Sky Infrastructure, Cliff Swallow, Geosyntec, Legence and Olympus.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mitchell was a Vice President at Riverstone, an energy-focused private equity firm. Prior to Riverstone, he was an analyst at Credit Suisse in the Global Energy Group.

Mitchell received a B.S. in Computer Engineering, cum laude, from Tufts University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. 

Jeffrey Nirenberg

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Jeffrey Nirenberg is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group. Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Nirenberg has worked in in the financial reporting group and is involved in tax research, compliance and diligence matters for all Blackstone Real Estate Partners (BREP) funds, Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (BREDS) funds, and he has also been involved in tax matters relating to fund formation as well as BREP / BREDS acquisitions and dispositions. 

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Nirenberg was a Tax Manager at Deloitte & Touche, where he provided tax services to real estate investment trusts, opportunity funds and partnerships in the real estate industry including BREP. 

Mr. Nirenberg received a BS in Accounting and a MS in Taxation from the University at Albany.  He is an IRS Enrolled Agent.

Oliver Nisenson

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Oliver Nisenson is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Nisenson leads investments in Asset Based Finance. 

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Nisenson was a Managing Director at Credit Suisse where he held a range of leadership roles including Head of Securitized Products Lending. Prior to Credit Suisse, Mr. Nisenson was a founding partner at 20 Gates Asset Management responsible for private asset-backed credit opportunities. Earlier in his career, Mr. Nisenson worked as an analyst at Morgan Stanley in the Securitized Products Group.

Mr. Nisenson received a BS in Finance from Syracuse University. 

Dan Noone

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Dan Noone is a Managing Director who is involved with the Investment Operations Team for Blackstone Insurance Solutions.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Noone was the Head of Professional Services at IntegriDATA Business and Technology Solutions, responsible for proprietary system builds and the implementation of accounting and trading systems to support the investment operations of alternative asset managers.

Mr. Noone received a BA from Hobart College. 

Eric Nortman

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Eric Nortman is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Nortman worked in the Credit Investment group at Medley Management. Mr. Nortman began his career at BMO Capital Markets in its U.S. Leveraged Finance and Debt Capital Markets Group.

Mr. Nortman received a BBA in Finance and Accounting from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School where he graduated with Highest Honors.

Daniel Novoa

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Daniel Novoa is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group based in London. Mr. Novoa leads the Portfolio Management team in Europe and is involved in overseeing key initiatives and integrating information flows across Blackstone’s real estate portfolio.

Before joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Novoa held roles HSBC Alternative Investments Limited and J.P. Morgan Asset Management where he focused on Real Estate investments.

Mr. Novoa is a CFA Charterholder, a Chartered Surveyor, and a Fellow Chartered Certified Accountant, and received a BA(Hons) in Business Studies from London South Bank University.

Jacob Nowack

Managing Director

BXCI - Toronto

Jake Nowack is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit. He is involved with the origination and execution of investments in the infrastructure, energy transition and renewable energy sectors, and helps lead the Sustainable Resources Group’s efforts in Canada. 

Before joining Blackstone Credit, Mr. Nowack spent over a decade originating, executing, and managing infrastructure private equity investments, including as a Principal at Blackstone Infrastructure Partners, in both New York and London. Mr. Nowack also worked at Searchlight Capital Partners and Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan where he was focused on infrastructure private equity. He began his career in energy investment banking at TD Securities.

Mr. Nowack received an Honors Business Administration with Distinction and Deans Honors from The Richard Ivey School of Business at The University of Western Ontario.

Stephen O’Connor

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Stephen O’Connor is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Group and the Chief Compliance Officer of Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BMXA). In addition, Mr. O’Connor is involved in overseeing legal matters relating to the group’s commingled multi-manager products and a number of firm-wide strategic initiatives including Blackstone’s data science unit. Previously, Mr. O’Connor was involved in the legal structuring, negotiation and execution of investments by the BXMA’s Multi-Strategy platform and other direct trading platforms.

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. O’Connor was an Associate at Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP focusing on various corporate and asset management matters including private investment fund formations and mergers & acquisitions.

Mr. O’Connor received a BA from the University of Virginia and a JD from the University of Virginia School of Law.

Shannon O’Grady

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Shannon O’Grady is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit. Ms. O’Grady focuses on marketing, relationship management and business development. Ms. O’Grady joined Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2008 and started her career working with Blackstone’s Distressed Debt Securities Fund. Ms. O'Grady has earned the right to use the Chartered Financial Analyst designation and received a BA in Business Administration with an emphasis in Finance and a Certificate in International Studies in Business from the University of Washington.

David O’Neill

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

David O’Neill is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group. Since joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. O’Neill has analyzed and managed real estate investments across several property types including the creation of Invitation Homes, its IPO, and subsequent merger with Starwood Waypoint. Mr. O’Neill currently focuses on the asset management of various investments in the residential sector.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. O’Neill worked for Colliers International in Hong Kong.

Mr. O’Neill received a BS in Finance from Arizona State University and an MBA from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.

T. Max O’Neill

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

T. Max O’Neill is a Managing Director in the Global Tax Planning Group, focused on the Real Estate business.  Mr. O’Neill has been involved in the development and implementation of global tax planning strategies for the Real Estate funds and portfolio companies. 

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2018, Mr. O’Neill was an associate in the tax group at Sullivan & Cromwell LLP, where he represented clients on a broad range of domestic and cross-border tax matters and transactions.

Mr. O’Neill received a BA in Economics from Georgetown University and a JD from the Georgetown University Law Center.

Dan Oneglia

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Daniel Oneglia is a Senior Managing Director, the Global CIO of Liquid Credit Strategies, and leads liquid asset allocation for Blackstone Credit Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, in 2019, he spent 20 years at Goldman Sachs where he was a partner and led the Americas Multi-Strategy Investment (MSI) team within the Special Situations Group (SSG).

Mr. Oneglia graduated from Princeton University with a B.A. in History and a Certificate in Latin American Studies. Mr. Oneglia serves as the Chair of the Board of Trustees for The New York Foundling.

Yifat Oron

Sr. Managing Director

Blackstone Growth - Israel

Yifat Oron is a Senior Managing Director and head of the firm’s office in Tel Aviv, Israel. She leads Blackstone’s growth and tech investments in Israel for Blackstone Growth (BXG) and assists with other investing efforts across the firm. Prior to joining Blackstone, Yifat Oron was the CEO of LeumiTech, a leading Israeli technology banking platform, servicing and financing several thousand technology companies and supporting their global expansion via LeumiTech’s global footprint. She spent most of her career as a Partner at Vertex Venture Capital (an Israel-based venture fund), where she invested in and served as a board member of companies across the tech ecosystem.

Before joining Vertex, Ms. Oron was a technology investment banking associate at JPMorgan Chase & Co. in New York. Previously, she spent three years at the Directorate of R&D of the Israeli Ministry of Defense where she achieved the rank of Lieutenant in the Economics, Budget & Control Department.

Ms. Oron holds an M.B.A. from Tel-Aviv University and a B.Sc. in Economics and Management from the Technion, also known as the Israel Institute of Technology.

Roberta Osborne

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Roberta Osborne is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Mrs. Osborne received a B.A. in Economics from Harvard College and is a CFA charterholder.

Cecilia Ott

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Cecilia Ott is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2002, Ms. Ott was an Accounts and Client Relations Manager at C.O. Architects International.

Ms. Ott received a BSc in Life Sciences from Queen’s University in Canada, a Postgraduate Degree in International Relations from the University of La Sorbonne in Paris, France, as well as a Postgraduate Degree in International Business from the ORT University in Montevideo, Uruguay. In addition, she serves on the U.S Foundation for Queen’s University at Kingston.

Catherine Ow

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Singapore

Catherine Ow is a Managing Director in the Private Wealth Solutions Group, based in Singapore. She is involved in the marketing strategy for the firm’s private wealth business in Asia.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Ow was a Managing Director and Head of APAC Marketing at Wellington Management. She has extensive experience in driving and overseeing regional marketing efforts in the investment management industry and has held similar roles in the Singapore Exchange, Russell Investments and First State Investments.

Ms. Ow received her Master in International Studies from the National University of Singapore and BA in Business Studies from the Nanyang Technological University.

Maura Pally

Sr. Managing Director

Charitable Foundation - New York

Maura Pally is the Executive Director of the Blackstone Charitable Foundation, where she oversees all Blackstone Charitable Foundation activity, leading strategy and execution of programs in support of Blackstone’s goal of creating economic opportunity for under-resourced communities.

Ms. Pally joins from the Clinton Foundation, where she was most recently Executive Vice President. Prior to that, she worked at Bloomberg Philanthropies and as the Deputy Assistant Secretary at the Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs in the U.S. Department of State. She also served as Deputy General Counsel for Hillary Clinton’s 2008 presidential campaign, as manager of Politics and Public Policy at Oxygen Media, and as Special Assistant in the office of the White House Counsel.

She received a JD from the USC Gould School of Law and a BA from Brown University.

Dominik Palowski

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Dominik Palowski is a Managing Director and Head of Asset Management Europe in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies group, based in London. Since joining Blackstone in 2018, Mr. Palowski has been involved in originating, underwriting, structuring, and asset managing real estate debt investments across all asset types throughout Europe.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Palowski was in the U.S. Real Estate group at The Carlyle Group where he was involved with real estate equity investments across various sectors. Prior to that, Mr. Palowski was on the Real Estate Investment Management team at Starwood Hotels & Resorts.

Mr. Palowski received a BS from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia and an MBA from London Business School. 

Linso Pals

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - Berkeley Square House London

Linso Pals is a Senior Managing Director and Head of European Institutional Client Solutions for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in London.

Before joining Blackstone in 2024, Mr. Pals was a Managing Director and the Head of Continental Europe, Middle East & Africa Institutional Business at J.P. Morgan Asset Management. Prior to that he was a Vice President at Morgan Stanley Investment Management covering institutional relationships in Northern Europe. Mr. Pals previously worked as a senior relationship manager at F&C Investments and started his professional career at Mercer Investment Consulting in the Netherlands.

Mr. Pals received a MSc in Applied Physics from the Delft University of Technology (TUDelft) in the Netherlands and is a CFA Charterholder. 

Saleh Panahi

Managing Director

Private Equity - London

Saleh Panahi is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group in London, where he focuses on investments in the Energy Transition, Industrials, Media & Education industries. Since joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Panahi has been involved in a number of investments and currently serves on the boards of Leica, Schenck Process, Desotec and Enstall (formerly known as Esdec Solar Group).

Mr. Panahi is a member of Blackstone’s Diverse Professionals Network EMEA Task Force, and represents Blackstone on the Futures Committee of Impetus, an organization supporting underprivileged youths in the UK.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Panahi worked at Lazard in the German M&A team. 

Mr. Panahi received a Master degree (Dipl. Kaufm.) from the University of Mannheim. 

Paris Panayiotopoulos

Sr. Managing Director

Blackstone Life Sciences - Cambridge

Paris Panayiotopoulos is a Senior Managing Director in the Blackstone Life Sciences group and a member of its Investment Committee, having joined Blackstone as part of its acquisition of Clarus in December of 2018.

Mr. Panayiotopoulos has over 20 years of biopharmaceutical operating and investing experience having served as Operating Partner at Clarus, as CEO and President of Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ: ARIA), as member of the Board of Directors of The Medicines Company (NASDAQ: MDCO), as President of the US and Japan biopharmaceutical businesses of Merck KGaA (FWB: MRK), and as President of the Serono Research and Development Institute.

Mr. Panayiotopoulos is currently a founder and board member of Anthos Therapeutics and AvenCell Therapeutics, and previously served as founding Chairman of Genevant Sciences and FerGene. He is also on the Board of Advisors of the non-profit Life Science Cares.

He holds a combined BS in Chemistry and Management Studies from University College London and an MS from Cranfield Business School in the United Kingdom.

Manali Parekh

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Singapore

Manali Parekh is a Managing Director in the Private Wealth Solutions group, based in Singapore.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mrs. Parekh worked at J.P. Morgan in the Alternative Investments Group in Singapore, most recently as an Executive Director where she was responsible for the Southeast Asia and Australia business. Before moving to Asia, Mrs. Parekh managed relationships and investment portfolios of some of the world’s elite law firms and their principals as part of the J.P. Morgan Private Bank’s Law Firm Group in New York City.

Mrs. Parekh received a BBA from the Goizueta Business School at Emory University.

Amisha Parekh

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Amisha Parekh leads ESG diligence, policy development and strategy and reporting for Blackstone’s Private Equity Group.

Ms. Parekh joined Blackstone from Bloomberg LP, where she worked for four and a half years, most recently serving as product manager of Bloomberg’s Sustainable Finance Solutions, leading ESG data acquisition and curation efforts and was instrumental in launching Bloomberg’s sustainable finance product offering as Head of Sustainable Finance Product Incubation. Prior to Bloomberg, Ms. Parekh was a Senior Manager at Deloitte where she worked on corporate strategy projects and helped manufacturing, consumer goods, and retail clients develop sustainability strategies and improve operational performance. She is the co-author of High Performance Hospitality: Sustainable Hotel Case Studies and is an Adjunct Professor of Business Strategy for Sustainability at Glasgow Caledonian New York College.

Ms. Parekh earned her MBA from the Ross School of Business, University of Michigan, an MS in Environmental Policy and Behavior (also from the University of Michigan), and a BS in Computer Science from SUNY Binghamton.

Tuhin Parikh

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - Mumbai

Tuhin Parikh is the Head of Real Estate India. Since joining Blackstone in 2007, Mr. Parikh has been involved in identifying and evaluating Indian real estate in several sectors and completing significant transactions in business park developments and Class A office space plus listing India’s first REIT on the stock exchange in 2019.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Parikh was the CFO and subsequently CEO of TCG Urban Infrastructure Holdings Ltd., a national level office developer and asset owner in India.

Mr. Parikh received a Bachelor in Accountancy from Mumbai University and an MBA from Indian Institute of Management (Ahmedabad).

Chris Parisi

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Chris Parisi is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Parisi brings 20 years of experience working with Insurers and is responsible for delivering a premier client experience to BXCI’s insurance clients.

Before joining Blackstone in 2024, Mr. Parisi was a Managing Director on the Partner Solutions team at Hayfin Capital Management where he led efforts to establish and deliver private credit solutions to insurance companies in North America. Prior to that he was a Managing Director at BlackRock within the Financial Institutions Group responsible for a variety of insurance company relationships. Mr. Parisi worked in similar client relationship roles delivering insurance asset management capabilities at Goldman Sachs Asset Management and DWS Group (formerly Deutsche Asset Management).

Mr. Parisi received a BA in Management from Gettysburg College.

Andrew Park

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Andrew Park is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Park focuses on the direct lending business.

Mr. Park has over 12 years of experience in private credit. Before joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Park was a Senior Vice President at First Eagle Alternative Credit where he was head of U.S. retail business development. Prior to First Eagle Alternative Credit, Mr. Park was a Vice President at THL Credit, the private credit business of Thomas H. Lee Partners, where he was the head of subadvisory sales.

Mr. Park graduated with a BA in Political Science from Syracuse University.

Owen Parker

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Owen Parker is a Managing Director in Real Estate Securities, part of Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group, where he is involved in investments in liquid real estate securities.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Parker worked at Deutsche Bank, where he was most recently responsible for trading CMBS.

Mr. Parker holds a BS in Business Administration with an additional major in Statistics from Carnegie Mellon University, where he graduated with Honors.

Viral Patel

Sr. Managing Director

BX Private Equity Strategies - New York

Viral Patel is the Chief Executive Officer of Blackstone Private Equity Strategies (“BXPE”). Mr. Patel is a member of the Investment Committees for BXPE, Blackstone Growth and participates on the Investment Committee of technology focused deals in Private Credit.

Mr. Patel has been with Blackstone since 2005 and he was involved in the launch of Blackstone Tactical Opportunities, as well as incubating and building other Blackstone businesses. Mr. Patel was also the Global Head of Technology Investing for Blackstone Credit. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Patel was a member of the Credit Suisse Structured Products business. He has served on the boards of various Blackstone portfolio companies.

Mr. Patel graduated magna cum laude from Cornell University with a B.S. in Operations Research and Industrial Engineering.

Randy Patterson

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

Randy Patterson is a Managing Director of Human Capital in the Portfolio Operations group. He is involved with building and developing world-class leadership teams and organizations across the portfolio with the capabilities to create value and improve performance.

Mr. Patterson has spent more than 25 years focused on helping organizations to drive transformation and growth through effective human capital strategies and talent management practices. Prior to joining Blackstone, he served as Chief HR Officer for Wilsonart, a leading private equity-sponsored global manufacturer and distributor of engineered surfaces used in the office, education, healthcare, residential, hospitality and retail markets. Prior to Wilsonart, he served as the Chief HR Officer for BlueLinx, a previously private equity-controlled public company and leading distributor of building products across North America. Mr. Patterson has also served in various other HR leadership roles throughout his career, including Senior Vice President of HR for Wholesale Banking at SunTrust Bank (now Truist Bank) and HR Director for U.S. Operations, Pro Sales and Customer Service for The Home Depot.

Mr. Patterson earned his bachelor's degree in business management and his master’s degree in business administration from The J. Mack Robinson College of Business at Georgia State University in Atlanta, Georgia. He has also served on the board of directors for several leading HR associations focused on the development and effectiveness of HR leaders and professionals. 

David Payne

Sr. Managing Director

Finance - New York

David Payne is a Senior Managing Director and the Chief Accounting Officer at Blackstone.  Mr. Payne is responsible for the firm’s corporate accounting, public company financial reporting and accounting policy functions, and also provides oversight for Blackstone’s quarterly valuation processes. Additionally, Mr. Payne is the Head of Financial Planning & Analysis for the firm, where he is responsible for management reporting, earnings preparation, and firmwide strategic initiatives.  Previously, Mr. Payne was the Head of Corporate Development and had oversight for strategic mergers and acquisitions, new business initiatives and special projects in support of Blackstone and its business units.  Prior to these roles in Finance, Mr. Payne worked in the Private Equity group where he was involved in the evaluation and execution of private equity investments across a range of industries. 

Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Payne worked in the Private Equity group at TPG Capital and in the Mergers and Acquisitions group at Morgan Stanley & Co.

Mr. Payne received a BBA in Finance and Accounting from the University of Michigan, where he graduated with high distinction, and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Matthew Pedley

Sr. Managing Director

ICS - New York

Matthew Pedley is a Senior Managing Director and the Head of Institutional Client Solutions in the Americas for Private Equity-related strategies.

Before joining Blackstone in 2009, Mr. Pedley was in the venture capital arm of AllianceBernstein, where he was responsible for software venture investments, Limited Partner relations, fundraising and legal documentation for the fund.  Prior to AllianceBernstein, Mr. Pedley was at Crosslink Capital, where he was responsible for venture investments in the software and communications sectors.  He was an Observer on the boards of Evant (acquired by MANH), IM Logic (acquired by SYMC), and Jasper Wireless (acquired by CSCO); he was also involved with private investments in Good Technology (acquired by MOT) and Equinix (EQIX).  Prior to his career in venture capital, Mr. Pedley was a Senior Consultant with Andersen Consulting, where he provided strategic and business process guidance to the world's largest technology companies.

Mr. Pedley received his BA in Mechanical Engineering from Columbia University, where he was President of his Class.

Austin Pena

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Austin Peña is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS") group and is the Executive Vice President, Investments of Blackstone Mortgage Trust (NYSE:BXMT), a publicly-traded commercial mortgage REIT managed by Blackstone. Mr. Peña is responsible for BXMT’s investment strategy in addition to sourcing loans and other real estate debt investments for the REIT and other investment vehicles managed by Blackstone. 

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Peña worked at Barclays in the Real Estate Investment Banking Group, where he was involved in advising REITs and other real estate companies on mergers, acquisitions, restructurings and capital markets transactions. Mr. Peña previously held a similar role at Lehman Brothers.

Mr. Peña graduated magna cum laude with a BS in Economics from the University of Pennsylvania.

Kim Percy

Sr. Managing Director

Finance - London

Kim Percy is a Senior Managing Director in the Finance Group and is the EMEA Head of Finance based in London. Ms. Percy is responsible for the financial, regulatory, and tax reporting of Blackstone’s companies and funds based in EMEA and the UK. Ms. Percy partners with regional senior leadership to support the firm’s strategic growth objectives and is a member of multiple boards.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Percy was the Deputy Controller of BNY Mellon where she oversaw the financial reporting of its investment management business. Prior to that, Ms. Percy held various senior financial controller roles at Man Group plc, BlackRock, and Cargill, both in London and the USA.

Ms. Percy received a Bachelor of Business Administration and Bachelor of Arts from the University of North Dakota and is a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants.

Angelina Perkovic

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Angelina Perkovic is a Managing Director with Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Ms. Perkovic is involved with portfolio financing and management.

Ms. Perkovic joined Blackstone in 2005 and was previously a Senior Vice President responsible for compliance monitoring, testing and reporting for various leverage facilities as well as coordinating closing and funding of directly originated transactions. Prior to that, Ms. Perkovic worked at Royal Bank of Canada as an Assistant to the Portfolio Managers and Credit Analysts.

Ms. Perkovic received a BBA in Finance and Investments from Zicklin School of Business, Baruch College.

Eric Perlyn

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Eric Perlyn is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2007, Mr. Perlyn worked at Morgan Stanley in both the Investment Banking Equity Capital Markets Division, as well as the Investment Strategy and Asset Allocation Group.

Mr. Perlyn received a BA in Economics from Duke University and an MBA with a Concentration in Finance from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Greg Petersen

Managing Director

Human Resources - New York

Greg Petersen is a Managing Director in the Human Resources group and Head of Global Investment Recruiting. He is based in New York.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Petersen worked at the Global Executive Search firm, CTPartners, both in London and New York within the Asset Management practice focusing on alternative asset management. Previously, he worked at Armstrong International in London covering investment bank and hedge fund clients.

Mr. Petersen received a Masters’ in Economics from Edinburgh University in the U.K.

Stevi Petrelli

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Stevi Petrelli is a Managing Director and Head of Blackstone Innovations Investments (BXI Investments) at Blackstone. She oversees the firm’s internal investments in early-stage FinTech, PropTech, Cybersecurity and Enterprise Tech companies, working across BXTI and various businesses to drive these investments and help accelerate innovation across the firm.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2021, Ms. Petrelli worked at Goldman Sachs, where she helped oversee the firm's principal strategic investments portfolio and internal innovation incubation efforts as part of the Firmwide Strategy team. Ms. Petrelli also worked on core strategy efforts with a number of Goldman's businesses and helped lead the firm's financial technology partnership efforts. Earlier in her career, she was a Vice President at Point72 Ventures and a member of the Principal Strategic Investments team at Goldman Sachs. In both roles, Ms. Petrelli focused on sourcing and executing early-stage investment opportunities in the financial technology space.

Ms. Petrelli received a BA in Political Science from Yale University.

Robert Petrini

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Robert Petrini is a Senior Managing Director and the Global Chief Investment Officer for Private Credit and Joint Portfolio Manager for the Capital Opportunities strategy for in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone in 2005, Mr. Petrini was a Principal of DLJ Investment Partners (“DLJIP”), the $1.6 billion mezzanine fund of CSFB’s Alternative Capital Division. Prior to that, Mr. Petrini was a member of DLJ’s Leveraged Finance Group.

Mr. Petrini graduated magna cum laude with a BS in Economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, where he was a Joseph Wharton and Benjamin Franklin Scholar.

Al Picallo

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Albert (Al) Picallo is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Real Estate Debt Strategies group. Mr. Picallo joined Blackstone in 2022 and is involved in all aspects of commercial real estate underwriting. Previously, Mr. Picallo was a Managing Director at CBRE where he was Head of Underwriting and Advisory and was responsible for overseeing the firm’s third-party underwriting and due diligence platform. 

During his career, Mr. Picallo has focused on the origination, structuring, due diligence and underwriting of complex commercial real estate transactions across all property types and risk profiles.

Mr. Picallo received a B.A. in Finance from the University of Florida.

Jeanette Pieper

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Jeanette Pieper is a Managing Director in the Private Wealth Management Group. Since joining Blackstone, Ms. Pieper has focused her efforts on raising capital for Blackstone’s private and public funds, with a primary focus on the private wealth advisors in New York City.

Before joining Blackstone in the Fall of 2011, Ms. Pieper was Director of Business Development for alternative investments at UBS in New York. Prior to joining UBS, Ms. Pieper worked in the asset management and consulting divisions at both Smith Barney and Prudential Investments.

Ms. Pieper received a BA with Distinction from Simmons College.

Juergen Pinker

Sr. Managing Director

Private Equity - London

Juergen Pinker is a Senior Managing Director in the Private Equity Group. Mr. Pinker is the Head of Private Equity for Blackstone in Germany. In addition, Mr. Pinker focuses on the Industrials sector and leads Blackstone’s investment activities in the Energy Transition sector in Europe.

Since joining Blackstone in 2011, Mr. Pinker has been involved in the execution of Blackstone’s investments in Intertrust, ATC, Elian, Scout24, Armacell, Cerdia, Schenck Process, Stow Group (aka Averys), BME Group, Desotec, Huws Gray, Array Technologies Inc. and Enstall (formerly known as Esdec Solar Group).

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Pinker worked as a Director at Strategic Value Partners focusing on European distressed situations. Before that, Mr. Pinker was an Associate Director at The Carlyle Group where he was involved in leading and executing investments in various sectors.

Mr. Pinker is a Trustee and Member of the Finance Committee of FareShare.

Mr. Pinker received a Master's degree in economics and business from WHU-Otto Beisheim School of Management. Mr. Pinker currently serves on the Board of Directors of Cerdia, Schenck Process, Stow Group, BME Group, Desotec, Huws Gray and Enstall (formerly known as Esdec Solar Group).

Andrea Pitotti

Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

Andrea Pitotti is a Managing Director and European credit research analyst involved in the ongoing analysis and evaluation of primary and secondary fixed income investments.

Mr. Pitotti joined Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, during GSO’s acquisition of Harbourmaster Capital Management Limited in 2012.  Prior to that, Mr. Pitotti worked at Harbourmaster where he was responsible for several LBO transactions as well as led negotiations with lending groups, sponsors and banks on material waiver / amendments to credit agreements. Prior to joining Harbourmaster in 2007, Mr. Pitotti worked as a fund accountant at Fidelity Investment, where he was in charge of monitoring trading activities on the $10bn Fidelity Institutional Fund, as well as executing analytical review of each client’s portfolio.  Prior to moving to Fidelity, Mr. Pitotti worked at JP Morgan in Italy where he collaborated with MDs to build and maintain relationships with Italian government agencies.  Prior to joining JP Morgan, Mr. Pitotti worked as credit analyst in Banca Popolare di Milano, where he was responsible for first stage credit risk assessment. 

Mr. Pitotti received a Business Administration with full marks and a Master’s degree in Economics from the University of Roma Tre.

Jack Pitts

Sr. Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Jack Pitts is a Senior Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Group, where he serves as General Counsel of BXMA. Mr. Pitts is a Co-Chair of the Blackstone Diverse Professionals Network Task Force and a member of the Blackstone Charitable Foundation Leadership Council. Since joining Blackstone, Mr. Pitts has been involved in the legal structuring of BXMA’s customized and commingled multi-manager portfolios as well as the review, analysis and negotiation of investments by BXMA’s Multi-Strategy platform and other direct trading platforms and investment opportunities.

Before joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Pitts was an Associate at Debevoise & Plimpton LLP where he focused on advising sponsors of and institutional investors in private investment funds.

Mr. Pitts received a B.S. in Financial Management from Hillsdale College and a J.D. from Howard University School of Law, where he served as the Managing Editor of the Howard Law Journal.

Kevin Pivnick

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Kevin Pivnick is a Managing Director of Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group where he focuses on commercial mortgage loan originations on behalf of its insurance clients.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2018, Mr. Pivnick worked at Deutsche Bank for 14 years, based in London and New York. While at Deutsche Bank, Mr. Pivnick was most recently responsible for Deutsche Bank’s CMBS conduit origination activities throughout Europe and the US. Prior to working at Deutsche Bank, Mr. Pivnick held roles in commercial mortgage loan origination at Credit Suisse and RBS Greenwich Capital, each based in Los Angeles.

Mr. Pivnick received a Bachelor of Arts in English from Dartmouth College.

Chris Placca

Managing Director

Finance - New Jersey

Chris Placca is the Head of Finance and a Managing Director of the Infrastructure group, and he currently oversees the Valuations, Financial Planning and Analysis, Operations and Accounting teams for Infrastructure. Since joining Blackstone, Mr. Placca has been involved in administrative, accounting, tax and financial reporting matters for Blackstone's infrastructure and private equity funds.

Before joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Placca was the U. S. Controller at Apax Partners, L. P., a London based private equity firm, where he was primarily involved in fund management, administration and financial reporting for its U. S. private equity funds and well as financial reporting and daily operations for the U. S. management Company. Prior to that, Mr. Placca was a Vice President at CCMP Capital Advisors, a New York based private equity firm.Mr. Placca was involved in deal execution, funds administration and operational issues.

Steve Plavin

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Steve Plavin is a Senior Managing Director based in London and oversees Blackstone’s Real Estate Debt Strategies business in Europe. Previously, from when he joined Blackstone in 2012 until June 2021, Mr. Plavin was the Chief Executive Officer of Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc., a NYSE- listed commercial mortgage REIT that is managed by Blackstone.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Plavin served as CEO of Capital Trust, Inc. (predecessor of Blackstone Mortgage Trust) and CT Investment Management Co., LLC, a commercial real estate debt investment manager and rated special servicer that was wholly owned by Capital Trust and acquired by Blackstone in December 2012. Prior to joining Capital Trust in 1998, Mr. Plavin was co-head of Global Real Estate for The Chase Manhattan Bank and Chase Securities Inc.

Mr. Plavin received a B.A. from Tufts University and an M.B.A. from the J.L. Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University.

Chad Plotkin

Managing Director

Infrastructure - New York

Mr. Plotkin is a Managing Director in the Infrastructure Group where he focuses on operations and asset management in the energy transition vertical.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Plotkin was the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Clearway Energy Inc, and its predecessor, NRG Yield, Inc, a publicly listed energy infrastructure investor in and owner of primarily U.S. based renewable energy assets. From 2007 through 2016, Mr. Plotkin served in numerous leadership roles at NRG Energy Inc, including Senior Vice President, Finance and Strategy, Vice President and Head of Investor Relations, and Vice President of Strategy and M&A. Prior to his tenure at NRG Energy Inc, Mr. Plotkin worked in various other sectors including satellite communications, retail energy and began his career at Enron Corporation.

Mr. Plotkin currently serves on the Board of Directors for Tallgrass Energy. Mr. Plotkin received a BBA in Finance and Organizational Behavior from Southern Methodist University, where he graduated Magna Cum Laude and was elected to Beta Gamma Sigma.

Thomas Pologruto

Sr. Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Thomas Pologruto is a Senior Managing Director and Chief Technology Officer of Blackstone Data Science and Liquid Asset Management Technology. He is also the firm’s Chief Data Architect. Mr. Pologruto handles all aspects of technology across Blackstone’s Credit, Insurance, Alternative Asset Management, and Liquid Real Estate Credit businesses and assists our portfolio companies with managing their technology programs and strategy. As Chief Data Architect, he is focused on building a modern data stack with advanced analytics and visualization. He is also involved in the firm’s balance sheet investments in targeted, early-stage, technology-related opportunities.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Pologruto was a Quantitative Researcher and Senior Portfolio Manager at Kepos Capital. Prior to Kepos, he was the Chief Technology and Research Officer at Capstone Investment Advisors.

Mr. Pologruto graduated with honors and distinction from the University of Pennsylvania with a BA in Physics, Biochemistry and Biophysics as well as with a MS in Chemistry. Mr. Pologruto received a PhD in Biophysics from Harvard University. 

Thomas Pologruto

Sr. Managing Director

FinTech & Enterprise Technology

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Thomas Pologruto is a Senior Managing Director and Chief Technology Officer of Blackstone Data Science and Liquid Asset Management Technology. He is also the firm’s Chief Data Architect. Mr. Pologruto handles all aspects of technology across Blackstone’s Credit, Insurance, Alternative Asset Management, and Liquid Real Estate Credit businesses and assists our portfolio companies with managing their technology programs and strategy. As Chief Data Architect, he is focused on building a modern data stack with advanced analytics and visualization. He is also involved in the firm’s balance sheet investments in targeted, early-stage, technology-related opportunities.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Pologruto was a Quantitative Researcher and Senior Portfolio Manager at Kepos Capital. Prior to Kepos, he was the Chief Technology and Research Officer at Capstone Investment Advisors.

Mr. Pologruto graduated with honors and distinction from the University of Pennsylvania with a BA in Physics, Biochemistry and Biophysics as well as with a MS in Chemistry. Mr. Pologruto received a PhD in Biophysics from Harvard University.

Wade Pontius

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Wade Pontius is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Pontius was an Associate at J.P. Morgan, where he worked as a desk analyst and focused on distressed situations.

Mr. Pontius received a BA in Interdisciplinary Studies from the University of California, Berkeley. 

Nick Porter

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

Nick Porter is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, based in London. Since joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Porter has been involved with Blackstone’s asset management and transaction activities in the UK and Europe, across a variety of asset classes including logistics, residential and retail.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Porter was a Director at Lone Star, where he spent 9 years focused on the acquisition, financing and asset management of real estate and asset backed credit investments across Europe and Asia.

Mr. Porter received a BA (Hons) from the University of Liverpool and an MPhil from the University of Cambridge.

Victoria Portnoy

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Victoria Portnoy is a Managing Director in the Chief Legal Office and Head of Corporate Finance and Group Legal Affairs.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Portnoy practiced securities law at Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP, where she represented public and private corporations, underwriters and private equity sponsors in a wide range of capital markets and financing transactions and corporate governance and SEC matters.

Ms. Portnoy received a BA, magna cum laude, from Columbia University, where she was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and a JD, magna cum laude, from New York University School of Law, where she was elected to the Order of the Coif and served as Symposium Editor for the Annual Survey of American Law.

Robert Post

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Mr. Post is a Managing Director and Portfolio Manager of the US leveraged loan and high yield strategies in Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit. He sits on LCS's U.S. Syndicated Credit Investment Committee.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, in 2017 Mr. Post was a Junior Portfolio Manager at BlackRock, where his responsibilities included various leveraged loan and high yield mandates.  Previously, Mr. Post was an Analyst at BMO Capital Markets, where he was involved with the ongoing monitoring and structuring of leveraged finance transactions.  Mr. Post began his career at MetLife Investments as a credit analyst focused on corporate bonds.

Mr. Post received a B.A. in Economics with a concentration in Financial Markets from Colby College.

John Prete

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

John Prete is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Real Estate Group and Chief Operating Officer of Real Estate Americas Asset Management.

Since joining Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Prete has been involved in investments across several asset classes, including multifamily, Affordable Housing, student housing, manufactured housing, office, retail and self-storage.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Prete focused on US real estate acquisitions as a Portfolio Manager at the Abu Dhabi Investment and Vice President at Pacific Coast Capital Partners. Mr. Prete began his real estate career at Lehman Brothers Real Estate Partners.

Mr. Prete received a BS from Brigham Young University’s Marriott School of Management, where he graduated cum laude. 

Brian Privor

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - DC

Brian Privor is the Global Head of LP Communications in the Legal & Compliance group.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Privor spent five years as the chief regulatory officer of Ultimus Fund Solutions, and as the president of Ultimus’ compliance division, which provided chief compliance officers to both registered investment companies and investment advisers.  He previously served as senior counsel to the U.S. Senate Committee on the Judiciary after serving seven years as senior counsel in the SEC’s Division of Enforcement in the Asset Management Unit.  Before joining the SEC, Mr. Privor practiced law for eleven years at Morgan, Lewis & Bockius where he focused on litigation and corporate investigations.

Mr. Privor received a BA, summa cum laude, from Tulane University, and a JD, cum laude, from Harvard Law School. 

Tom Procida

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Thomas Procida is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Procida was co-Head of Treasury and an Operations Manager at TPG-Axon Capital, a fundamental long/short equity hedge fund.  Prior to TPG-Axon, Mr. Procida worked in Spear Leeds and Kellogg's Fixed Income Institutional Sales division.

Mr. Procida received an MBA from The Johnson School of Management at Cornell University and a BA in Economics from Loyola University in Maryland.

Pinak Pujari

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Pinak Pujari is a Managing Director in the Technology and Innovations group at Blackstone. He focuses on all aspects of software engineering across Blackstone’s Real Estate and Private Equity businesses and collaborates with portfolio companies to advise and align on technology solutions.

Prior to his current position, Mr. Pujari held a variety of significant roles leading software solutions for accounting, investor reporting, and entity management within Blackstone’s Technology and Innovations group. Before joining Blackstone in 2012, Mr. Pujari worked as a Software Engineer at Capital IQ, a division of Standard & Poor’s, and helped architect and develop the product Capital IQ Estimates which provides market forecast data.

Mr. Pujari holds a Master's degree in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University with a research focus on Artificial Intelligence, Computer Vision & Computer Integrated Surgery.

Jurij Puth

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - Frankfurt Omniturm

Jurij Puth is a Senior Managing Director and the Head of European Origination for Private Credit Strategies in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in Frankfurt. Mr. Puth is involved in various private and public credit investments, across the capital structure.

Mr. Puth joined Blackstone in 2006 as a founding member of the London office and relocated to Frankfurt in 2017. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Puth worked in investment banking on Credit Suisse’s Leverage Finance and Financial Sponsors team in London.

Mr. Puth holds a master’s degree in International Management, from Cass Business School in London, as well as the German and French equivalents from ESCP-EAP, Paris and Berlin.

Doyle Queally

Sr. Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York

Doyle Queally is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Strategic Partners, where he leads global business development for GP Stakes.

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. Queally spent two years in Blackstone Private Equity,  where he helped oversee private market fundraising in North America.  He previously spent 12 years in Blackstone Credit, where he was involved with the marketing of the firm’s public and private investment products with a geographic focus of the Midwest and West Coast of the United States, including many of Blackstone’s strategic relationships.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Queally was a Senior Vice President of Institutional Sales and Relationship Management for ING Investment Management. Prior to ING, he was a Senior Managing Director at Bear Stearns Inc, where he worked for over twenty years. Mr. Queally was a structured mortgage product specialist with extensive experience covering banks, money managers and hedge funds. In addition, he spent three years at the International Management Group (The Mark McCormack Organization) in Cleveland, Ohio, where he helped develop the team sports division. He started his career at IBM in New York City, specializing in banking.

Mr. Queally received a B.A. in economics from Denison University in Granville, Ohio. He also holds series 24, 7 and 63 licenses with FINRA.

Paul Quinlan

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York 601 Lex

Paul D. Quinlan is a Senior Managing Director and Chief Financial Officer of the Blackstone Real Estate group. Mr. Quinlan was previously the CFO for Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies and Blackstone Mortgage Trust. Prior to joining Blackstone in 2010, Mr. Quinlan worked at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, focusing on strategic corporate M&A and private equity investments. Mr. Quinlan received a BS in Finance cum laude from Georgetown University and an MBA with distinction from the NYU Stern School of Business.

Edward Rabinowitz

Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York

Edward B. Rabinowitz is a Managing Director, having joined Strategic Partners in 2009. Mr. Rabinowitz is an advisory board member of multiple funds.

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. Rabinowitz attended Cornell University where he graduated with a B.S. in Hotel Administration.

Prakash Rajah

Managing Director

Private Equity - Sydney

Prakash Rajah is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group, where he focuses on technology, leisure & entertainment and healthcare investments.

Before joining Blackstone in 2020, Mr. Rajah was a Vice President at Brookfield Capital Partners in Sydney, supporting its entrance into the Australian market. Mr. Rajah started his career in the Mergers & Acquisitions Group at Goldman Sachs.

Mr. Rajah has a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Melbourne, majoring in Finance & Economics and has an Honours Degree in Finance (First Class) from the University of Sydney, where he received The Joye Medal as top of his cohort.

Ramzi Ramsey

Managing Director

Blackstone Growth - San Francisco

Ramzi Ramsey is a Managing Director at Blackstone Growth, focusing on investing in the enterprise software and financial technology sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2021, Ramzi has led Blackstone’s investments in Cloudinary, Dynamo, and Hotel Engine. 

Prior to Blackstone, Ramzi was a Partner at SoftBank’s Vision Fund and led investing activity in the enterprise software sector. Prior to SoftBank, Ramzi was an investor at TCV (Technology Crossover Ventures) and began his investing career at TA Associates. Ramzi has been a board member or investor in companies including Attentive Mobile, Automation Anywhere, Avvo, Cloudinary, Dynamo, Financial Software Systems, Hotel Engine, Ion Trading, Nerdy (NYSE: NRDY), OneTrust, Qualtrics (NASDAQ: XM), Rover (NASDAQ: ROVR), SeatGeek, Wall Street Systems, and Zillow (NASDAQ: Z). From 2019 through 2021, Ramzi was recognized as a Top 40 under 40 growth equity investor by GrowthCap. 

Ramzi received his B.S. from Carnegie Mellon University with university and college honors and completed his MBA from Harvard Business School. 

Stephen Ramsthaler

Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York 601 Lex

Stephen P. Ramsthaler is a Managing Director in the Strategic Partners Finance department, having joined in 2019.

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. Ramsthaler was a Managing Director at GCM Grosvenor, where he led the fund finance operations for the firm’s private equity business. Prior to joining GCM Grosvenor, Mr. Ramsthaler was a Managing Director in the Asset Management division of Credit Suisse. In this role, he was responsible for overseeing the operations for various business units, including Strategic Partners.

Mr. Ramsthaler received a B.S. in Accounting from Rutgers University.

Brian Rapp

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Chicago

Brian Rapp is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group. He is involved with Blackstone’s investments in healthcare including TeamHealth, Center for Autism and Related Disorders (CARD), HealthEdge, and Precision Medicine Group.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Rapp worked as Chief Operations and Strategy Officer for Compass Health Center (mental healthcare); before joining Compass, Mr. Rapp was a Partner at McKinsey & Company where he helped lead the Healthcare Strategy and Operations Practice in North America.

Mr. Rapp received a BA from Harvard in Economics.

Sheila Rapple

Sr. Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Sheila Rapple is a Senior Managing Director and Global Head of Investor Services in Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions Group. In this role, she oversees investor services and devotes many of her efforts towards helping to build out the processes needed to support new products and channels. Prior to leading Investor Services, she was Head of the Internal Sales & Service Desk for the Private Wealth Management Group.

Before joining Blackstone in 2011, Ms. Rapple worked with Legg Mason, Inc.,  most recently as Director, Separately Managed Account Product Manager in Legg Mason's retail distribution unit, where she was responsible for SMA product maintenance, product development, platform placement, sales, marketing, operations, and client service. Ms. Rapple began her career with Smith Barney Asset Management working in their sales and marketing team promoting Smith Barney mutual funds and separately managed accounts.

Ms. Rapple received a BS in Marketing & Management from Siena College.

Kiran Reddy

Sr. Managing Director

Blackstone Life Sciences - Cambridge

Kiran Reddy is a Senior Managing Director in the Blackstone Life Sciences group having joined in May 2020. Dr. Reddy was previously the President & CEO of Praxis Precision Medicines, which he co-founded in November 2016.

Previously, Dr. Reddy was at Biogen where he was part of the corporate develop and strategy leadership team. Dr. Reddy was also an Associate Partner at Third Rock Ventures. He supported and managed various portfolio companies in addition to focusing on new company formation and new investments. He was part of the founding team and interim Chief Business Officer for SAGE Therapeutics through its IPO. Dr. Reddy was part of the team that launched Foundation Medicine, and he has served as a Board Observer for Alnara pharmaceuticals, Rhythm pharmaceuticals and PanOptica pharmaceuticals.

Dr. Reddy holds MD and MBA degrees from Georgetown University. He completed his internship in medicine and his neurology residency at Harvard/Massachusetts General Hospital. Dr. Reddy was previously a Howard Hughes science fellow and has authored several peer-reviewed scientific papers in the field of epilepsy, neuroimmunology and neurodegenerative diseases.

Alok Reejhsinghani

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Alok Reejhsinghani is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2022, Mr. Reejhsinghani was a Founding Partner at Vitalium Capital Partners where he served as Chief Risk Officer and Head of Trading. Prior to Vitalium, Mr. Reejhsinghani was a Managing Director and Head of Trading at Third Point LLC.

Mr. Reejhsinghani received an M.B.A. from NYU, an MS in Computer Engineering from University of Florida and a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University.

Omar Rehman

Sr. Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

Omar Rehman is a Senior Managing Director and serves as the firm’s Deputy Global Head of Compliance. He is also currently the Chief Compliance Officer for Blackstone’s Private Equity group.

Before joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Rehman was Global Head of Compliance for the Merchant Banking Division at Goldman Sachs. Prior to that role, Mr. Rehman was a Vice President in Investment Banking Compliance at Goldman Sachs. Before joining Goldman Sachs in 2006, Mr. Rehman was an associate at the law firm of Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton where he specialized in capital markets transactions and corporate governance issues.

Mr. Rehman received his undergraduate degree from Duke University cum laude. Mr. Rehman was a Harlan Fiske Stone scholar at Columbia University School of Law, where he received a JD, and graduated with a master’s degree in law from the Université de Paris I – Panthéon Sorbonne.

Kristen Reiner

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Kristen Reiner is a Managing Director on the Real Estate Institutional Client Solutions team, based in New York.

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2016, Ms. Reiner worked at Goldman Sachs in the Securities division, covering futures and derivatives. 

Ms. Reiner received a BA from Princeton University where she graduated with honors and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

William Renahan

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York 601 Lex

William Renahan is a Managing Director in the Legal and Compliance Department and serves as the Chief Compliance Officer of Blackstone’s Registered Funds.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Renahan was a Senior Managing Director at Duff & Phelps Investment Management and served as Chief Compliance Officer of its investment adviser and affiliated registered investment companies.

He graduated with a B.A. from Hobart College, a J.D. with honors from Albany Law School, and a Master of Laws in Taxation from New York University School of Law.  He is admitted to practice law in New York State and holds Series 7 and 24 FINRA licenses.

Richard Reyes

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Rich Reyes is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group, and he currently focuses on new investment opportunities in the multifamily sector. Since joining Blackstone in 2017, Mr. Reyes has been involved in the acquisition of over 100,000 multifamily units.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Reyes was an Assistant Vice President at Waterton Associates and involved in acquisitions across the United States.

Mr. Reyes received a BS in Finance from the University of Illinois.

Devon Rinker

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Devon Rinker is a Managing Director in the Private Equity Group. 

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Rinker was an associate at KKR, where he evaluated and executed private equity investments in the technology, media and communications industries. Prior to that, he worked in investment banking at Evercore Partners.

Mr. Rinker received a BS in Commerce from the University of Virginia, where he graduated with distinction and Beta Gamma Sigma, and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Jonathan Roberts

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Jonathan Roberts is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Securities group, part of Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group. He evaluates public real estate-related investments.

Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Roberts has been involved in analyzing a wide array of real estate debt opportunities across public and private markets.

Prior to Blackstone, Mr. Roberts started his career in the Real Estate Investing and Servicing business unit of Starwood Property Trust focused on high yield debt investing and special servicing.

Mr. Roberts holds a BS in Interdisciplinary Studies in Real Estate Finance from Cornell University.

Joseph Rocco

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Joseph Rocco is a Managing Director in Blackstone Treasury and is involved in credit and risk management initiatives for Blackstone’s Treasury operations, including risk assessment for the firm’s cash management and investment strategies. He works closely with counterparts from throughout the firm and its funds on funding initiatives and FX hedging and trading strategies. Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Rocco worked at Moody’s Investors Service covering residential mortgage and asset-backed securities where his primary responsibilities included rating surveillance, methodology development and sector commentary. Mr. Rocco holds an MBA from New York University’s Stern School of Business and a BS in Finance from Fordham University.

Jean Rogers

Senior Managing Director and Blackstone’s ESG Chairperson

ICS - New York

Dr. Jean Rogers is a Senior Managing Director and Blackstone’s ESG Chairperson. She partners with investment and ICS teams on energy transition and ESG-related initiatives.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Dr. Rogers advised companies and asset managers on long-term ESG integration as an independent board director and C-level advisor. Dr. Rogers founded and led the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB), a non-profit dedicated to optimizing US capital markets by fostering disclosure of material sustainability information that meets investor needs and enhances public trust. Before founding SASB, Dr. Rogers worked to advance sustainable development across the US, Europe and China for more than a decade at Arup, a global engineering consultancy specializing in low-carbon infrastructure and green buildings, and Deloitte, where she worked on environmental projects in its manufacturing practice.

Dr. Rogers holds a PhD in environmental engineering from Illinois Institute of Technology and earned both her BE and ME in civil and environmental engineering from Manhattan College. She was a Loeb Fellow at Harvard University and currently serves as an advisor to the Social Innovation and Change Initiative at the Harvard Kennedy School and the Hoffman Global Institute at INSEAD. Dr. Rogers serves on the Board of Directors of Xpansiv, a Blackstone portfolio company, as well as on the Investment Committees for certain of Blackstone’s strategies in private equity and private credit focused on energy transition and climate solutions.

Greg Roppa

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Gregory Roppa is a Managing Director in the Global Fund Finance group where he focuses on the accounting and financial reporting for certain entities within Blackstone Credit, Real Estate, & Insurance businesses.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Roppa was the Director of Operations and Fund Accounting for Clinton Group Inc., an alternative asset management firm.  Prior to that Mr. Roppa began his career in the financial services audit practice at Arthur Andersen LLP. 

Mr. Roppa received a BS in Accounting from Binghamton University, where he graduated Cum Laude.  He is a Certified Public Accountant. 

David Rosen

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York 601 Lex

David Rosen is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies Group based in New York. Mr. Rosen oversees valuations, financial reporting, and portfolio operations for the BREDS business.

Before joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Rosen worked at General Electric where he held multiple roles across their Asset Management and Treasury groups. Prior to those roles, Mr. Rosen was a member of General Electric’s Corporate Audit Staff and a graduate of its Financial Management Program.

Mr. Rosen received a BS in Applied Economics and Management from Cornell University.

William Rosener

Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York

William L. Rosener is a Managing Director and the Head of Institutional Client Solutions for Strategic Partners. Mr. Rosener has worked with Strategic Partners since 2007 and leads the capital raising and business development activities for the Strategic Partners platform.

Prior to joining Strategic Partners, Mr. Rosener was a member of the Private Equity Product Specialist team with Credit Suisse Alternative Investments, where he focused on the development, structuring and distribution of Credit Suisse’s wholly-owned and joint venture private equity funds, including Strategic Partners. Prior to joining Credit Suisse, Mr. Rosener was an M&A legal analyst at Deutsche Bank in Paris.

Mr. Rosener received a B.A. in French Literature from Emory University, where he was Senior Editor of the Emory Political Review. Mr. Rosener is fluent in French.

James Rosenfeld

Managing Director

Real Estate - London

James Rosenfeld is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in London. Mr. Rosenfeld focuses on Blackstone’s real estate acquisitions in the UK. Since joining Blackstone in 2014, Mr. Rosenfeld has been involved in a number of Blackstone’s investments in the UK, including iQ Student Accommodation, Sage Housing, and The Office Group.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Rosenfeld was an Analyst in the investment banking division at Goldman Sachs International.

Mr. Rosenfeld graduated from the University of Oxford with a first-class degree in History and received an MPhil in Real Estate Finance from the University of Cambridge

Kate Rubenstein

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Kate Rubenstein is a Managing Director and the Chief Operating Officer of North America Private Credit for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Ms. Rubenstein serves as Chief Operating Officer of Blackstone Private Credit Fund (BCRED) and Blackstone Secured Lending Fund (BXSL).

Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Ms. Rubenstein created and led the GSO Advantage platform (now Blackstone Credit Value Creation program), which brings Blackstone’s broad set of capabilities to drive operational efficiencies and growth for BXCI’s portfolio companies.
