Aaron Weymouth

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Aaron Weymouth is a Managing Director in the Technology and Innovations group at Blackstone. He oversees product development across Blackstone’s Private Equity businesses where he advises the firm's private equity teams and portfolio companies on internally built and third-party product strategy.

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Weymouth served as the Chief Product Officer at ROKO Labs, where he led the development of B2C SaaS products for clients in the finance, healthcare, gaming and consumer industries. Prior to that, he worked at Relationship Science, where he led the mobile product team and helped build the company. Mr. Weymouth began his career at S&P Capital IQ, focused on product management.

Mr. Weymouth received a Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.

Kurt Wheeler

Operating Partner

Blackstone Life Sciences - San Francisco

Kurt C. Wheeler is an Operating Partner in the Blackstone Life Sciences group and a member of its Investment Committee, having joined Blackstone as part of its acquisition of Clarus in December 2018. Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Wheeler was a co-founder and Managing Director of Clarus since the firm's inception in 2005.

Mr. Wheeler has over 30 years of direct investment and industry operating experience within the healthcare sector where he has led investments in the medical technology, specialty pharmaceutical, and biotechnology space including partnerships with pharmaceutical companies. Prior to Clarus, Mr. Wheeler was a General Partner at MPM Capital, a healthcare venture capital firm. Mr. Wheeler was a co-founder and CEO of InControl, a medical device company which he sold to Guidant.

Mr. Wheeler holds a BA from Brigham Young University and an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School.

Carlos Whitaker

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

 Carlos Whitaker is a Senior Managing Director and the President of Blackstone Private Credit Fund (BCRED) and Blackstone Secured Lending Fund (BXSL) in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Whitaker had a 21-year career at Credit Suisse where he was a Managing Director and senior executive in the Global Markets division.

Mr. Whitaker received a Bachelor of Arts from the Plan II Honors Program, a Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting, and a Master of Professional Accounting from the University of Texas at Austin, where he graduated with honors. Mr. Whitaker is a member of the McCombs School of Business Advisory Council at the University of Texas at Austin. He also sits on the boards of New York for McCombs and Rising Stars Capital Management, which is a nonprofit focused on improving diversity in the finance industry. 

Paul White

Managing Director

Executive Offices - New York

Paul White is a Managing Director in the Finance Group. Since joining Blackstone, Mr. White has been involved in a variety of matters pertaining to individual financial planning, cash management, investments, philanthropy, taxation and accounting.

Before joining Blackstone in 2004, Mr. White worked as a Senior Tax Manager at Deloitte and Touche and as a Tax Principal at Arthur Andersen LLP, focusing in the areas of individual tax consulting, planning and compliance.

Mr. White received a BA in English from Tufts University. An MS from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism and an MBA from Baruch College.

Caroline Widman

Managing Director

Human Resources - Los Angeles

Caroline Widman is a Managing Director in the Human Resources Group. Since joining Blackstone, Ms. Widman has focused on Blackstone’s organizational development efforts, including the firm’s performance evaluation process. She has also been involved in Human Resources systems and process development initiatives, and has managed many firm charity campaigns, diversity and training programs. Before joining Blackstone in 2004, Ms. Widman worked as a Program Coordinator at Reach Out and Read of Greater New York. Ms. Widman received a BA in Psychology from Washington University in St. Louis and an MA in Organizational Psychology from Columbia University.

Michael Wiebolt

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Mike Wiebolt is the Global Head of Securities in the Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group. In this role, he focuses on public and private real estate-related investments.

Before joining Blackstone, he worked at Goldman, Sachs & Co where he was most recently responsible for trading high yield CMBS and CRE CDOs.

Mr. Wiebolt holds a BA in History from Carleton College, where he graduated magna cum laude and was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. Mr. Wiebolt also received a Master’s in Business Administration from the Columbia Graduate School of Business. Mr. Wiebolt serves on the Board of Trustees at Carleton College and the Associates Council of Prep for Prep.

Jeffrey Wilkie

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

John Winn

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - New York

John Winn is a Managing Director in the Portfolio Operations group, providing strategic support and advice to the firm’s investment teams and portfolio companies with a focus on technology, cloud computing and digital innovation.

Before joining the Portfolio Operations group, Mr. Winn was a Principal Architect for Amazon Web Services (AWS) in their private equity group. Prior to that, Mr. Winn was the Chief Product and Risk Officer of Amphora and Solutions Director at Eka, both leading providers of Commodity Trading and Risk Management (CTRM) software. Mr. Winn was a Director of the Open Source Division at Finastra (formerly Misys Corporation). His team at Misys was featured in Harvard Business Review’s, “Great Leaders in Innovation.”

Mr. Winn received a Bachelor of Business (Distinction) and a Bachelor of Information Technology (Distinction) from the Queensland University of Technology (QUT). He has a Master of Arts in Chinese Studies from the University of Sydney, and a Master of Science in Applied Statistics from Swinburne University in Melbourne, and a Master of Science in Cybersecurity from Georgia Tech.

Rob Wisniewski

Managing Director

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Rob Wisniewski is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Technology and Innovations group and serves as the firm’s Chief Software Architect as well as the Chief Technology Officer of Client and Firmwide Platforms. He is involved with technical leadership of firmwide tools such as Niagara, BXAccess, Investran, Anaplan and their underlying frameworks.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Wisniewski served as Chief Technology Officer at CLEAR, building a technical delivery organization focused on biometric identity and security. Prior to joining CLEAR, he was Vice President of Engineering at Symphony Communications, delivering end-to-end secure and compliant messaging systems for financial services companies.

Mr. Wisniewski received a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and a Master’s Degree in Computer Science from the University of Minnesota.

Rob Wisniewski

Managing Director

Enterprise Technology

BXTI - New York 601 Lex

Rob Wisniewski is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Technology and Innovations group and serves as the firm’s Chief Software Architect as well as the Chief Technology Officer of Client and Firmwide Platforms. He is involved with technical leadership of firmwide tools such as Niagara, BXAccess, Investran, Anaplan and their underlying frameworks.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Wisniewski served as Chief Technology Officer at CLEAR, building a technical delivery organization focused on biometric identity and security. Prior to joining CLEAR, he was Vice President of Engineering at Symphony Communications, delivering end-to-end secure and compliant messaging systems for financial services companies.

Mr. Wisniewski received a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and a Master’s Degree in Computer Science from the University of Minnesota.

Paul Wolpe

Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Paul Wolpe is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Debt Strategies (“BREDS”) group. He is the head of the BREDS Portfolio Management Group and a senior member of the BREDS residential investment team. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Wolpe was a Managing Director at the CIT Group and an Executive Vice President at OneWest Bank prior to its sale to CIT.  Prior to OneWest Mr. Wolpe worked at Dune Capital where he was part of the team responsible for buying IndyMac Bank from the FDIC and creating OneWest.

Mr. Wolpe received a B.S. in Computer Science and Economics from Carnegie Mellon University.

John Wrafter

Managing Director

BXCI - Ireland

Mr. Wrafter is a Managing Director and a Portfolio Manager of the European commingled funds and European separately managed accounts in Blackstone Credit’s Liquid Credit Strategies (“LCS”) unit. Mr. Wrafter is also responsible for LCS’s European secondary trading activity and sits on LCS’s European Syndicated Credit Investment Committee and Asset Allocation Committee.

Mr. Wrafter joined Blackstone in 2012, when Blackstone Credit, then known as GSO Capital Partners, acquired Harbourmaster Capital Management Limited. Prior to that, Mr. Wrafter was a Senior Analyst in the Portfolio Management Group at Harbourmaster Capital Management where his main responsibility was to support the Portfolio Managers for the various Funds under management at Harbourmaster Capital.  Mr. Wrafter was also involved in Investor Relations, Client Due Diligence, Capital Formation and Fund Marketing.  Prior to joining Harbourmaster Capital, Mr. Wrafter worked at Bank of New York Mellon/JP Morgan Global Corporate Trust where he was responsible for various CDO Transactions.  Mr. Wrafter has also spent five years working in New York, primarily trading the US Treasury and Foreign Exchange Markets.

Mr. Wrafter received a Bachelor of Commerce Degree and a Masters of Business Studies Degree in Finance from University College Dublin.

Eric Wu

Sr. Managing Director

Real Estate - New York

Eric Wu is a Senior Managing Director in the Real Estate Group and Global Co-Head of Real Estate Debt Capital Markets. Mr. Wu was previously Chief Operating Officer of Real Estate Americas.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Wu spent over 5 years at Barclays where he was Head of Originations for the commercial real estate lending business in the United States.  Prior to Barclays, Mr. Wu worked at Morgan Stanley where he held various roles in the CMBS and merchant banking groups in the US and in Europe.

Mr. Wu received a BS in Economics and a BA in Chemistry from Duke University where he graduated magna cum laude and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

Robin Wynn

Sr. Managing Director

Human Resources - New York

Robin Wynn is Senior Managing Director and Global Head of Employee Relations in the Human Resources group. Ms. Wynn focuses on coaching and guiding senior business leaders on employee issues. She also oversees the “Respect at Work” program and engages in various initiatives to help mitigate and control the firm’s risk.

Before joining Blackstone in 2008, Ms. Wynn worked as a HR Business partner supporting the liquids businesses in the Citi Alternative Investments business at Citigroup. She also played a key role supporting the Global Private Equity business at Warburg Pincus. She has held the following positions: Vice President, Senior HR Generalist at Deutsche Bank; Divisional VP, HR Generalist/Employee Relations Officer at UBS PaineWebber; and Assistant Vice President of Technology Staffing and a variety of roles at Chase Manhattan Bank.

Ms. Wynn received a BA in Behavioral Sciences from Concordia College and a MS from Fordham University.

Ms. Wynn is also the recent author of a Harvard Business Review article entitled “When to Bring in a Professional Coach."

Erin Yam

Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - Hong Kong

Erin Yam is a Managing Director, Head of Greater China in Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions Group, based in Hong Kong.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Yam focused on developing sales strategies for onshore China at Morgan Stanley Investment Management. Prior to Morgan Stanley, Ms. Yam was involved in the equity derivatives business at Barclays Capital and Credit Suisse.

Ms. Yam received a Master of Science in Financial Mathematics from Stanford University and a Bachelor of Mathematics in Actuarial Science and Statistics from University of Waterloo. She is a CFA charter holder and speaks fluent English, Mandarin, and Cantonese. 

Ralph Yang

Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - New York

Ralph Yang is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Tactical Opportunities Group, where he focuses on executing transactions in the business services and financial technology and services verticals. Mr. Yang’s existing investments includes InComm Payments, North American Bancard, Peridot Financial and Global Supply Chain Finance, Riveron, Trilliant, and multiple Structured Risk Transfer (SRT) investments with banks. Since joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Yang has also been involved with Blackstone’s investments in BlueYonder, Cloudreach, Concert Golf Partners, Cylance, Finance of America, Locus Point, NCR, and Valkyrie Aviation.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Yang was an Associate at KKR & Co. He began his career as an Investment Banking Analyst at Goldman Sachs & Co.

Mr. Yang holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce from the University of British Columbia (UBC), where he graduated with honors and is a Leslie Wong Fellow as part of UBC’s Portfolio Management Foundation.

Emily Yoder

Sr. Managing Director

Executive Offices - New York

Emily Yoder is a Senior Managing Director in the Strategic Relationships group. Ms. Yoder serves as a primary interface with Blackstone’s banking and other financial services partners, and is responsible for delivering a firm-wide approach to relationship management.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Ms. Yoder worked at JPMorgan as a Managing Director in their Senior Relationship Management team, focusing on hedge funds and alternative asset managers. Ms. Yoder started her career in trading for JPMorgan, and was a founding member of the Emerging Markets Eurobond Trading team at JPMorgan in London. Ms. Yoder was the primary risk taker focusing on FX, Cross-Currency Swaps, and Local Market government bonds in CEEMEA & Latin America.

Ms. Yoder currently sits on the board of Calvary, a leading end-of-life hospital and hospice care provider in the New York Tri-State area.

Ms. Yoder received a B.A. in Mathematical Economic Analysis and Latin America Studies from Rice University.

Andrew Yongvanich

Managing Director

BX Private Equity Strategies - New York

Andrew Yongvanich is a Managing Director in the Blackstone Private Equity Strategies (“BXPE”) group.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Yongvanich was a Managing Director at Nuveen, where he led Product Strategy followed by Global Real Estate Product, covering both institutional and private wealth clients. He was responsible for product development, management and capital formation. Prior to joining Nuveen, Mr. Yongvanich was at UBS in the Global Alternative Investment Solutions group. He focused on sourcing and structuring private market fund offerings including private credit, real estate and hedge funds.

Mr. Yongvanich received a B.S. in Engineering from Cornell University.

Robert Young

Managing Director

Legal & Compliance - New York

Robert Young is a Managing Director in the Legal & Compliance Department and the General Counsel for insurance in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Before joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Young practiced in the Investment Funds, Advisers and Derivatives group at Sidley Austin LLP. Mr. Young began his career as an Associate at Davis Polk & Wardwell LLP, where he focused on advising sponsors of, and institutional investors in, private investment funds.

Mr. Young received a BA magna cum laude from the University of Nevada Las Vegas and a JD from Harvard Law School.

Ward Young

Sr. Managing Director

Strategic Partners - New York

Edward (“Ward”) Young is a Senior Managing Director in Blackstone Strategic Partners. Mr. Young serves as the Chief Investment Officer of Blackstone GP Stakes, focusing on the acquisition of minority ownership interests in private-market alternative asset management firms. 

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Young spent more than 12 years at The Carlyle Group, where he focused on investments in the Infrastructure and Power sectors. Before joining Carlyle, he began his career at UBS Investment Bank.

Mr. Young received an A.B. in History and Political Science from Brown University, where he graduated magna cum laude with high honors and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

Eric Yuen

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Eric Yuen is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Yuen is focused on developing quantitative tools, integrating data science solutions, and utilizing alternative data to augment decision making throughout the investment lifecycle.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Yuen was an Executive Director at J.P. Morgan in the Digital Strategy and Fintech Group where he led the strategy and portfolio management team. Over his 18-year tenure at J.P. Morgan, Mr. Yuen worked in a variety of areas, including the Global Commodities Group, Investor Relations, Fixed Income Group, and Finance Group across multiple locations including New York, Tokyo, and Sydney.

Mr. Yuen holds a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of New South Wales, Australia and is a Certified Practicing Accountant from CPA Australia. He also serves on the board of Trustees of The Caedmon School in New York City.

Pak Man Yuen

Managing Director

Real Estate - Hong Kong

Pak Man Yuen is a Managing Director in the Real Estate group and is based in Hong Kong. Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Mr. Yuen has been involved in a number of Blackstone’s investments across Asia, including SCPG, Tysan Holdings, Taubman Asia and the GE Australia portfolio.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Yuen was a member of the acquisitions team at Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing.

Mr. Yuen received a BS in Computer Science and MS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford University, where he graduated with distinction, was elected to Phi Beta Kappa and was a Terman Scholar. Mr. Yuen currently serves on the board of Tysan Holdings.

Jimmy Yung

Managing Director

Real Estate - Los Angeles

Jimmy Yung is a Managing Director in Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies based in Los Angeles and oversees West Coast debt investments. Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Yung was Head of Originations and a member of the Investment Committee for TPG Real Estate Finance Trust. Previously, he was Head of Originations for Deutsche Bank’s US Commercial Real Estate Special Situations business focused on principal high yield finance and distressed debt acquisitions. Mr. Yung received a BA from Georgetown University.

Robert Zable

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Robert Zable is the Global Head of Liquid Credit Strategies (LCS) within Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. In his role, Mr. Zable oversees the firm’s liquid credit activities, including CLO management, CLO investing, senior loans, multi-asset credit, investment grade and high yield bonds.

Prior to joining Blackstone Credit in 2007, Mr. Zable began his career at JP Morgan Securities Inc., where he focused on leveraged finance in New York and London. 

Mr. Zable received a BS from Cornell University and an MBA in Finance from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Alexander Zarzhevsky

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Alexander Zarzhevsky is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. He is also a senior U.S. credit research analyst involved with the ongoing analysis and evaluation of primary and secondary fixed income investments.

Mr. Zarzhevsky joined Blackstone in 2005 from RBC, where he was a Senior Associate with primary responsibility for research and analysis of investments within the collateralized debt portfolios. Previously, Mr. Zarzhevsky worked at Mizuho Corporate Bank, Ltd, where he was an Assistant Vice President within its leveraged finance group. At Mizuho, Mr. Zarzhevsky recommended investments across a wide range of industries on behalf of the bank’s three CDO funds, in addition to underwriting exposures for the bank.

Mr. Zarzhevsky received a B.S. in Business Administration with a concentration in Finance from Yeshiva University’s Sy Syms School of Business and is a CFA® Charterholder.

Michael Zawadzki

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Michael Zawadzki is the Global Chief Investment Officer for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York. Mr. Zawadzki serves as a Portfolio Manager for the Blackstone Private Credit Fund (BCRED), Blackstone Senior Direct Lending Fund (BXD), Blackstone Green Private Credit Fund III (BGREEN III), and Blackstone Multi-Asset Credit Fund (BMAC). 

Prior to joining Blackstone in 2006, Mr. Zawadzki was with Citigroup Private Equity. Before that, he worked in the investment banking division of Salomon Smith Barney.

Mr. Zawadzki received a BS in Economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Ivana Zecevic

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Ivana Zecevic is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Since joining Blackstone in 2013, Ms. Zecevic has been involved with investments in quantitative trading strategies across asset classes and fund maturities.

Ms. Zecevic received a A.B. in Applied Mathematics with a Secondary Field in Economics from Harvard University.

Hala Zeine

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - Munich (Regus)

Hala Zeine is a Managing Director in Portfolio Operations, where she is involved with Blackstone’s technology portfolio companies on accelerating growth and innovation as well as advising the firm’s investment teams in identifying and evaluating opportunities in the technology sector, with a particular focus on the European market.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Zeine served as Chief Product Officer for Celonis, a Germany-based global software firm. Prior to Celonis, Ms. Zeine spent almost two decades at SAP, working in corporate executive roles ranging from business development to leading their Digital Supply Chain product business.

Ms. Zeine holds a Bachelor of Applied Science (BASc) from Bentley University.

Liping Zhang

Sr. Managing Director

Greater China - Hong Kong

Liping Zhang is a Senior Managing Director and Chairman, Greater China of Blackstone.

Mr. Zhang has over 30 years of financial industry, corporate management and government sector experience. He commenced his career at China’s Ministry of Foreign Trade & Economic Cooperation in Beijing in the early eighties and held a number of senior positions at other organizations including Co-CEO, Greater China and Vice Chairman of the Global Investment Banking Department of Credit Suisse, Managing Director of Pacific Concord Group, Managing Director and Geographic Head – Greater China Region of Dresdner Banking Group and Director of Merrill Lynch Investment Banking Division.

Mr. Zhang graduated from Beijing University’s school of International Business & Economics and received a master’s degree in International Affairs and International Law from St. John’s University in New York. He also attended NYU Stern’s MBA program. He is currently a member of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Committee, Guangxi Autonomous Region, a member of the Board of Trustees of Beijing University of International Business and Economics, a member of the Hong Kong Trade Development Council Financial Services Advisory Committee and the Asian Financial Forum Steering Committee.

James Zhang

Managing Director

BXMA - Hong Kong

James Zhang is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2023, Mr. Zhang was a Managing Director at Goldman Sachs Asset Management where he was head of the Hong Kong & Taiwan Client Business. He was responsible for advising institutional clients on asset management solutions across the firm's private and public investing platforms, including alternative investments, equities, fixed income and liquidity management.

Mr. Zhang received a BA from the University of Notre Dame and is a CFA charterholder.

Frank Zhao

Managing Director

Real Estate - Shanghai

Frank Zhao is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group based in Shanghai. Since joining Blackstone in 2016, Mr. Zhao has focused on sourcing and executing real estate investments across China, including DragonCor Logistics Portfolio, Guangzhou R&F Logistics Park, Westlink and Aroma Garden.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. Zhao worked in Hong Kong as a Vice President at Proprium Capital Partners, where he was responsible for investments in Greater China. Prior to that, Mr. Zhao worked at Warburg Pincus and Morgan Stanley Investment Banking Division, focusing on the real estate sector.

Mr. Zhao graduated from the University of Hong Kong in 2008, where he received a Bachelor degree of Business Administration.

Stephen Zhu

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Stephen Zhu is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA).

Before joining Blackstone in 2019, Mr. Zhu was a Portfolio Manager at Axonic Capital for its hedge fund, long-only, and separately managed accounts focused on credit strategies globally. Prior to Axonic, Mr. Zhu was a Trader at Ellington Management Group focused on structured credit investments and portfolio management.

Mr. Zhu received a B.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and a B.S. in Biology from MIT and a M.S. in Computer Science from UCLA.

Mark Zhu

Managing Director

Private Equity - New York

Mark Zhu is a Managing Director in Blackstone’s Private Equity Group where he is focused on investment activity in the energy and energy transition sectors. Since joining Blackstone in 2015, Mr. Zhu has been involved with the firm’s investments in Sabre Industries, Power Grid Components, Onyx Renewables, Custom Truck One Source, Lightstone Generation, Guidon Energy, and Swallowtail Royalties.

Prior to joining Blackstone, Mr. Zhu worked at Bank of Montreal’s Energy and Infrastructure Group.

Mr. Zhu received a Bachelor of Business Administration from University of Guam and a Master of Management Studies from Duke University.

Joseph Zidle

Sr. Managing Director

Private Wealth Solutions - New York 601 Lex

Joe Zidle is a Senior Managing Director and the Chief Investment Strategist in the Private Wealth Solutions group. Previously, he worked at Richard Bernstein Advisors, an independent investment advisor, where he was responsible for portfolio strategy, asset allocation, investment management and marketing to major wealth management firms and independent RIAs. Zidle previously spent nearly a decade at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, most recently serving as Head of Investment Strategy for Global Wealth Management and Deputy Director of the Research Investment Committee, where he was responsible for creating and communicating global investment strategies to the firm's private client division across all major investment disciplines. Mr. Zidle holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Economics and History from Emory University. From 1993 to 2001, he served as a specialist in military intelligence for the U.S. Army Reserves.

Amanda Ziegler

Managing Director

Finance - New York 601 Lex

Amanda Ziegler is a Managing Director in the Real Estate Group. Ms. Ziegler is co-head of the firm’s Global Fund Finance Group. She is involved in the accounting, financial reporting and investor reporting for the Blackstone Real Estate opportunistic funds and investment entities.

Before joining Blackstone, Ms. Ziegler worked at Neuberger Berman as a Managing Director and Global Corporate Controller. Prior to Neuberger Berman, she worked at Och-Ziff Capital Management (currently known as Sculptor Capital) as the global head of Valuation and the head of fund accounting for the Private Equity and Real Estate funds. Prior to Sculptor Capital, she was a valuation consultant at PricewaterhouseCoopers and Duff and Phelps. Prior to those roles, she was an engineer at Lockheed Martin Aeronautics.

Ms. Ziegler received a BS in Mechanical Engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology and an MBA from Emory University. She is a Certified Public Accountant and a CFA charter holder.

Raphael de Botton

Sr. Managing Director

Tactical Opportunities - London

Raphael de Botton is a Senior Managing Director in the Tactical Opportunities group, based in London. Since joining Blackstone in 2006, Mr. de Botton has been involved in Blackstone's investments in Tangerine, TDC, Tragus, Versace, AAG, Clarion, JOA, Murka, Superbet, HH Global, Sipartech, Lazeo and SII Group.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. de Botton worked at Lazard in the Mergers and Acquisition division, in New York.

Mr. de Botton graduated from ESSEC Business School with a Master’s degree in Finance and from the French National Institute of Telecommunications with a Master's of Science. Mr. de Botton serves as a director of JOA, Murka, HH Global, Lazeo and SII Group.

Carlos de Mello

Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Carlos de Mello is a Managing Director in Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Mr. de Mello is focused on capital markets, including the leverage and financing of BXCI’s funds and investments.

Before joining Blackstone, Mr. de Mello worked in the Commodity Trade Finance group at Brown Brothers Harriman.

Mr. de Mello received a Bachelors of Art in Political Science from Trinity College in Hartford, CT.

Robert de Veer

Managing Director

BXMA - New York

Robert de Veer is a Managing Director in Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing.

Before joining Blackstone in 2024, Mr. De Veer served as Chief Risk Officer at AssuredIM (formerly BlueMountain Capital Management), a multi-strategy credit investment firm. Prior to AssuredIM, Mr. De Veer was a Vice President at The Carlyle Group from 2008 to 2017, where he focused on portfolio construction, investment analytics, and managed accounts across Carlyle’s Investment Solutions business.

Mr. De Veer received a MSc. In Quantitative Finance and Actuarial Sciences, a MSc. in Investment Analysis, a BSc. in Econometrics & OR, and a BSc. in International Business, all from Tilburg University in the Netherlands. Mr. De Veer is CFA, FRM, and CAIA charterholder.

Courtney della Cava

Sr. Managing Director

Portfolio Operations - San Francisco

Courtney della Cava is a Senior Managing Director and Global Head of Portfolio Talent & Organizational Performance. She leads a team that drives value creation by improving leadership and organizational effectiveness across the Blackstone portfolio.

Before joining Blackstone in 2021, Courtney served as a Partner at Bain & Company. With more than 20 years of global management consulting experience at Bain & Company in their Los Angeles, London and San Francisco offices, she served clients across multiple industry sectors. As a leader within their Talent and Leadership practice, Courtney most recently advised corporate and private equity clients on CEO and board effectiveness and organizational and talent solutions, and she also built and led several of the firm’s global human capital teams and client capabilities.  She also served as a Partner and Managing Director for Russell Reynolds Associates, a global executive search and talent assessment firm, and the European Marketing Director for M&M Mars. She spent the first chapter of her career at WPP.

Courtney earned an MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and graduated from The University of California, Los Angeles, with a B.A. in Economics. She currently serves on the boards of Mphasis and Renaissance.

Heather von Zuben

Sr. Managing Director

BXCI - New York

Heather von Zuben is Co-Chief Operating Officer for Blackstone Credit and Insurance (BXCI) based in New York.

Ms. von Zuben joined Blackstone in 2022 after 15 years at Goldman Sachs, where she held a range of leadership roles in business development across alternative investment solutions, most recently as the Global Head of Wealth Management Alternatives. Prior to that, she led private equity business development efforts for both private wealth and institutional clients as the Global Head of Private Equity Client Engagement and Product Strategy. She started her career as a legal associate at Davis Polk & Wardwell.

Ms. von Zuben received a BS from Georgetown University and a JD from Columbia Law School.
